recipes.description: Shanghai braised oversized pork meatballs simmered with napa cabbage in a savory broth.
instructions: Finely dice water chestnuts. Mix with pork, egg, cornstarch, soy sauce, shaoxing wine, minced ginger, sliced scallions, and white pepper.
Form into 4 large meatballs, about the size of a fist.
Heat oil in a clay pot or Dutch oven. Brown meatballs on all sides until golden.
Separate napa cabbage leaves and arrange around and under the meatballs.
Pour in chicken stock and dark soy sauce. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and braise for 40-45 minutes until meatballs are tender and cabbage is silky.
Serve in the pot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Red-Braised Pork Belly
recipes.description: Iconic Shanghai-style pork belly braised until meltingly tender in soy sauce, sugar, and shaoxing wine.
instructions: Cut pork belly into 3cm cubes. Blanch in boiling water for 3 minutes to remove impurities. Drain.
Heat a wok or heavy pot. Add sugar and cook on medium heat until it melts into a dark amber caramel.
Add pork belly pieces and stir to coat in caramel.
Add ginger slices, scallion segments, star anise, and cinnamon stick. Stir briefly.
Pour in shaoxing wine, soy sauces, and water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce to a gentle simmer, cover, and braise for 75-90 minutes until pork is meltingly tender.
Uncover, increase heat, and reduce sauce until thick and glossy. Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Scallion Oil Noodles
recipes.description: Simple yet deeply savory Shanghai noodles tossed in caramelized scallion oil and soy sauce.
instructions: Cut scallions into 5cm lengths, separating white and green parts.
Heat oil in a pan over low heat. Add all scallion pieces.
Slowly fry the scallions for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deeply golden and crispy.
Strain the scallion oil into a bowl. Reserve the crispy scallions.
Mix scallion oil with light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, and sugar.
Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain.
Toss hot noodles with the scallion oil sauce. Top with crispy scallions and serve.

recipes.name: Drunken Chicken
recipes.description: Cold Shanghai appetizer of poached chicken steeped in shaoxing wine and ginger broth.
instructions: Bring a pot of water with ginger slices and scallion to a boil. Add chicken and poach for 18 minutes.
Transfer chicken to an ice bath to stop cooking. Cool completely.
Mix chicken stock with shaoxing wine, salt, sugar, and goji berries.
Place chicken in a container and pour the wine broth over it.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, preferably overnight.
Remove chicken from brine, chop through the bone into pieces.
Arrange on a plate and spoon some of the wine broth over the top. Serve cold.

recipes.name: Peking Duck
recipes.description: Beijing's most famous dish featuring crispy lacquered duck skin served with thin pancakes, scallions, and hoisin sauce.
instructions: Clean the duck and separate skin from meat by inflating. Season cavity with five spice.
Pour boiling water over the duck to tighten the skin. Pat dry.
Mix maltose with rice vinegar and brush all over the duck. Air-dry uncovered in the refrigerator for 24 hours.
Preheat oven to 200C. Roast duck breast-side up on a rack for 40 minutes.
Reduce heat to 160C, flip, and roast another 30 minutes. Flip back and increase to 220C for final 10 minutes.
Rest for 15 minutes. Slice the crispy skin and meat separately.
Serve with warm Mandarin pancakes, hoisin sauce, julienned scallions, and cucumber strips.

recipes.name: Zhajiangmian (Beijing Fried Sauce Noodles)
recipes.description: Beijing-style wheat noodles topped with a savory fermented soybean paste sauce with pork and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Julienne cucumber and radish. Boil edamame until tender. Set all toppings aside.
Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add minced ginger and stir-fry 30 seconds.
Add ground pork, breaking it up. Cook until no longer pink.
Add sweet bean paste and soybean paste. Stir-fry for 3 minutes until fragrant and darkened.
Add shaoxing wine, sugar, and a splash of water. Simmer 5 minutes until thick.
Cook noodles, drain, and divide among bowls.
Top with the meat sauce and arrange cucumber, radish, edamame, and scallions around the bowl.

recipes.name: Lamb Hot Pot
recipes.description: Northern Chinese communal hot pot with thinly sliced lamb, vegetables, and tofu cooked in aromatic broth.
instructions: Prepare broth: bring 1.5L water to a boil with ginger, goji berries, and red dates. Simmer 15 minutes.
Arrange sliced lamb, cabbage, tofu, mushrooms, and glass noodles on separate plates.
Prepare dipping sauce: mix sesame paste, fermented tofu sauce, soy sauce, chili oil, and minced garlic.
Set the broth pot on a portable burner at the table.
Each diner cooks lamb slices and vegetables in the simmering broth for 30-60 seconds.
Dip cooked items into the sesame sauce before eating.
Add glass noodles near the end to soak up all the flavors from the enriched broth.

recipes.name: Jianbing (Chinese Crepe)
recipes.description: Popular Beijing street breakfast crepe with egg, crispy wonton, scallions, and savory sauces.
instructions: Mix mung bean flour and wheat flour with water to form a thin batter.
Heat a flat griddle or large non-stick pan. Brush with oil.
Pour batter and spread into a thin circle using a crepe spreader.
Once the surface sets, crack an egg on top and spread it evenly. Sprinkle scallions, cilantro, and sesame seeds.
Flip the crepe when the bottom is golden. Spread sweet bean paste and chili sauce on the egg side.
Place a wonton crisp in the center.
Fold the crepe over the crisp from both sides and the bottom. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Hunan Orange Chicken
recipes.description: Hunan-style crispy chicken pieces tossed in a tangy, spicy fresh orange sauce with dried chilies.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Toss with half the soy sauce and let sit 10 minutes.
Zest one orange and juice both oranges. Mix juice with remaining soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and 1 tbsp cornstarch.
Coat chicken pieces in beaten egg, then remaining cornstarch.
Deep-fry chicken in batches at 180C until golden and crispy, about 4 minutes.
In a clean wok, stir-fry dried chilies, garlic, and ginger for 30 seconds.
Add orange sauce mixture and cook until thickened.
Toss fried chicken in the sauce with orange zest and scallions. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chairman Mao's Red-Braised Pork
recipes.description: Hunan-style braised pork belly cooked in a bold sauce with chilies, soy, and rock sugar.
instructions: Cut pork belly into 3cm cubes. Blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and pat dry.
Heat oil in a heavy pot. Add rock sugar and melt on medium heat until amber.
Add pork belly and stir to coat in caramel. Cook until lightly browned.
Add ginger, garlic, dried and fresh chilies, and star anise. Stir-fry 1 minute.
Add shaoxing wine, soy sauces, and enough water to just cover the pork.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and braise for 60-70 minutes until very tender.
Uncover and reduce sauce on high heat until thick and glossy. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Steamed Fish Head with Chopped Chilies
recipes.description: Hunan specialty of a large fish head smothered in fermented chopped chilies and steamed until succulent.
instructions: Split fish head in half and clean thoroughly. Rub with shaoxing wine, soy sauce, and white pepper.
Place fish head cut-side up on a heatproof plate. Lay ginger slices underneath.
Spread chopped chilies generously over the top of the fish head.
Scatter minced garlic and sugar over the chilies.
Steam over high heat for 12-15 minutes until fish is cooked through.
Heat vegetable oil until smoking and pour over the fish head.
Garnish with sliced scallions and serve with rice to balance the heat.

recipes.name: Egg Fried Rice
recipes.description: The quintessential Chinese fried rice with eggs, scallions, and day-old rice cooked over high wok heat.
instructions: Break apart cold rice with your hands, ensuring no clumps.
Beat eggs with a pinch of salt.
Heat wok over highest heat until smoking. Add oil and swirl to coat.
Pour in eggs, scramble quickly for 15 seconds until just set but still moist.
Immediately add rice, pressing it against the wok. Toss vigorously for 2 minutes.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and white pepper while tossing.
Add sliced scallions, toss a few more times, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Yangzhou Fried Rice
recipes.description: The classic Chinese fried rice with shrimp, char siu, peas, and egg in a well-seasoned wok.
instructions: Dice char siu, carrots, and devein shrimp. Break apart cold rice.
Heat wok over high heat. Add oil, stir-fry shrimp until pink. Remove.
Scramble eggs in the same wok until just set. Add rice and toss vigorously.
Add diced carrots and peas. Continue tossing for 2 minutes.
Return shrimp to wok. Add char siu.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and white pepper. Toss to combine.
Finish with sesame oil and sliced scallions. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chow Mein
recipes.description: Stir-fried egg noodles with vegetables and a savory sauce, achieving a mix of crispy and tender textures.
instructions: Cook noodles until just al dente. Drain, toss with a little oil to prevent sticking.
Julienne cabbage and carrots. Slice scallions into 3cm lengths.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add noodles in a flat layer and let one side get crispy, about 2 minutes.
Flip the noodle cake and crisp the other side.
Break noodles apart, add carrots and cabbage. Stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add soy sauce, dark soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Toss to coat evenly.
Add bean sprouts and scallions, toss for 30 seconds. Drizzle with sesame oil and serve.

recipes.name: Spring Rolls
recipes.description: Crispy deep-fried rolls filled with seasoned vegetables and glass noodles, a classic Chinese appetizer.
instructions: Soak mushrooms and glass noodles separately in hot water. Drain, chop mushrooms, and cut noodles.
Julienne cabbage, carrots, and bamboo shoots.
Stir-fry all vegetables with soy sauce and sesame oil over high heat for 3 minutes. Add noodles. Season with white pepper. Cool completely.
Place a spring roll wrapper diamond-wise. Add 2 tbsp filling near the bottom corner.
Fold bottom corner over filling, fold in sides, and roll tightly. Seal edge with cornstarch paste.
Heat oil to 170C. Fry spring rolls in batches for 3-4 minutes until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet chili sauce.

recipes.name: Egg Drop Soup
recipes.description: Light and comforting Chinese soup with silky egg ribbons in a seasoned chicken broth.
instructions: Bring chicken stock to a boil with ginger slices.
Season with salt and white pepper.
Mix cornstarch with 2 tbsp water. Stir into the soup to thicken slightly.
Beat eggs well in a bowl.
Reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Slowly pour beaten eggs in a thin stream while stirring in one direction.
Remove from heat once egg ribbons have formed, about 30 seconds.
Drizzle with sesame oil and garnish with sliced scallions. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Pork
recipes.description: Crispy battered pork pieces tossed in a tangy, bright red sweet and sour sauce with peppers and pineapple.
instructions: Cut pork into 2cm cubes. Season with soy sauce and let sit 10 minutes.
Coat pork in beaten egg, then cornstarch. Double-coat for extra crispiness.
Deep-fry pork at 170C until golden, about 4 minutes. Drain and rest. Re-fry at 190C for 1 minute.
Cut peppers and onion into chunks similar in size to pork.
In a clean wok, combine ketchup, vinegar, sugar, and 3 tbsp water. Bring to a boil.
Add peppers, onion, and pineapple. Stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add fried pork and toss quickly to coat. Serve immediately while crispy.

recipes.name: General Tso's Chicken
recipes.description: Crispy fried chicken chunks in a sweet, tangy, and slightly spicy sauce with dried chilies.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Marinate with 1 tbsp soy sauce and shaoxing wine for 10 minutes.
Coat chicken in beaten egg, then cornstarch.
Deep-fry at 180C until golden and crispy, about 4 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Mix remaining soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, sugar, and 2 tbsp water for the sauce.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a clean wok. Toast dried chilies until darkened. Add garlic and ginger.
Pour in sauce and bring to a boil until slightly thickened.
Add fried chicken and toss to coat. Garnish with scallions and sesame seeds.

recipes.name: Sesame Chicken
recipes.description: Tender chicken pieces in a sweet and savory glaze finished with toasted sesame seeds.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Season with 1 tbsp soy sauce.
Coat in beaten egg and cornstarch.
Deep-fry at 180C until golden and cooked through, about 4 minutes. Drain.
In a clean pan, combine remaining soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, minced garlic, and ginger.
Bring sauce to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened, about 2 minutes.
Add fried chicken and toss to coat evenly in the glaze.
Transfer to a plate, sprinkle generously with sesame seeds and sliced scallions.

recipes.name: Mongolian Beef
recipes.description: Tender sliced beef stir-fried with scallions in a sweet soy and ginger sauce.
instructions: Slice flank steak against the grain into thin strips. Toss with cornstarch until evenly coated.
Cut scallions into 5cm lengths.
Heat oil in a wok until very hot. Sear beef strips in batches until crispy edges form. Remove.
In the same wok, add ginger, garlic, and dried chilies. Stir-fry 30 seconds.
Add soy sauces, brown sugar, and 2 tbsp water. Bring to a boil.
Return beef to wok and toss to coat in the sauce.
Add scallions, toss for 30 seconds just until wilted, and serve over rice.

recipes.name: Beef and Broccoli
recipes.description: Classic stir-fry of tender beef slices and crisp broccoli in a savory oyster sauce.
instructions: Slice beef against the grain into thin strips. Marinate with soy sauce, shaoxing wine, and 1 tbsp cornstarch for 15 minutes.
Blanch broccoli in boiling salted water for 1 minute. Drain and set aside.
Mix oyster sauce, remaining cornstarch, sugar, and 3 tbsp water for the sauce.
Heat oil in a wok until smoking. Sear beef quickly for 1-2 minutes until browned. Remove.
Add garlic and ginger to the wok, stir-fry 30 seconds.
Return beef and add broccoli. Pour in sauce and toss until everything is coated and sauce thickens.
Finish with sesame oil and serve immediately over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Ma La Xiang Guo (Numbing Spicy Stir-Fry Pot)
recipes.description: Sichuan dry stir-fry with customizable meats, vegetables, and a bold numbing-spicy sauce.
instructions: Prepare all ingredients: slice lotus root, tear mushrooms, cut cabbage, cube tofu.
Blanch lotus root, mushrooms, cabbage, and tofu separately in boiling water. Drain.
Heat oil in a large wok. Toast dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns until fragrant.
Add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. Stir-fry until oil turns red.
Add beef and shrimp, stir-fry on high heat until nearly cooked.
Add all blanched vegetables and tofu. Toss vigorously over high heat for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle cumin seeds, drizzle sesame oil, toss once more and serve in a hot bowl.

recipes.name: Hot Pot Broth (Sichuan Spicy Base)
recipes.description: Fiery, rich Sichuan hot pot broth made with beef tallow, doubanjiang, and a symphony of spices.
instructions: Melt beef tallow in a large pot over medium heat.
Add doubanjiang and stir-fry for 3 minutes until oil turns deep red and fragrant.
Add all dried spices: chilies, Sichuan peppercorns, star anise, cassia bark, bay leaves, and fennel seeds. Toast 2 minutes.
Add smashed ginger, garlic, and scallion sections. Cook another 2 minutes.
Pour in chicken stock and add rock sugar. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes to develop flavor.
Strain if desired, or leave spices in for presentation. Use as a base for hot pot.

recipes.name: Scallion Pancakes
recipes.description: Flaky, crispy, and chewy pan-fried flatbread with layers of fragrant scallions.
instructions: Mix flour with boiling water, then add cold water. Knead into a smooth dough. Rest 30 minutes.
Finely slice scallions and mix with salt, white pepper, and five spice powder.
Divide dough into 4 portions. Roll each into a thin rectangle.
Brush with sesame oil, sprinkle scallion mixture evenly over the surface.
Roll up tightly into a log, then coil into a spiral. Flatten and roll out into a round disc.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Cook each pancake for 3 minutes per side until golden and flaky.
Cut into wedges and serve with soy-vinegar dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Baozi (Steamed Pork Buns)
recipes.description: Soft, fluffy steamed buns filled with savory seasoned pork and aromatics.
instructions: Mix flour, yeast, sugar, and warm water. Knead 10 minutes until smooth. Cover and let rise 1 hour.
Finely chop cabbage, salt it, and squeeze out excess water.
Mix pork with cabbage, minced ginger, scallions, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper.
Punch down dough and divide into 16 pieces.
Roll each piece into a circle thicker in the center. Place filling in the center and pleat to seal.
Place buns on parchment squares in steamer baskets, leaving space. Let rest 15 minutes.
Steam over high heat for 15 minutes. Turn off heat and wait 3 minutes before opening lid.

recipes.name: Jiaozi (Chinese Dumplings)
recipes.description: Hand-wrapped dumplings filled with pork and chives, pan-fried or boiled, a staple of Chinese New Year.
instructions: Mix flour and water, knead into a smooth dough. Rest covered for 30 minutes.
Finely chop chives. Mix with pork, grated ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, shaoxing wine, salt, and white pepper.
Roll dough into a log and cut into 30 pieces. Roll each into a thin circle.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center. Fold and pleat to seal into a crescent shape.
To boil: cook in boiling water, adding cold water twice when it returns to a boil. Done when dumplings float.
To pan-fry: brown bottoms in oiled pan, add 80ml water, cover and steam 5 minutes until crispy.
Serve with a dipping sauce of Chinkiang vinegar, soy sauce, chili oil, and minced garlic.

recipes.name: Tea Eggs
recipes.description: Hard-boiled eggs steeped in a fragrant tea and spice brine, creating beautiful marbled patterns.
instructions: Place eggs in a pot, cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook for 8 minutes.
Transfer eggs to cold water. Gently tap each egg all over with a spoon to crack the shell without removing it.
In a pot, combine water, soy sauces, tea bags, star anise, cinnamon, Sichuan peppercorns, sugar, and salt. Bring to a boil.
Add the cracked eggs to the spiced tea liquid.
Reduce heat to very low and simmer for 2 hours, adding water if needed.
Turn off heat and let eggs steep for at least 4 hours, ideally overnight.
Peel to reveal the beautiful marbled pattern. Serve at room temperature or cold.

recipes.name: Tomato Egg Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A beloved Chinese home-style dish of scrambled eggs and juicy tomatoes in a simple sweet-savory sauce.
instructions: Score tomatoes and blanch in boiling water for 30 seconds. Peel and cut into wedges.
Beat eggs with a pinch of salt.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a wok over high heat. Pour in eggs and scramble until just set but still soft. Remove.
Add remaining oil to wok. Stir-fry tomatoes on high heat until they soften and release juices.
Add sugar, salt, and ketchup. Cook until tomatoes form a saucy consistency.
Return scrambled eggs, breaking them into large pieces. Gently fold together.
Garnish with sliced scallions and serve over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Green Beans
recipes.description: Blistered green beans dry-fried until wrinkled and tender, tossed with ground pork and garlic.
instructions: Trim green beans and cut into 5cm pieces. Pat dry thoroughly.
Heat oil in a wok until smoking. Add green beans and fry without stirring for 2 minutes until blistered.
Stir-fry beans until tender-crisp, about 3 more minutes. Remove.
In the same wok, add pork, dried chilies, and Sichuan peppercorns. Stir-fry until pork is browned.
Add garlic and ya cai, cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return beans to wok. Add soy sauce and sugar, toss to combine.
Serve immediately as a side dish with rice.

recipes.name: Garlic Bok Choy
recipes.description: Tender baby bok choy quickly stir-fried with garlic and a light soy-based sauce.
instructions: Wash bok choy thoroughly and halve lengthwise. Pat dry.
Mince garlic finely.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat until smoking.
Add garlic and stir-fry for 15 seconds until fragrant but not burned.
Add bok choy and toss vigorously for 2 minutes.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar. Toss for another minute until bok choy is tender-crisp.
Drizzle with sesame oil and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chinese Eggplant with Garlic Sauce
recipes.description: Silky braised eggplant in a savory-sweet garlic sauce, a popular home-style dish.
instructions: Cut eggplant into diagonal chunks.
Mix soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, cornstarch, and 3 tbsp water for the sauce.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add eggplant and stir-fry for 4 minutes until softened.
Push eggplant aside, add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Pour sauce mixture over the eggplant. Toss and cook until sauce thickens and eggplant is silky.
Finish with sesame oil and sliced scallions.
Serve over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Tang Yuan (Glutinous Rice Balls)
recipes.description: Chewy glutinous rice dumplings filled with sweet black sesame paste, served in warm ginger syrup.
instructions: Mix glutinous rice flour with warm water and knead into a smooth, pliable dough.
Roll black sesame paste into small balls about 1cm in diameter. Freeze for 15 minutes.
Divide dough into 16 pieces. Flatten each, place sesame ball in center, seal and roll smooth.
Make ginger syrup: boil water with sliced ginger and brown sugar for 10 minutes.
Bring a separate pot of water to a boil. Add tang yuan and cook until they float, about 3-4 minutes.
Transfer cooked tang yuan to the ginger syrup.
Serve warm, garnished with goji berries.

recipes.name: Mooncake (Traditional Lotus Paste)
recipes.description: Intricately molded pastry filled with sweet lotus seed paste and salted egg yolk, eaten during Mid-Autumn Festival.
instructions: Mix golden syrup, oil, and lye water. Add flour and mix until a soft dough forms. Rest for 2 hours.
Bake salted duck egg yolks at 180C for 5 minutes. Let cool.
Divide lotus paste into 8 portions. Wrap each around a salted egg yolk.
Divide dough into 8 portions. Flatten each piece and wrap around the lotus paste ball, sealing completely.
Press into a mooncake mold, compact firmly, and tap out onto a lined baking sheet.
Bake at 180C for 10 minutes. Remove, cool 10 minutes, brush with egg wash.
Return to oven and bake 12-15 more minutes until golden. Cool completely. Store 2-3 days before eating.

recipes.name: Egg Tart (Dan Tat)
recipes.description: Cantonese-style flaky pastry tart filled with smooth, silky sweet egg custard.
instructions: Make pastry: mix flour, cold cubed butter, powdered sugar, and egg yolk until a dough forms. Refrigerate 30 minutes.
Dissolve sugar in hot water. Cool slightly, then mix with milk, beaten eggs, and vanilla.
Strain custard mixture through a fine sieve twice for silky smoothness.
Press small portions of pastry dough into tart molds, creating an even thin shell.
Pour custard filling into each shell, filling about 80% full.
Bake at 200C for 18-20 minutes until custard is set with slight wobble and pastry is golden.
Cool in molds for 5 minutes before removing. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Red Bean Soup
recipes.description: Sweet Cantonese dessert soup of slow-simmered red beans with dried tangerine peel and lotus seeds.
instructions: Soak red beans overnight or for at least 4 hours. Drain.
Soak dried tangerine peel in warm water for 20 minutes. Scrape off white pith.
Bring water to a boil in a pot. Add beans, lotus seeds, and tangerine peel.
Return to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 60-75 minutes until beans are very soft.
Add rock sugar and stir until dissolved. Continue simmering for another 10 minutes.
For a smoother soup, mash some of the beans against the side of the pot.
Serve hot in bowls. Can also be served cold in summer.

recipes.name: Sesame Balls (Jian Dui)
recipes.description: Crispy deep-fried glutinous rice balls coated in sesame seeds with sweet red bean paste filling.
instructions: Mix glutinous rice flour with sugar and warm water. Knead into a smooth dough.
Divide red bean paste into 12 small balls.
Divide dough into 12 portions. Flatten each, place a bean paste ball in the center, and seal. Roll smooth.
Lightly wet the surface of each ball and roll in sesame seeds, pressing gently to adhere.
Heat oil to 150C. Gently add sesame balls and fry on low heat.
Gently press the balls with a slotted spoon as they fry to encourage puffing. Fry for 10-12 minutes until golden.
Drain on paper towels. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Mango Pudding
recipes.description: Silky, creamy Cantonese mango pudding made with fresh mangoes and set with gelatin.
instructions: Soak gelatin sheets in cold water for 5 minutes until soft.
Peel mangoes and blend the flesh until smooth. Reserve a few cubes for garnish.
Dissolve sugar in hot water. Squeeze excess water from gelatin and stir into the hot sugar water.
Combine mango puree, coconut milk, and evaporated milk. Stir in the gelatin mixture.
Pour into individual molds or ramekins.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours until firmly set.
Unmold onto plates, garnish with fresh mango cubes and a drizzle of coconut milk.

recipes.name: Vegetable Fried Rice
recipes.description: Quick and colorful fried rice loaded with mixed vegetables, perfect for using leftover rice.
instructions: Dice carrots into small cubes. Slice scallions, separating whites and greens.
Break apart cold rice to remove clumps.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat until smoking.
Add garlic and scallion whites. Stir-fry 15 seconds.
Add carrots, peas, and corn. Stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add rice, pressing against the wok. Toss vigorously for 2 minutes.
Season with soy sauce and white pepper. Add scallion greens and sesame oil. Toss and serve.

recipes.name: Shrimp Fried Rice
recipes.description: Wok-fried rice with plump shrimp, egg, and scallions, a seafood twist on the classic.
instructions: Devein shrimp and pat dry. Season with shaoxing wine and a pinch of salt.
Break apart cold rice. Beat eggs lightly.
Heat wok over high heat. Add 1 tbsp oil, sear shrimp until pink. Remove.
Add remaining oil. Pour in eggs, scramble briefly, then add rice immediately.
Toss rice vigorously over high heat for 2 minutes, breaking up egg pieces.
Add peas, soy sauce, and white pepper. Continue tossing.
Return shrimp to wok, add scallions and sesame oil. Toss and serve hot.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Shrimp
recipes.description: A seafood variation of the Sichuan classic with shrimp, peanuts, and dried chilies.
instructions: Devein and pat dry shrimp. Toss with shaoxing wine and a pinch of cornstarch.
Mix soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and remaining cornstarch with 1 tbsp water for the sauce.
Heat wok over high heat, add oil. Stir-fry shrimp until just pink, about 1 minute. Remove.
Toast dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns in the wok for 30 seconds.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry 15 seconds.
Return shrimp, pour in sauce. Toss until sauce coats shrimp and thickens.
Add peanuts and scallions. Toss once and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Mapo Eggplant
recipes.description: Tender eggplant in a spicy, savory Sichuan-style sauce inspired by mapo tofu.
instructions: Cut eggplant into rolling-cut chunks.
Heat oil in a wok. Fry eggplant until softened and golden, about 5 minutes. Remove.
In the same wok, add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Add soy sauce, sugar, and vegetable stock. Bring to a simmer.
Return eggplant and cook for 5 minutes until tender and sauce is absorbed.
Thicken with cornstarch slurry if needed. Sprinkle Sichuan peppercorn powder.
Garnish with scallions and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Chinese Braised Mushrooms with Bok Choy
recipes.description: Plump shiitake mushrooms braised in oyster sauce served on a bed of tender bok choy.
instructions: Soak shiitake mushrooms in hot water for 30 minutes. Reserve 200ml soaking liquid.
Blanch bok choy in boiling water with a drop of oil for 1 minute. Drain and arrange on a plate.
Heat oil in a wok. Add garlic and mushrooms, stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add mushroom soaking liquid, oyster sauce, soy sauces, and sugar. Bring to a simmer.
Braise mushrooms for 15 minutes until liquid reduces by half.
Thicken with cornstarch slurry. Finish with sesame oil.
Arrange mushrooms over bok choy and drizzle with the glossy sauce.

recipes.name: Cumin Lamb
recipes.description: Northwestern Chinese stir-fry of tender lamb with cumin, chili flakes, and onions.
instructions: Slice lamb thinly against the grain. Marinate with soy sauce, shaoxing wine, and cornstarch for 10 minutes.
Slice onion into wedges. Toast cumin seeds in a dry wok until fragrant.
Heat oil in wok over high heat until smoking. Sear lamb slices quickly for 1-2 minutes.
Add onion and garlic. Stir-fry 1 minute.
Add toasted cumin seeds, ground cumin, and chili flakes. Toss vigorously.
Add scallion segments and toss a few more times.
Transfer to a plate and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chinese Corn Soup
recipes.description: Creamy, comforting Chinese-style corn soup thickened with egg ribbons and silky chicken.
instructions: Finely mince or shred chicken breast.
Bring chicken stock to a boil. Add creamed corn and corn kernels.
Add chicken and stir to break apart. Simmer 5 minutes.
Season with salt and white pepper.
Mix cornstarch with 2 tbsp water. Stir into soup to thicken.
Beat egg and drizzle slowly into the simmering soup while stirring.
Serve hot with sesame oil and sliced scallions.

recipes.name: Wontons in Chili Oil (Hong You Chao Shou)
recipes.description: Sichuan-style wontons drenched in a spicy, numbing chili oil sauce with garlic and soy.
instructions: Mix ground pork with minced ginger, 1 tsp soy sauce, and sesame oil for the filling.
Place a teaspoon of filling on each wrapper. Fold and seal into your preferred wonton shape.
Make the sauce: combine chili oil, remaining soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, sugar, and Sichuan peppercorn powder.
Boil wontons in water for 3-4 minutes until they float and wrappers are translucent.
Transfer wontons with a slotted spoon directly into the sauce bowl.
Toss gently to coat wontons in the chili oil sauce.
Top with crushed peanuts, sliced scallions, and extra chili oil to taste.

recipes.name: Ma Jiang Mian (Sesame Noodles)
recipes.description: Cold noodles tossed in a rich sesame sauce, a popular Chinese summer dish.
instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water.
Whisk sesame paste with soy sauce, vinegar, chili oil, sugar, and minced garlic. Thin with noodle cooking water.
Julienne cucumber into thin matchsticks.
Toss cold noodles with the sesame sauce until evenly coated.
Top with cucumber strips and sliced scallions.
Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.
Mix everything together before eating. Adjust sauce to taste.

recipes.name: Suan La Fen (Hot and Sour Glass Noodles)
recipes.description: Chongqing street food of slippery sweet potato noodles in a hot, sour, and numbing broth.
instructions: Soak glass noodles in hot water for 10 minutes until softened. Drain.
Prepare the sauce in a serving bowl: combine chili oil, soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, sugar, and Sichuan peppercorn powder.
Heat vegetable stock until boiling.
Cook softened noodles in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain.
Place noodles in the sauce bowl, pour hot stock over the top.
Top with preserved mustard greens and crushed peanuts.
Garnish with sliced scallions and extra chili oil. Stir well before eating.

recipes.name: Zongzi (Sticky Rice Dumplings)
recipes.description: Glutinous rice parcels wrapped in bamboo leaves and stuffed with pork and mushrooms, a Dragon Boat Festival tradition.
instructions: Soak glutinous rice for at least 6 hours. Soak bamboo leaves in hot water for 2 hours.
Cut pork belly into chunks. Marinate with soy sauce, dark soy sauce, five spice, white pepper, and shaoxing wine for at least 2 hours.
Soak mushrooms, drain and quarter. Soak dried shrimp.
Overlap two bamboo leaves and fold into a cone. Add rice, then pork, mushroom, shrimp, and half a salted egg yolk.
Top with more rice. Fold leaves over to seal and tie securely with twine.
Place zongzi in a large pot of boiling water. Boil for 3 hours, keeping them submerged.
Remove and let cool slightly before unwrapping. Serve with soy sauce.

recipes.name: Chinese Braised Beef Noodle Soup
recipes.description: Rich, aromatic beef broth with tender braised beef shank, chewy noodles, and bok choy.
instructions: Cut beef shank into large chunks. Blanch in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse.
Heat oil in a large pot. Add doubanjiang, ginger, garlic, and scallions. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Add beef and sear on all sides. Deglaze with shaoxing wine.
Add soy sauces, star anise, cinnamon, rock sugar, and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 2 hours until beef is very tender.
Cook noodles and blanch bok choy separately.
Divide noodles among bowls, slice beef and place on top. Ladle broth over and add bok choy.

recipes.name: Cashew Chicken
recipes.description: Quick stir-fry of tender chicken with roasted cashews and vegetables in a light savory sauce.
instructions: Dice chicken into 2cm cubes. Marinate with 1 tbsp soy sauce, shaoxing wine, and cornstarch for 10 minutes.
Cut bell pepper and celery into similar-sized pieces.
Mix remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce, and 2 tbsp water for the sauce.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Stir-fry chicken until golden, about 3 minutes. Remove.
Stir-fry garlic, ginger, bell pepper, and celery for 2 minutes.
Return chicken, add sauce, and toss until thickened.
Add cashews and sesame oil. Toss once and serve over rice.

recipes.name: Char Kway Teow (Chinese-Style)
recipes.description: Smoky wok-fried flat rice noodles with shrimp, Chinese sausage, bean sprouts, and chives.
instructions: Separate rice noodles gently. Slice sausage thinly and cut chives into 5cm lengths.
Heat wok over highest heat until smoking. Add 1 tbsp oil, sear shrimp until pink. Remove.
Add remaining oil. Crack eggs in and scramble briefly.
Add garlic and sausage, stir-fry 30 seconds.
Add noodles, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Toss carefully.
Add bean sprouts, chives, chili paste, and return shrimp. Toss for 1 minute.
The key is intense heat for smoky wok hei flavor. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Sichuan Dry-Fried Chicken (La Zi Ji)
recipes.description: Fiery mountain of crispy chicken pieces buried under a heap of dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns.
instructions: Chop chicken into small bite-sized pieces through the bone. Marinate with soy sauce and shaoxing wine for 15 minutes.
Coat chicken pieces in cornstarch.
Deep-fry in batches at 180C until golden and very crispy, about 5 minutes. Drain.
Snip dried chilies in half and shake out most seeds.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a clean wok. Add chilies and Sichuan peppercorns, stir-fry until chilies darken.
Add garlic, ginger, fried chicken, and sugar. Toss over high heat for 1 minute.
Finish with scallions and sesame seeds. Serve in a heap with the chilies as garnish.

recipes.name: Cantonese Steamed Spare Ribs with Black Beans
recipes.description: Tender pork spare ribs steamed with fermented black beans, garlic, and chili, a dim sum favorite.
instructions: Ask butcher to cut spare ribs into 3cm pieces through the bone. Rinse and pat dry.
Rinse fermented black beans briefly and roughly chop. Mince garlic and ginger. Slice chili.
Marinate ribs with soy sauce, shaoxing wine, cornstarch, sugar, sesame oil, and vegetable oil for 15 minutes.
Add chopped black beans, garlic, and ginger to the ribs. Toss to combine.
Spread ribs in a single layer on a heatproof plate.
Top with sliced red chili for color.
Steam over high heat for 18-20 minutes until ribs are tender and cooked through. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
recipes.description: Classic French braised chicken slowly cooked in red Burgundy wine with mushrooms, pearl onions, and lardons. A rustic dish from the Burgundy region.
instructions: Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper, then brown them in butter in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Remove and set aside.
Cook the lardons in the same pot until crispy, then sauté the pearl onions, carrots, and garlic until lightly browned.
Add the tomato paste and cook for one minute, then pour in the red wine and chicken stock, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom.
Return the chicken to the pot, add thyme and bay leaves, bring to a simmer, cover, and cook on low heat for 90 minutes.
Sauté the mushrooms separately in butter until golden, then add them to the pot during the last 15 minutes of cooking.
Remove the chicken and vegetables, then reduce the sauce over high heat until it coats the back of a spoon.
Return everything to the pot, adjust seasoning, and serve hot with crusty bread or mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
recipes.description: Hearty Burgundian beef stew braised in red wine with carrots, pearl onions, mushrooms, and lardons. Popularized worldwide by Julia Child.
instructions: Cut the beef into large cubes, pat dry, season with salt and pepper, and brown in batches in a Dutch oven with butter over high heat. Set aside.
Cook the lardons until crispy, then sauté the carrots, pearl onions, and garlic until softened.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir for one minute, then add the tomato paste.
Deglaze with red wine, add beef stock, thyme, and bay leaves, then return the beef to the pot.
Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook in a 160C oven for 2.5 hours until the beef is fork-tender.
Sauté mushrooms in butter and add to the stew during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs, adjust seasoning, and serve over egg noodles or with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Duck Confit
recipes.description: Tender duck legs cured in salt and herbs, then slowly poached in their own fat until meltingly soft. A celebrated preserve from Gascony in southwest France.
instructions: Rub the duck legs generously with coarse salt, crushed garlic, thyme, crushed juniper berries, and peppercorns. Refrigerate uncovered for 24 to 36 hours.
Rinse the duck legs thoroughly under cold water and pat completely dry with paper towels.
Place the duck legs in a single layer in a heavy ovenproof pot, cover completely with melted duck fat, and add bay leaves.
Cook in a 130C oven for 3 hours, until the meat is very tender and pulls easily from the bone.
Remove the legs from the fat and let them rest. Strain and reserve the cooking fat.
To serve, sear the confit legs skin-side down in a hot skillet until the skin is deeply golden and crispy.
Serve with sautéed potatoes and a simple green salad dressed with walnut oil vinaigrette.

recipes.name: Cassoulet
recipes.description: Rich and hearty slow-baked casserole of white beans with duck confit, Toulouse sausages, and pork. A legendary winter dish from the Languedoc region.
instructions: Soak the haricot beans overnight in cold water, then drain and rinse.
Cut the pork belly into chunks and brown in duck fat in a large Dutch oven. Remove and set aside.
Brown the Toulouse sausages in the same pot, then remove and slice into thick rounds.
Sauté onions, carrots, and garlic in the remaining fat until softened, then add tomatoes, stock, herbs, and the drained beans.
Simmer for 1 hour until the beans are almost tender, then layer the beans with the pork belly, sausage, and duck confit in a deep casserole dish.
Top with breadcrumbs, drizzle with duck fat, and bake at 150C for 2 hours, breaking the crust and pressing it down every 30 minutes to form new layers.
The cassoulet is ready when the top is deeply golden and the beans are creamy and rich. Let it rest for 15 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Blanquette de Veau
recipes.description: Delicate French veal stew in a silky white cream sauce with mushrooms and pearl onions. A refined comfort dish that is the essence of French home cooking.
instructions: Cut the veal into large cubes and place in a large pot. Cover with cold water, bring to a boil, then drain and rinse the meat to remove impurities.
Return the veal to the pot with fresh water, add carrots, leek, bouquet garni, and pearl onions. Simmer gently for 1.5 hours until the veal is tender.
Remove the meat and vegetables, strain the broth, and reserve about 600ml of the cooking liquid.
Make a roux by melting butter and whisking in flour, cooking for 2 minutes without browning. Gradually whisk in the reserved broth to make a smooth velouté.
Sauté the mushrooms in a little butter with a squeeze of lemon juice to keep them white.
Whisk together the egg yolks and cream, then temper by adding a ladleful of hot sauce. Stir back into the pot off heat to create the liaison.
Return the veal, vegetables, and mushrooms to the sauce. Gently reheat without boiling, season with salt, white pepper, and lemon juice, and serve over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Steak Frites
recipes.description: The quintessential French bistro dish: a perfectly pan-seared steak served with crispy golden frites and a classic béarnaise or herb butter.
instructions: Peel the potatoes, cut into 1cm thick batons, rinse in cold water, and dry thoroughly. Fry at 150C for 7 minutes to blanch, then drain and rest.
Season the steaks generously with fleur de sel and cracked black pepper. Let them come to room temperature.
Heat a cast-iron skillet to very hot, add a thin layer of oil, and sear the steaks for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Add butter, crushed garlic, and thyme to the pan and baste the steaks with the foaming butter for one minute.
Rest the steaks on a warm plate, loosely tented with foil, for 5 minutes.
Fry the potatoes a second time at 190C until deeply golden and crispy, about 3 minutes. Drain and season with fleur de sel.
Serve the steak alongside the frites, drizzled with pan juices and sprinkled with chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Ratatouille
recipes.description: A vibrant Provençal vegetable stew of tomatoes, eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers gently simmered with herbs de Provence. A celebration of summer produce.
instructions: Dice the eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers into roughly equal-sized cubes. Dice the tomatoes and onion separately.
Heat olive oil in a large heavy pot and sauté the onion and garlic until softened and fragrant.
Add the eggplant and cook for 5 minutes, then add the bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add the zucchini and tomatoes along with herbes de Provence, salt, and pepper. Stir gently to combine.
Cover and simmer on low heat for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until all vegetables are tender but still hold their shape.
Adjust seasoning, tear fresh basil over the top, and drizzle with a little extra olive oil before serving.

recipes.name: Quiche Lorraine
recipes.description: Buttery shortcrust pastry filled with a rich custard of eggs, cream, and smoky lardons. The original quiche from the Lorraine region of northeastern France.
instructions: Make the pastry by rubbing cold butter into flour until it resembles breadcrumbs, then add cold water and bring together into a dough. Wrap and chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out the pastry and line a 25cm tart tin. Prick the base with a fork, line with baking paper and beans, and blind bake at 190C for 15 minutes.
Cook the lardons in a dry pan until golden and crispy, then drain on paper towels.
Whisk together eggs, cream, milk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Scatter the lardons and half the Gruyère over the pastry base, pour in the custard, and top with the remaining cheese.
Bake at 180C for 30-35 minutes until the filling is set with a gentle wobble in the center and golden on top.
Let the quiche cool for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Croque Monsieur
recipes.description: Classic French grilled sandwich of ham and Gruyère with a luscious Mornay sauce. A staple of Parisian cafés since the early 1900s.
instructions: Make a béchamel by melting butter, whisking in flour, cooking for one minute, then gradually adding milk while stirring until smooth and thick.
Remove from heat, stir in half the grated Gruyère, nutmeg, and salt to make a Mornay sauce.
Spread Dijon mustard on two slices of bread, layer with ham, and top with the other bread slices.
Spread a generous layer of Mornay sauce over the top and sides of each sandwich, then cover with the remaining grated Gruyère.
Place on a baking sheet and bake at 200C for 10 minutes, then broil for 2-3 minutes until the cheese is bubbling and golden brown.
Serve immediately while the cheese is still melting and the bread is crispy.

recipes.name: French Onion Soup
recipes.description: Deeply caramelized onion soup enriched with beef broth, finished with a crusty crouton and a thick cap of melted Gruyère. The ultimate Parisian comfort food.
instructions: Slice all the onions thinly and evenly. Melt butter in a large heavy pot over medium heat and add the onions with a pinch of salt.
Cook the onions slowly for 45 to 60 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deeply golden brown and caramelized. Add sugar halfway through to help the process.
Add garlic and cook for one minute, then deglaze with white wine, scraping up all the caramelized bits from the bottom.
Pour in the beef broth, add thyme and bay leaf, and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Slice the baguette into thick rounds and toast until golden on both sides.
Ladle the soup into ovenproof bowls, place a crouton on top, and pile generously with grated Gruyère.
Broil for 3-5 minutes until the cheese is melted, bubbling, and lightly browned. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Vichyssoise
recipes.description: Elegant chilled soup of leeks and potatoes finished with cream and chives. Created by French chef Louis Diat, inspired by his mother's leek soup.
instructions: Trim the leeks, using only the white and light green parts. Slice thinly and wash thoroughly to remove all grit.
Melt butter in a large pot, add the leeks, and cook gently for 10 minutes until soft but not browned.
Peel and dice the potatoes, add to the pot with vegetable stock, and simmer for 20 minutes until potatoes are completely tender.
Blend the soup until very smooth using a blender or immersion blender, then pass through a fine sieve for an extra silky texture.
Stir in the cream, season with salt and white pepper, and chill thoroughly in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
Serve cold in chilled bowls, garnished with finely snipped fresh chives and a drizzle of cream.

recipes.name: Bouillabaisse
recipes.description: Marseille's legendary Provençal fish stew with a rich saffron-scented broth and an assortment of Mediterranean fish and shellfish. Served with rouille and crusty bread.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot and sauté the sliced onion, fennel, and garlic until softened.
Add the chopped tomatoes, saffron, orange zest, white wine, and fish stock. Bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the firm white fish pieces first and cook for 5 minutes, then add the shrimp and scrubbed mussels.
Cover and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the mussels have opened and the shrimp are pink. Discard any unopened mussels.
Season with salt and pepper, scatter with chopped parsley, and ladle into warm bowls.
Serve with toasted bread rounds spread with rouille and a scattering of fresh herbs.

recipes.name: Moules Marinières
recipes.description: Fresh mussels steamed in white wine with shallots, garlic, parsley, and butter. The simplest and most beloved way to prepare mussels in France.
instructions: Scrub the mussels thoroughly under cold water, pulling off any beards. Discard any mussels that are cracked or do not close when tapped.
Melt butter in a very large pot over medium heat. Add the finely diced shallots and garlic and cook gently until softened.
Add the white wine, bay leaf, and thyme. Bring to a rolling boil.
Add all the mussels at once, cover with a tight-fitting lid, and cook for 4-5 minutes, shaking the pot occasionally.
The mussels are ready when they have all opened. Discard any that remain closed.
Transfer the mussels to warm bowls, stir chopped parsley into the broth, and pour the broth over the mussels. Serve with crusty bread for dipping.

recipes.name: Sole Meunière
recipes.description: Delicate sole fillets lightly dredged in flour and pan-fried in golden brown butter with lemon and parsley. A cornerstone of classic French cuisine.
instructions: Pat the sole fillets dry with paper towels and season with salt and white pepper on both sides.
Dredge the fillets lightly in flour, shaking off any excess.
Heat half the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it foams. Place the fillets in the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden.
Transfer the fish to warm plates. Wipe the pan clean and add the remaining butter.
Cook the butter until it turns a nutty golden brown color and smells toasty, then immediately add the lemon juice and chopped parsley.
Pour the brown butter sauce over the sole fillets and serve immediately with steamed potatoes.

recipes.name: Coquilles Saint-Jacques
recipes.description: Pan-seared scallops served in their shells on a bed of creamy duchesse potato and gratinéed with a white wine and cream sauce. An elegant French classic.
instructions: Boil and mash the potatoes with butter, egg yolks, and a splash of cream to make duchesse potato. Pipe around the edges of scallop shells or gratin dishes.
Pat the scallops dry and sear them in hot butter for 1-2 minutes per side until golden. Remove and set aside.
Sauté the finely chopped shallot in the same pan, deglaze with white wine, and reduce by half.
Make a sauce by adding flour to the pan, cooking briefly, then whisking in milk and cream until smooth and thick.
Place the scallops in the prepared shells, spoon the sauce over them, and sprinkle with grated Gruyère.
Broil for 3-4 minutes until the cheese is golden and bubbling and the duchesse potato border is lightly browned. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Salade Niçoise
recipes.description: Composed salad from Nice with tuna, hard-boiled eggs, green beans, potatoes, olives, and anchovies on a bed of lettuce, dressed in a classic vinaigrette.
instructions: Boil the potatoes until tender, about 15 minutes, then halve. Blanch the green beans in salted water for 3 minutes, then plunge into ice water.
Hard-boil the eggs for 10 minutes, then cool, peel, and quarter.
Sear the tuna steaks in a hot oiled pan for 1-2 minutes per side, leaving them pink in the center. Slice thickly.
Make the vinaigrette by whisking together olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Arrange the butter lettuce on a large platter. Compose the salad by arranging the potatoes, green beans, tomatoes, eggs, olives, onion rings, tuna, and anchovies in groups.
Drizzle the vinaigrette over the salad and serve immediately without tossing, allowing each person to mix as they wish.

recipes.name: Gratin Dauphinois
recipes.description: Thinly sliced potatoes baked in cream and garlic until golden and bubbling. An indulgent side dish from the Dauphiné region of southeastern France.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 160C. Peel the potatoes and slice them very thinly using a mandoline, about 3mm thick.
Rub a baking dish generously with butter and the cut side of a garlic clove.
Heat the cream, milk, remaining minced garlic, nutmeg, salt, and pepper in a saucepan until just simmering.
Layer the potato slices in the buttered dish in overlapping rows, pouring some of the hot cream mixture between each layer.
Pour any remaining cream over the top and dot with small pieces of butter.
Bake for 70-75 minutes until the potatoes are completely tender when pierced with a knife and the top is deeply golden brown.
Let the gratin rest for 10 minutes before serving to allow the cream to be absorbed.

recipes.name: Crème Brûlée
recipes.description: Silky vanilla custard with a shattering layer of caramelized sugar on top. The most iconic French dessert, requiring just a few simple ingredients.
instructions: Split the vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out the seeds. Heat the cream with the vanilla seeds and pod until just simmering, then remove from heat and steep for 10 minutes.
Whisk the egg yolks with the granulated sugar until pale and thick.
Gradually pour the warm cream into the yolks, whisking constantly. Strain through a fine sieve into a jug and skim off any bubbles.
Divide the custard among six ramekins. Place them in a deep baking dish and pour hot water around them to come halfway up the sides.
Bake at 150C for 40-45 minutes until the custards are set around the edges but still have a gentle wobble in the center.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, sprinkle an even layer of demerara sugar on top and caramelize with a kitchen torch until dark amber and crackling.

recipes.name: Tarte Tatin
recipes.description: Upside-down caramelized apple tart baked on puff pastry and flipped to reveal glistening amber fruit. Created by accident at the Hôtel Tatin in the Loire Valley.
instructions: Peel, halve, and core the apples. Toss with lemon juice to prevent browning.
Make a caramel by melting sugar in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat until deep amber, then stir in the butter and vanilla extract.
Arrange the apple halves tightly in the caramel, cut-side up, packing them in as snugly as possible.
Cook on the stovetop over medium heat for 15 minutes until the apples start to soften and the caramel darkens.
Roll out the puff pastry into a circle slightly larger than the skillet, drape it over the apples, and tuck the edges down around the fruit.
Bake at 200C for 25 minutes until the pastry is deeply golden and puffed.
Let it rest for 5 minutes, then place a serving plate over the skillet and flip quickly. Serve warm with crème fraîche.

recipes.name: Profiteroles
recipes.description: Light choux pastry puffs filled with cold vanilla ice cream and drizzled with warm chocolate sauce. A beloved French patisserie classic.
instructions: Bring water, butter, sugar, and salt to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat and add all the flour at once, stirring vigorously with a wooden spoon until it forms a smooth ball.
Return to low heat and cook for one minute to dry out the dough, stirring constantly.
Transfer to a bowl and beat in eggs one at a time, making sure each is fully incorporated before adding the next. The dough should be glossy and fall from the spoon in a thick ribbon.
Pipe walnut-sized mounds onto a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake at 200C for 25-30 minutes until puffed, golden, and hollow-sounding when tapped.
Make the chocolate sauce by heating cream and pouring it over chopped dark chocolate, stirring until smooth and glossy.
Slice the cooled profiteroles in half, fill each with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and drizzle generously with warm chocolate sauce. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Mousse au Chocolat
recipes.description: Rich, airy French chocolate mousse made with just dark chocolate, eggs, and a touch of sugar. Intensely chocolatey with a cloud-like texture.
instructions: Melt the dark chocolate with butter in a heatproof bowl set over barely simmering water, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Separate the eggs. Whisk the yolks into the melted chocolate one at a time until smooth and glossy.
In a clean bowl, whisk the egg whites with a pinch of salt until soft peaks form, then gradually add the sugar and whisk to stiff, glossy peaks.
Fold one-third of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture to lighten it, then gently fold in the remaining whites in two additions, being careful not to deflate.
Divide the mousse among six ramekins or glasses, cover with cling film, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight until set.
Serve chilled, topped with a dollop of whipped cream or a few shavings of chocolate.

recipes.name: Crêpes
recipes.description: Thin, delicate French pancakes that can be filled sweet or savory. This classic recipe produces tender crêpes with lacy golden edges.
instructions: Whisk the flour, eggs, milk, melted butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt together until completely smooth. The batter should be the consistency of thin cream.
Let the batter rest for at least 30 minutes at room temperature, or up to overnight in the refrigerator.
Heat a non-stick crêpe pan or skillet over medium-high heat and brush lightly with butter.
Pour a small ladleful of batter into the center and immediately swirl the pan to coat the base evenly in a very thin layer.
Cook for about 1 minute until the edges are golden and lift easily, then flip and cook for another 30 seconds.
Stack the crêpes on a warm plate, serve with lemon juice and sugar, Nutella, fresh berries, or jam.

recipes.name: Soufflé au Fromage
recipes.description: Dramatically risen cheese soufflé with a golden crown and a creamy, airy interior. Made with Gruyère and a well-seasoned béchamel base.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200C. Butter a 1.5L soufflé dish generously and dust with a little finely grated Gruyère.
Make a thick béchamel by melting butter, stirring in flour, and cooking for one minute. Gradually whisk in the milk and cook until very thick and smooth.
Remove from heat and stir in the grated Gruyère, mustard, cayenne, nutmeg, and salt. Beat in the egg yolks one at a time.
Whisk the egg whites with a pinch of salt until they hold stiff peaks. Stir one-quarter into the cheese base to lighten it.
Gently fold in the remaining egg whites in two additions, using a large spatula and cutting through the center, being careful to maintain as much volume as possible.
Pour into the prepared dish, run your thumb around the inside edge to create a groove, and bake for 22-25 minutes until risen and golden. Do not open the oven door during baking.
Serve immediately at the table before the soufflé deflates.

recipes.name: Madeleines
recipes.description: Small shell-shaped sponge cakes with a delicate lemon flavor and the signature bump on the back. Made famous by Marcel Proust in his literary masterpiece.
instructions: Melt the butter and let it cool to room temperature. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Whisk the eggs, sugar, and honey together until pale, thick, and doubled in volume, about 5 minutes with an electric mixer.
Fold in the flour mixture gently, then stir in the melted butter, lemon zest, and vanilla extract.
Cover the batter and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight for the best bump.
Butter and flour a madeleine pan generously. Spoon the cold batter into each mold, filling about three-quarters full.
Bake at 220C for 10-12 minutes until the madeleines are golden around the edges with a pronounced bump in the center.
Unmold immediately and dust with powdered sugar while still warm. Best eaten the same day.

recipes.name: Clafoutis
recipes.description: Rustic baked custard studded with fresh cherries from the Limousin region. Traditionally made with unpitted cherries for extra almond-like flavor from the pits.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180C. Butter a shallow baking dish generously and scatter the cherries in a single layer.
Whisk together the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Sift in the flour and salt, whisking until smooth.
Add the milk, cream, and vanilla extract, whisking until the batter is smooth and the consistency of thin pancake batter.
Pour the batter over the cherries and dot the top with small pieces of butter.
Bake for 35-40 minutes until the clafoutis is puffed, golden, and set in the center with a slight wobble.
Dust generously with powdered sugar and serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Pissaladière
recipes.description: Provençal flatbread topped with slowly caramelized onions, anchovies, and Niçoise olives. A savory tart from Nice that predates modern pizza.
instructions: Make the dough by dissolving yeast in warm water with a pinch of sugar, then mix with flour, 2 tablespoons olive oil, and salt. Knead for 8 minutes and let rise for 1 hour.
Slice all the onions thinly. Cook them very slowly in olive oil with garlic, thyme, and bay leaf over low heat for 45 minutes until completely melted and golden.
Season the onions with salt and pepper, remove the bay leaf and thyme stems, and let cool.
Roll or stretch the dough to fit a large rectangular baking sheet. Brush with olive oil.
Spread the caramelized onions evenly over the dough, then arrange anchovy fillets in a diamond pattern and place olives in the spaces between.
Bake at 220C for 20-25 minutes until the crust is golden and crispy on the bottom.
Drizzle with a little extra olive oil, cut into squares, and serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Gougères
recipes.description: Airy Burgundian cheese puffs made from choux pastry studded with Gruyère cheese. Traditionally served as an apéritif with a glass of Burgundy wine.
instructions: Bring water, butter, and salt to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat and add all the flour at once, stirring vigorously with a wooden spoon until a smooth dough forms.
Return to low heat and stir for one minute to dry out the dough. Transfer to a mixing bowl.
Beat in the eggs one at a time until the dough is smooth, shiny, and falls from a spoon in a thick V-shape.
Fold in three-quarters of the cubed Gruyère along with the mustard, pepper, and cayenne.
Pipe or spoon walnut-sized mounds onto a parchment-lined baking sheet, leaving space between each. Top with the remaining cheese.
Bake at 200C for 22-25 minutes until puffed, golden, and crisp on the outside. Do not open the oven during the first 20 minutes.
Serve warm from the oven as an apéritif.

recipes.name: Pot-au-Feu
recipes.description: The grand French boiled dinner: beef, marrow bones, and root vegetables gently simmered for hours in a clear broth. Considered the cornerstone of French home cooking.
instructions: Place the beef chuck and short ribs in a very large stockpot and cover with cold water. Bring slowly to a boil, skimming off all the scum that rises to the surface.
Stud the onions with cloves and add them to the pot along with the bouquet garni, garlic, peppercorns, and salt.
Reduce heat to a very gentle simmer and cook for 2 hours with the lid slightly ajar, skimming occasionally.
Peel and cut the carrots, turnips, leeks, and celery into large pieces. Add the root vegetables and marrow bones to the pot.
Continue simmering for another 1.5 to 2 hours until the beef is very tender and the vegetables are soft.

Serve the clear broth as a first course with toasted bread. Follow with the sliced meat, marrow bones, and vegetables arranged on a platter, accompanied by cornichons, Dijon mustard, and fleur de sel.

recipes.name: Confit Byaldi
recipes.description: Elegant thinly sliced vegetables fanned over a piperade sauce and baked until meltingly tender. Thomas Keller's refined ratatouille, famously featured in the film Ratatouille.
instructions: Make the piperade by roasting the bell peppers until charred, peeling them, and sautéing with diced onion and garlic in olive oil until soft. Add canned tomatoes and cook down until thick.
Spread the piperade sauce in an even layer across the bottom of a baking dish.
Slice the zucchini, yellow squash, eggplant, and Roma tomatoes into very thin rounds of uniform thickness, about 2mm, using a mandoline.
Arrange alternating slices of each vegetable in a tight spiral or overlapping rows over the piperade, seasoning each layer with salt and pepper.
Drizzle generously with olive oil, scatter with thyme leaves, cover tightly with parchment paper, and bake at 130C for 2 hours until all the vegetables are meltingly tender.
Remove the parchment paper and increase the heat to 180C for 15 minutes to lightly caramelize the top.
Garnish with torn fresh basil and a drizzle of the best olive oil. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Boeuf en Croûte
recipes.description: Beef tenderloin wrapped in mushroom duxelles and puff pastry, baked until golden. The French original of Beef Wellington, a show-stopping centerpiece for special occasions.
instructions: Season the beef tenderloin and sear it on all sides in a very hot skillet with oil until a deep brown crust forms. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool completely.
Finely chop the mushrooms and cook them with shallots, garlic, thyme, and butter over high heat until all moisture has evaporated and the duxelles is dry and concentrated.
Lay out overlapping slices of prosciutto on cling film, spread the duxelles evenly over them, place the beef at one end, and roll tightly into a log. Chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out the puff pastry, wrap it around the beef parcel, sealing the edges with egg wash. Score the top decoratively and brush all over with egg yolk.
Bake at 220C for 25-30 minutes until the pastry is deep golden brown and the internal temperature of the beef reads 52C for medium-rare.
Rest for 10 minutes before slicing into thick rounds. Serve with a red wine jus and seasonal vegetables.

recipes.name: Salade Lyonnaise
recipes.description: Classic Lyonnaise salad of frisée lettuce with crispy lardons, a perfectly poached egg, and a warm mustard vinaigrette. A bistro staple from Lyon.
instructions: Wash and dry the frisée, tearing it into bite-sized pieces, using mostly the pale inner leaves.
Cook the lardons in a skillet over medium heat until golden and crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon, reserving the rendered fat in the pan.
Add the finely chopped shallot to the fat and cook for one minute. Remove the pan from heat and whisk in the vinegar, olive oil, and Dijon mustard to make a warm vinaigrette.
Poach the eggs in gently simmering water with a splash of vinegar for 3 minutes until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Toss the frisée with the warm vinaigrette, scatter with the crispy lardons and croutons, and top each portion with a poached egg.
Season with salt and pepper, break the egg yolk to let it run over the salad, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Pommes Dauphine
recipes.description: Luxurious deep-fried potato puffs made by combining mashed potatoes with choux pastry dough. Impossibly light and crispy on the outside, fluffy within.
instructions: Boil the potatoes until very tender, drain well, and pass through a ricer or fine sieve while still hot. Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg, and the egg yolk. Let cool slightly.
Make choux pastry by bringing water, half the butter, and a pinch of salt to a boil. Add flour all at once, stir vigorously until the dough forms a ball and pulls away from the pan.
Beat in the eggs one at a time until the choux is smooth and glossy.
Combine the potato purée and choux pastry in a 2:1 ratio, mixing until homogeneous. The dough should be soft but hold its shape.
Heat vegetable oil to 170C. Using two spoons or a piping bag, form small balls of dough and carefully drop them into the hot oil.
Fry in batches for 4-5 minutes, turning occasionally, until puffed, golden brown, and cooked through. Drain on paper towels.
Season with fine salt and serve immediately as a side dish with roasted meats.

recipes.name: Haricots Verts Amandine
recipes.description: Crisp French green beans tossed with toasted slivered almonds and brown butter. A simple, elegant side dish that appears on tables across France.
instructions: Trim the haricots verts and blanch in a large pot of heavily salted boiling water for 3-4 minutes until bright green and crisp-tender.
Immediately plunge the beans into a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking and preserve the vibrant color. Drain well.
Toast the slivered almonds in a dry skillet over medium heat, stirring frequently, until golden and fragrant. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt the butter over medium heat and cook until it turns nutty brown and smells toasty.
Add the drained green beans and toss in the brown butter for one minute until heated through. Squeeze lemon juice over the top.
Transfer to a serving dish, scatter with the toasted almonds, season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Bisque de Homard
recipes.description: Luxuriously smooth lobster bisque enriched with cream, brandy, and the deep flavor of roasted lobster shells. The pinnacle of French soup-making tradition.
instructions: Cook the lobsters in boiling water for 8 minutes, then remove the meat from the tails and claws, reserving all the shells. Dice the meat and refrigerate.
Crush the shells and roast them in butter in a large pot until fragrant and deeply colored. Add the diced onion, carrot, celery, and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes, then flambé with brandy. Add white wine and reduce by half.
Add fish stock and rice, bring to a simmer, and cook for 30 minutes until the rice is very soft and the broth is deeply flavorful.
Blend the soup in batches, shells and all, then pass through a fine sieve, pressing hard to extract every drop of flavor. Discard the solids.
Return the bisque to the pot, stir in the cream, cayenne, tarragon, and salt. Gently reheat without boiling.
Ladle into warm bowls, garnish with the reserved lobster meat and a drizzle of brandy cream. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Galette Bretonne
recipes.description: Savory Breton buckwheat crêpe filled with ham, Gruyère cheese, and a whole egg. A crispy-edged specialty from Brittany, naturally gluten-free from the buckwheat flour.
instructions: Make the galette batter by whisking buckwheat flour, water, one egg, and salt until smooth. Let it rest for at least 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator.
Heat a large flat skillet or crêpe pan over medium-high heat and brush with melted butter.
Pour a thin layer of batter and swirl to coat the pan evenly. Cook until the edges start to crisp and the surface is dry.
Place a slice of ham and a generous amount of grated Gruyère on the galette. Crack an egg into the center.
Fold the four edges of the galette inward to form a square frame around the egg. Cover briefly to let the cheese melt and the egg white set while keeping the yolk runny.
Slide onto a plate, season with pepper, and serve immediately while the edges are still crispy.

recipes.name: Croissants
recipes.description: Flaky, buttery laminated pastry with a golden crust and soft, airy interior. The quintessential French breakfast pastry.
instructions: Warm the milk slightly and dissolve yeast and sugar in it, then combine with flour, salt, and 30g of softened butter to form a smooth dough.
Wrap the dough in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour until firm.
Pound the remaining 250g butter into a flat rectangle between parchment sheets and chill until pliable but cold.
Roll out the dough, encase the butter block, and perform three sets of single folds, chilling 30 minutes between each fold.
Roll the laminated dough to 5mm thickness and cut into triangles, then roll each triangle from the wide end to the tip.
Curve the ends inward to form the crescent shape and place on a lined baking sheet.
Proof at room temperature for 1.5 to 2 hours until doubled, then brush with beaten egg wash.
Bake at 200°C for 15-18 minutes until deeply golden brown and flaky.

recipes.name: Pain au Chocolat
recipes.description: Rectangular laminated pastry filled with two batons of dark chocolate. A beloved French viennoiserie enjoyed at breakfast or as a snack.
instructions: Prepare laminated croissant dough by combining flour, milk, yeast, sugar, salt, and 30g butter, then chill for 1 hour.
Encase 250g of cold butter in the dough and perform three single folds with 30-minute rests between each.
Roll the finished dough into a large rectangle about 5mm thick.
Cut into rectangles approximately 10cm by 15cm each.
Place two chocolate batons along the short edge of each rectangle and roll up tightly.
Place seam-side down on a lined baking sheet, cover, and proof for 1.5 to 2 hours until puffy.
Brush with beaten egg wash and bake at 200°C for 15-18 minutes until golden and crisp.

recipes.name: Éclairs
recipes.description: Elegant choux pastry fingers filled with vanilla pastry cream and topped with a glossy chocolate glaze. A classic French pâtisserie staple.
instructions: Bring water, 125ml milk, 100g butter, sugar, and salt to a boil, then add flour all at once and stir vigorously until the dough pulls away from the pan.
Transfer the dough to a bowl and beat in eggs one at a time until smooth and glossy, forming a pipeable choux paste.
Pipe 12cm lengths onto a lined baking sheet and bake at 200°C for 10 minutes, then reduce to 180°C for 20 minutes until golden and hollow.
For the pastry cream, heat 300ml milk with vanilla, then whisk sugar, cornstarch, and egg yolks together and temper with the hot milk.
Cook the pastry cream over medium heat until thick, stir in 10g butter, then cover with plastic wrap directly on the surface and chill.
Melt chocolate with cream to make a smooth ganache glaze and let it cool slightly until it thickens to a coating consistency.
Poke holes in the bottom of each cooled éclair and pipe in pastry cream until full.
Dip the tops of each éclair into the chocolate glaze and allow to set before serving.

recipes.name: Mille-feuille
recipes.description: Three layers of crisp caramelized puff pastry sandwiching vanilla pastry cream, topped with feathered icing. Also known as Napoleon.
instructions: Roll out puff pastry to 3mm thickness, dock thoroughly with a fork, and place between two baking sheets to keep it flat.
Bake at 200°C for 20-25 minutes until golden and crisp, then dust with powdered sugar and caramelize briefly under the broiler.
Prepare vanilla pastry cream by heating milk with split vanilla bean, then whisking into a mixture of egg yolks, sugar, and cornstarch.
Cook the custard until thick and glossy, stir in butter, then press plastic wrap onto the surface and chill completely.
Cut the baked pastry into three equal rectangles and whip the chilled pastry cream until smooth.
Layer pastry, cream, pastry, cream, and finish with the final pastry layer on top.
Make a white icing from powdered sugar and water, spread on top, then pipe thin lines of melted chocolate and drag a knife through for the feathered pattern.
Refrigerate for 1 hour to set, then slice with a serrated knife.

recipes.name: Tarte aux Fraises
recipes.description: A classic French strawberry tart with buttery pâte sucrée crust, smooth vanilla pastry cream, and fresh glazed strawberries.
instructions: Make pâte sucrée by creaming butter with powdered sugar and salt, then mixing in egg yolk and flour until a smooth dough forms; chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out the dough, line a 24cm tart ring, prick the base, and blind bake at 180°C for 20 minutes until golden.
Prepare pastry cream by heating milk with vanilla, then whisking into combined egg yolks, sugar, and cornstarch; cook until thick.
Pour the pastry cream into the cooled tart shell and spread evenly, then refrigerate until set.
Hull the strawberries and arrange them neatly on top of the cream, starting from the outside edge.
Warm apricot jam with a splash of water, strain, and brush over the strawberries for a glossy finish.

recipes.name: Quiche Florentine
recipes.description: A savory tart with a flaky butter crust filled with creamy egg custard, wilted spinach, and nutty Gruyère cheese.
instructions: Make shortcrust pastry by rubbing cold cubed butter into flour with salt, then adding ice water until the dough just comes together; chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out the pastry, line a 24cm tart tin, prick the base, and blind bake at 190°C for 15 minutes.
Wilt the spinach in a hot pan, squeeze out all excess moisture, and roughly chop.
Whisk together eggs, cream, milk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper to make the custard.
Spread the spinach over the par-baked tart shell and scatter grated Gruyère on top.
Pour the custard mixture over the filling and bake at 180°C for 30-35 minutes until set and lightly golden.
Allow the quiche to rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Flamiche
recipes.description: A rich leek tart from Picardy made with buttery pastry, slow-cooked leeks, cream, and egg custard. A hearty northern French classic.
instructions: Clean the leeks thoroughly, slice into thin rounds using only the white and light green parts.
Melt butter in a large pan and sweat the leeks over low heat for 20 minutes until very soft but not browned.
Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg, then let the leeks cool slightly.
Roll out two-thirds of the puff pastry and line a deep 24cm tart tin.
Whisk eggs and cream together, then fold into the cooled leeks and pour into the pastry case.
Roll out the remaining pastry, cover the tart, seal the edges, and cut a steam vent in the center.
Brush with egg yolk wash and bake at 190°C for 30-35 minutes until puffed and deeply golden.

recipes.name: Socca
recipes.description: A thin, crispy chickpea flour pancake from Nice, baked in a blazing hot oven until charred at the edges. Simple, rustic, and naturally gluten-free.
instructions: Whisk chickpea flour with water, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and salt until smooth with no lumps.
Let the batter rest for at least 30 minutes at room temperature, skimming off any foam that rises.
Preheat the oven to its highest setting, at least 250°C, with a large cast-iron skillet or baking pan inside.
Carefully remove the hot pan, add the remaining olive oil, swirl to coat, and pour in the batter.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the socca is set, golden, and charred in spots around the edges.
Season with black pepper and cumin, cut into irregular pieces, and serve immediately while hot.

recipes.name: Piperade
recipes.description: A vibrant Basque dish of sweet peppers, tomatoes, and onions stewed with Espelette pepper, finished with softly scrambled eggs.
instructions: Slice the peppers into thin strips, dice the onion, mince the garlic, and peel and chop the tomatoes.
Heat olive oil in a wide pan and sauté the onion until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the peppers and cook over medium heat for 15 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
Add garlic, tomatoes, thyme, Espelette pepper, and salt, then simmer for 20 minutes until thick and jammy.
Lightly beat the eggs and pour over the vegetable mixture, stirring gently until just set in soft curds.
Serve immediately on warm plates, with crusty bread alongside.

recipes.name: Aligot
recipes.description: Extraordinarily stretchy and elastic mashed potatoes from the Aubrac region, enriched with young tomme fraîche cheese, butter, and cream.
instructions: Peel and cut the potatoes into even chunks, then boil in salted water until completely tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain the potatoes thoroughly and pass through a ricer or food mill back into the pot.
Over low heat, stir in butter, warm cream, and minced garlic until smooth and creamy.
Begin adding the thinly sliced tomme fraîche cheese in handfuls, stirring vigorously with a wooden spoon.
Continue stirring energetically for 10 minutes, lifting and stretching the mixture until it becomes elastic and ribbony.
Season with salt and white pepper, then serve immediately while still hot and stretchy.

recipes.name: Tartiflette
