Strain the pani through a sieve for a smooth liquid. Adjust salt and spice to taste. Chill in the refrigerator.
Make a separate sweet-sour water by dissolving tamarind paste in 1 cup of water with a pinch of cumin and salt.
To assemble, gently crack a small hole in the top of each puri shell using your thumb.
Fill each puri with a small spoonful of the potato-chickpea mixture.
Dip the filled puri into the chilled mint pani, filling it up, and eat in one bite immediately.

recipes.name: Aloo Tikki
recipes.description: Crispy, golden-brown spiced potato patties served with chutneys and yogurt. A popular North Indian street snack with a crunchy exterior and fluffy interior.
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, peel, and mash thoroughly until smooth with no lumps.
Boil green peas until soft and mash them lightly. Mix into the mashed potato.
Add finely chopped onion, green chili, cilantro, cumin, garam masala, amchur, cornstarch, and salt. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into 12 flat, round patties about 2 inches in diameter and 1 cm thick.
Heat oil in a flat pan or tawa. Shallow-fry the tikkis on medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side until golden and crispy.
Serve hot, topped with whisked yogurt, tamarind chutney, green chutney, and a sprinkle of chaat masala.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.description: Chargrilled chicken tikka pieces simmered in a creamy, spiced tomato-based masala sauce. A globally beloved dish with deep roots in Indian cooking traditions.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized chunks. Marinate in yogurt, half the Kashmiri chili powder, cumin, and salt for at least 1 hour.
Thread chicken onto skewers and grill or broil at high heat for 10-12 minutes, turning once, until charred. Set aside.
Heat butter and oil in a pan. Sauté finely chopped onions until soft and golden, about 8 minutes.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add tomato puree, remaining Kashmiri chili, coriander powder, turmeric, and salt. Cook for 12-15 minutes until thickened.
Add the grilled chicken tikka pieces and stir to coat. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Pour in heavy cream and garam masala. Stir well and cook for another 5 minutes on low heat.
Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of cream and fresh cilantro, alongside naan or basmati rice.

recipes.name: Lamb Vindaloo
recipes.description: A fiery Goan curry of tender lamb marinated and braised in a pungent vinegar-chili-garlic sauce with warm spices. Bold, tangy, and intensely flavorful.
instructions: Make a paste by blending garlic, ginger, cumin, mustard seeds, peppercorns, cloves, cinnamon, and Kashmiri chili powder with the vinegar.
Marinate the lamb pieces in this spice-vinegar paste for at least 2 hours, ideally overnight in the refrigerator.
Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add sliced onions and cook until deep golden brown, about 12 minutes.
Add the marinated lamb with all its paste and sear on high heat for 5 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes, sugar, and salt. Stir well and cook for 5 minutes.
Add 1 cup of hot water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to very low. Cover tightly and simmer for 60-70 minutes.
The lamb should be tender and the sauce thick and dark. Adjust vinegar and salt to taste.
Serve piping hot with steamed rice or crusty bread.

recipes.name: Saag Aloo
recipes.description: Tender potatoes simmered in a thick, earthy mustard greens and spinach sauce with garlic and spices. A rustic Punjabi comfort dish rich in iron and flavor.
instructions: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain, refresh in ice water, and blend into a coarse puree.
Cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Parboil them until just tender but still firm. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle.
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies.
Add turmeric and the parboiled potato cubes. Toss for 2-3 minutes.
Add the spinach puree, salt, and a splash of water. Cover and cook on low heat for 12-15 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and stir gently. Serve hot with roti or naan.

recipes.name: Baingan Bharta
recipes.description: Smoky roasted eggplant mashed and cooked with onions, tomatoes, and bold spices. A rustic Punjabi dish where the fire-roasted flavor takes center stage.
instructions: Roast the whole eggplant directly over an open flame, turning occasionally, until the skin is completely charred and the flesh is soft and smoky, about 15 minutes.
Let the eggplant cool slightly, then peel off the charred skin under running water. Mash the flesh roughly with a fork, keeping some texture.
Heat mustard oil in a pan until smoking, then let it cool slightly. Add cumin seeds.
Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the tomatoes break down, about 8 minutes.
Add the mashed roasted eggplant and salt. Stir well and cook for 8-10 minutes, mashing further as it cooks.
Sprinkle garam masala, garnish with fresh cilantro, and serve hot with roti or paratha.

recipes.name: Dum Aloo
recipes.description: Baby potatoes fried golden and simmered in a rich, creamy yogurt-tomato gravy on a slow flame. A Kashmiri-inspired dish that is simple yet deeply satisfying.
instructions: Boil baby potatoes until just tender. Peel and prick all over with a fork to allow the gravy to penetrate.
Deep-fry or shallow-fry the potatoes in oil until golden brown all over. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan with 2 tablespoons of oil, add sliced onion and sauté until soft.
Add garlic-ginger paste, Kashmiri chili powder, turmeric, and fennel powder. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add pureed tomatoes and cook for 8 minutes until the oil separates from the masala.
Whisk the yogurt and add it gradually, stirring constantly. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add the fried potatoes and half a cup of water. Cover tightly and cook on very low heat (dum) for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot with steamed rice or naan.

recipes.name: Gulab Jamun
recipes.description: Soft, spongy milk-solid dumplings deep-fried to a dark golden brown and soaked in warm rose-cardamom scented sugar syrup. India's most beloved dessert.
instructions: Make the sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in 2 cups of water over medium heat. Add crushed cardamom, saffron, and rose water. Simmer for 10 minutes and keep warm.
Crumble the khoya into a bowl. Add flour, milk powder, and baking soda. Mix gently.
Add warm milk a little at a time and knead into a soft, smooth dough. Do not overwork. The dough should not be sticky or dry.
Divide the dough into 24 small portions and roll into smooth, crack-free balls between your palms.
Heat ghee on medium-low heat (around 140C). Gently slide the balls in and fry on low heat, turning constantly, until uniformly dark golden brown.
Remove the fried balls and immediately drop them into the warm sugar syrup. Let them soak for at least 2 hours.
Serve warm or at room temperature, garnished with chopped pistachios and a few saffron strands.

recipes.name: Jalebi
recipes.description: Crispy, pretzel-shaped spirals of fermented batter deep-fried and soaked in saffron sugar syrup. A bright orange, syrupy Indian sweet best enjoyed warm and crunchy.
instructions: Make the sugar syrup: dissolve sugar in 1 cup of water, add saffron, cardamom powder, and lemon juice. Simmer for 8 minutes until slightly sticky. Add rose water and keep warm.

Mix flour, cornstarch, yogurt, and baking powder with warm water to make a smooth, flowing batter (like pancake batter). Let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours, or use a pinch of instant yeast for a quicker rise.
Pour the batter into a squeeze bottle or piping bag with a small round tip.
Heat oil to 170C. Squeeze the batter in concentric circular or pretzel shapes directly into the hot oil.
Fry on medium heat for 2-3 minutes, flipping once, until crispy and deep golden orange.
Remove and immediately dip the hot jalebis into the warm sugar syrup for 30 seconds.
Remove from the syrup and serve immediately while still crispy and warm.

recipes.name: Kheer
recipes.description: A creamy Indian rice pudding slow-simmered in milk with cardamom, saffron, and nuts until thick and luscious. A timeless dessert served at festivals and celebrations.
instructions: Rinse and soak basmati rice in water for 20 minutes. Drain thoroughly.
Bring milk to a boil in a heavy-bottomed pot, stirring frequently to prevent scorching.
Add the soaked rice and crushed cardamom pods. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring every few minutes.
Cook for 35-40 minutes until the rice is completely soft and the milk has reduced to about half its original volume.
Add sugar, saffron soaked in a tablespoon of warm milk, and sliced almonds, cashews, and raisins.
Simmer for another 5 minutes, then add rose water. The kheer should coat the back of a spoon.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with slivered pistachios and a few saffron strands.

recipes.name: Rasgulla
recipes.description: Soft, spongy balls of fresh chhena cheese cooked in a light sugar syrup until they puff up and absorb the sweetness. A beloved Bengali dessert that melts in the mouth.
instructions: Bring milk to a rolling boil. Add lemon juice gradually while stirring until the milk curdles completely and the whey separates as a clear greenish liquid.
Strain through a muslin cloth, rinse under cold water to remove the lemony taste, and squeeze out all excess whey.
Knead the chhena (fresh cheese) on a clean surface for 8-10 minutes until it becomes very smooth, soft, and no longer grainy.
Divide into 16 equal portions and roll into smooth, crack-free balls. They will expand to nearly double when cooked.
Make the syrup by dissolving sugar in 6 cups of water. Bring to a rolling boil.
Gently drop the chhena balls into the boiling syrup. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-18 minutes. They should puff up significantly.
Remove from heat, add rose water and cardamom. Let the rasgullas cool completely in the syrup before serving chilled.

recipes.name: Gajar Ka Halwa
recipes.description: Grated carrots slow-cooked in milk with sugar, ghee, and cardamom until thick and rich, garnished with nuts. A warming winter dessert beloved across North India.
instructions: Wash, peel, and finely grate the carrots using a box grater.
Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add grated carrots and sauté on medium heat for 5 minutes.
Pour in the milk and crushed cardamom. Cook on medium heat, stirring frequently, until all the milk is absorbed, about 30-35 minutes.
Add sugar and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the released moisture evaporates.
Add remaining ghee, crumbled khoya, and stir well. Cook until the halwa starts leaving the sides of the pan.
In a separate small pan, lightly fry the sliced almonds, cashews, and raisins in a teaspoon of ghee.
Fold the fried nuts into the halwa. Serve warm, garnished with a few more slivered almonds.

recipes.name: Barfi
recipes.description: Dense, fudge-like milk sweet made from reduced khoya and sugar, set and cut into diamond shapes. A classic Indian confection enjoyed during festivals like Diwali.
instructions: Crumble the khoya into fine pieces. Heat a heavy-bottomed non-stick pan with a small amount of ghee.
Add the crumbled khoya and cook on low heat, stirring continuously, until it melts and becomes smooth, about 8 minutes.
Add sugar and keep stirring on low heat. The mixture will become loose at first as sugar melts, then gradually thicken.
Add cardamom powder and saffron. Continue cooking and stirring for 12-15 minutes until the mixture thickens and starts to leave the sides of the pan.
Grease a tray with ghee. Pour the mixture onto the tray and spread evenly to about 1 cm thickness.
Press slivered pistachios and almonds into the surface. Apply silver leaf if using.
Let it cool and set at room temperature for 2-3 hours. Cut into diamond or square shapes and serve.

recipes.name: Kulfi
recipes.description: Traditional Indian frozen dessert made by slow-reducing milk with cardamom, saffron, and nuts until intensely creamy, then frozen in molds. Denser and richer than ice cream.
instructions: Bring milk to a boil in a heavy-bottomed pan, stirring frequently to prevent it from sticking or scorching at the bottom.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring regularly, until the milk reduces to about one-third of its original volume, about 35-40 minutes.
Add sugar, condensed milk, cardamom powder, and saffron soaked in a tablespoon of warm milk. Stir well.
Add finely chopped pistachios and almonds (reserve some for garnish). Cook for another 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in rose water. Let the mixture cool to room temperature.
Pour into kulfi molds or small cups. Cover with foil and insert a popsicle stick into each. Freeze for at least 6-8 hours.
To unmold, dip the mold briefly in warm water. Serve garnished with chopped pistachios and falooda sev if desired.

recipes.name: Rasmalai
recipes.description: Flattened discs of spongy chhena cheese soaked in thickened, chilled saffron-cardamom milk. An exquisite Bengali sweet that is light, elegant, and irresistibly creamy.
instructions: Bring 1 liter of milk to a boil. Add lemon juice gradually to curdle it. Strain through muslin, rinse, and squeeze out all whey.
Knead the chhena for 8-10 minutes until silky smooth. Shape into 12 small, flat discs.
Make a sugar syrup with 200g sugar and 4 cups of water. Bring to a boil.
Gently add the chhena discs to the boiling syrup. Cover and cook for 12-15 minutes. They will puff up. Remove and place in cold water.
For the rabri, simmer the remaining 1 liter of milk on low heat, stirring often, until it reduces to about 400ml, about 25-30 minutes.
Add remaining sugar, cardamom, saffron, and rose water to the reduced milk. Stir and let it cool.
Gently squeeze excess syrup from the chhena discs and place them in the chilled sweetened milk.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Serve cold, garnished with slivered pistachios and saffron strands.

recipes.name: Garlic Naan
recipes.description: Soft leavened flatbread generously topped with minced garlic, butter, and cilantro. A fragrant, irresistible variation of classic naan that pairs perfectly with any curry.
instructions: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm milk. Let it sit for 10 minutes until frothy.
Combine flour, salt, and baking powder. Add the yeast mixture, yogurt, and oil. Knead into a soft dough for 8-10 minutes.
Cover and let the dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour until doubled in size.
Mince the garlic finely and mix with softened butter and chopped cilantro to make the garlic butter.
Divide the dough into 8 portions. Roll each into a teardrop shape about 5mm thick. Press minced garlic into the surface of each naan.
Heat a cast-iron skillet on high heat. Place the naan garlic-side down and cook until bubbles form. Flip and cook until golden spots appear.
Brush each hot naan generously with the garlic-cilantro butter.
Serve immediately alongside dal, butter chicken, or any curry of your choice.

recipes.name: Jeera Rice
recipes.description: Fragrant basmati rice tempered with cumin seeds, ghee, and whole spices. A simple, aromatic side dish that is the perfect accompaniment to any Indian curry or dal.
instructions: Rinse basmati rice in cold water 3-4 times until the water runs clear. Soak in water for 20 minutes, then drain.
Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle and turn golden, about 30 seconds.
Add bay leaf, cardamom pods, and cloves. Sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the drained rice and gently sauté for 1-2 minutes, coating each grain with ghee.
Add 2 cups of water (double the volume of rice) and salt. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to the lowest setting, cover tightly, and cook for 15 minutes without lifting the lid.
Turn off the heat and let the rice rest covered for 5 minutes. Fluff gently with a fork, garnish with cilantro, and serve.

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
recipes.description: Crispy fermented rice and lentil crepe filled with spiced potato masala, a beloved South Indian breakfast staple.
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, peel and roughly mash them.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter, then add curry leaves and green chillies.
Add chopped onion and saute until translucent.
Add turmeric powder, salt, and the mashed potatoes; mix well and cook for 3 minutes.
Heat a flat griddle, pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread it in a thin circle.
Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden and crisp.
Place a portion of potato masala in the centre, fold the dosa over, and serve hot with sambar and chutney.

recipes.name: Idli
recipes.description: Soft, fluffy steamed rice and lentil cakes that are a staple South Indian breakfast, light and easy to digest.
instructions: Soak idli rice and urad dal with fenugreek seeds separately for at least 6 hours.
Grind urad dal to a smooth fluffy batter, then grind rice to a slightly grainy batter.
Combine both batters, add salt, and mix well; let it ferment overnight in a warm place.
Grease idli moulds lightly with oil and pour batter into each cavity.
Steam in an idli steamer for 12-15 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Let them cool slightly, then unmould with a wet spoon and serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Sambar
recipes.description: A tangy and spicy South Indian lentil stew loaded with mixed vegetables and tamarind, served as an accompaniment to rice, dosa, or idli.
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric and water until soft, then mash and set aside.
Cut drumstick, carrot, and onion into pieces; chop tomato.
Soak tamarind paste in warm water, extract the juice, and discard the pulp.
Cook the vegetables in water until tender, then add tamarind juice, sambar powder, and salt.
Add the mashed dal to the vegetable mixture and simmer for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a small pan, add mustard seeds, asafoetida, and curry leaves for the tempering.
Pour the tempering over the sambar, stir well, and serve hot with rice, idli, or dosa.

recipes.name: Coconut Chutney
recipes.description: A creamy and refreshing South Indian condiment made from fresh coconut, green chillies, and tempered with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
instructions: Blend fresh coconut, roasted chana dal, green chillies, ginger, salt, and water into a smooth paste.
Adjust consistency by adding more water if needed; transfer to a serving bowl.
Heat oil in a small pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add urad dal and fry until golden, then add curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the chutney, mix gently, and serve alongside dosa, idli, or vada.

recipes.name: Kerala Fish Curry
recipes.description: A tangy and spicy Kerala-style fish curry cooked in a coconut and tamarind base with raw mango, a signature dish from God's Own Country.
instructions: Soak kodampuli in warm water for 15 minutes to soften.
Heat coconut oil in a clay pot or heavy pan, add fenugreek seeds and curry leaves.
Add sliced shallots and saute until golden brown.
Add chilli powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and a splash of water; cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomato, soaked kodampuli with its water, salt, and remaining water; bring to a boil.
Gently slide in the fish steaks, cover and simmer on low heat for 12-15 minutes without stirring.
Shake the pot gently to mix the gravy, garnish with curry leaves, and let it rest for an hour before serving for best flavour.

recipes.name: Avial
recipes.description: A thick mixed vegetable curry from Kerala, cooked with ground coconut paste and yogurt, finished with fragrant coconut oil and curry leaves.
instructions: Cut all vegetables into long finger-length strips of uniform thickness.
Cook the vegetables with turmeric, salt, and minimal water until just tender but not mushy.
Grind coconut, green chillies, and cumin seeds to a coarse paste with a little water.
Add the coconut paste to the cooked vegetables and simmer on low heat for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in the yogurt gently without vigorous mixing.
Drizzle coconut oil over the top, add curry leaves, and mix gently.
Serve warm as a side dish with steamed rice as part of a traditional Kerala Sadya.

recipes.name: Appam
recipes.description: Lacy, bowl-shaped fermented rice pancakes with crisp edges and a soft spongy centre, a quintessential Kerala breakfast.
instructions: Soak raw rice for 4-6 hours, then drain.
Grind soaked rice, cooked rice, and grated coconut together to a smooth batter using water as needed.
Dissolve yeast and sugar in a little warm water, add to the batter, mix well, and let it ferment for 6-8 hours.
Add salt and adjust the batter to a thin pouring consistency.
Heat an appam pan (appachatti), grease lightly with coconut oil, pour a ladleful of batter, and swirl the pan to spread it thin along the edges.
Cover and cook on medium-low heat for 2-3 minutes until edges are crisp and lacy while the centre remains thick and spongy.
Serve hot with vegetable stew or coconut milk.

recipes.name: Uttapam
recipes.description: A thick South Indian pancake made with fermented dosa batter topped with onions, tomatoes, and green chillies, often called an Indian pizza.
instructions: Finely chop onion, tomato, green chillies, coriander, and grate the carrot.
Heat a flat griddle or tawa on medium heat and grease lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread it to form a thick circle, unlike the thin dosa.
Immediately scatter chopped onion, tomato, green chillies, grated carrot, and coriander on top, pressing them gently into the batter.
Drizzle oil around the edges and cook on medium heat until the bottom is golden brown.
Flip carefully and cook the other side for 2 minutes.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: Medu Vada
recipes.description: Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, these South Indian savoury doughnuts are made from urad dal batter, deep-fried to perfection.
instructions: Soak urad dal for 4 hours, drain, and grind to a thick fluffy batter without adding too much water.
Add finely chopped green chillies, ginger, curry leaves, onion, crushed peppercorns, asafoetida, and salt to the batter; mix well.
Wet your hands, take a portion of batter, shape it into a ball, flatten it, and poke a hole in the centre to form a doughnut shape.
Heat oil to 170 degrees C in a deep pan.
Gently slide the shaped vadas into the hot oil and fry on medium heat until golden brown on both sides.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: Pongal
recipes.description: A comforting South Indian rice and moong dal porridge tempered with black pepper, cumin, ghee, and cashews, traditionally prepared for the harvest festival.
instructions: Dry roast moong dal until aromatic and lightly golden, then wash together with rice.
Pressure cook rice and dal together with water and salt until very soft and porridge-like.
Heat ghee in a pan, fry cashew nuts until golden and set aside.
In the same ghee, add cumin seeds, crushed black peppercorns, grated ginger, curry leaves, and asafoetida.
Pour the tempering over the cooked rice-dal mixture, add the fried cashews, and mix well.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: Payasam
recipes.description: A rich and creamy South Indian dessert pudding made with vermicelli, milk, sugar, and garnished with fried cashews and raisins in ghee.
instructions: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan, fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden; set aside.
In the same pan, roast vermicelli in the remaining ghee until golden brown and fragrant.
Boil milk in a separate pot, add the roasted vermicelli, and cook on medium-low heat, stirring occasionally.
When the vermicelli is fully cooked and the mixture thickens, add sugar and stir until dissolved.
Add cardamom powder and saffron strands, mix well.
Garnish with the fried cashews and raisins, serve warm or chilled.

recipes.name: Chicken Chettinad
recipes.description: A fiery and aromatic chicken curry from the Chettinad region of Tamil Nadu, known for its freshly ground spice blend and bold black pepper heat.
instructions: Dry roast peppercorns, fennel seeds, dried red chillies, cinnamon, and star anise until aromatic; grind to a fine powder.
Heat oil in a heavy pan, add curry leaves and chopped onions; saute until deep golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and the freshly ground Chettinad spice powder; cook until tomatoes break down.
Add chicken pieces and salt, coat well with the masala, and cook on high heat for 5 minutes.
Add grated coconut, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes until chicken is tender and oil separates.
Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or parotta.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Dum Biryani
recipes.description: A royal Hyderabadi biryani with layers of fragrant basmati rice and spiced marinated meat, slow-cooked under a sealed lid for an aromatic masterpiece.
instructions: Marinate meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, half the mint and coriander, green chillies, and salt for at least 2 hours.
Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes, then parboil in salted water until 70 percent cooked; drain.
Deep fry thinly sliced onions in oil until crisp and dark golden brown to make birista; set aside.
Soak saffron strands in warm milk for 15 minutes.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, spread the marinated meat at the bottom, top with half the fried onions, remaining mint and coriander.
Layer the parboiled rice on top, drizzle saffron milk and ghee, and scatter remaining fried onions.
Seal the pot tightly with dough or aluminium foil, place on very low heat, and cook (dum) for 45 minutes.
Open the lid, gently mix the layers from the bottom, and serve with raita and mirchi ka salan.

recipes.name: Pesarattu
recipes.description: A nutritious Andhra-style green gram crepe, high in protein and naturally gluten-free, typically served with ginger chutney for breakfast.
instructions: Soak whole green moong and rice together for at least 4 hours.
Drain and grind with green chillies, ginger, cumin seeds, salt, and water to a smooth batter.
The batter should be of pouring consistency, slightly thicker than dosa batter.
Heat a flat griddle, pour a ladleful of batter, and spread it in a circular motion to form a thin crepe.
Sprinkle finely chopped onion on top and drizzle oil around the edges.
Cook until the bottom turns crisp and golden, fold and serve hot with allam (ginger) chutney.

recipes.name: Rasam
recipes.description: A thin, tangy, and peppery South Indian soup made with tamarind, tomatoes, and aromatic spices, known for its digestive and comforting properties.
instructions: Cook toor dal until very soft, mash and dilute with water to extract a thin dal water.
Extract tamarind juice by soaking paste in warm water.
Crush peppercorns and cumin seeds coarsely in a mortar and pestle.
Combine tamarind water, chopped tomatoes, rasam powder, crushed garlic, salt, and the dal water in a pot; bring to a boil.
When it starts to froth, add the crushed pepper-cumin mixture and remove from heat immediately (do not over-boil).
Heat ghee, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and asafoetida for tempering; pour over the rasam.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with steamed rice or drink as a soup.

recipes.name: Bengali Fish Curry (Machher Jhol)
recipes.description: A light and aromatic Bengali fish curry with rohu or katla fish in a turmeric and cumin-flavoured tomato broth, an everyday staple in Bengali households.
instructions: Rub fish steaks with a pinch of turmeric and salt; lightly fry in mustard oil until golden on both sides and set aside.
In the same oil, add nigella seeds and let them crackle.
Fry quartered potatoes until light golden, then add sliced onions and cook until soft.
Add turmeric, cumin powder, chilli powder, and chopped tomatoes; cook until tomatoes soften.
Add water, slit green chillies, and salt; bring to a boil and cook potatoes until tender.
Gently add the fried fish, simmer for 5-7 minutes on low heat without stirring to avoid breaking the fish.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
recipes.description: A beloved Bengali sweetened yogurt dessert with caramelised jaggery, set to a creamy custard-like consistency, served chilled in earthen pots.
instructions: Bring milk to a boil in a heavy-bottomed pan, then reduce heat and simmer until it reduces by a third.
In a separate small pan, gently melt the jaggery with a tablespoon of water to make a smooth syrup.
Add the jaggery syrup and sugar to the reduced milk, stir until fully dissolved.
Let the milk cool to lukewarm (around 40 degrees C), then whisk in the yogurt culture and cardamom.
Pour into earthen pots or ceramic bowls, cover, and set in a warm place for 6-8 hours until firmly set.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving chilled.

recipes.name: Sandesh
recipes.description: A delicate Bengali sweet made from fresh paneer (chenna), flavoured with cardamom and saffron, moulded into elegant shapes.
instructions: Bring milk to a rolling boil, add lemon juice gradually while stirring until the milk curdles completely.
Strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth, rinse under cold water to remove the lemony taste.
Hang the chenna for 30 minutes to drain excess whey, then knead it on a clean surface for 8-10 minutes until very smooth.
Cook the chenna with sugar in a non-stick pan on low heat, stirring continuously, until the mixture thickens and pulls away from the sides.
Add cardamom powder and saffron, mix well, and remove from heat.
When cool enough to handle, shape into small rounds or press into moulds.
Garnish with slivered pistachios and refrigerate until set before serving.

recipes.name: Kosha Mangsho
recipes.description: A rich and deeply spiced slow-cooked Bengali mutton curry where the meat is caramelised in a thick onion and ginger masala until dark and intensely flavourful.
instructions: Marinate the goat meat with yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, chilli powder, cumin, and salt for at least 1 hour.
Heat mustard oil until it smokes slightly, then reduce heat; add bay leaves, cardamom, and cinnamon.
Add sliced onions and sugar, fry on medium heat until onions are deeply browned and caramelised.
Add the marinated meat and cook on high heat, stirring frequently, until the meat is well seared and the masala starts sticking to the pan.
Add a splash of water, scrape the bottom, and continue the bhuna (dry roasting) process for 15 minutes.
Add just enough water to cover the meat, bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on very low heat for 45-50 minutes.
Uncover and cook on high heat until the gravy is thick and dark, oil separates, and meat is coated in a glossy masala.
Sprinkle garam masala, serve hot with luchi (deep-fried flatbread) or steamed rice.

recipes.name: Shukto
recipes.description: A traditional Bengali mixed vegetable dish with a distinctive bitter-sweet flavour profile, cooked in a mustard and poppy seed paste with milk.
instructions: Soak poppy seeds for 30 minutes and grind to a smooth paste.
Cut all vegetables into uniform batons; lightly fry bitter gourd slices in ghee until crisp and set aside.
Heat ghee in a heavy pan, add panch phoron and bay leaf; let them crackle.
Add the harder vegetables first (drumstick, raw banana, sweet potato), then brinjal; saute for 3-4 minutes.
Add ginger paste, mustard paste, salt, sugar, and a little water; cover and cook until vegetables are almost tender.
Stir in the poppy seed paste and milk, simmer on low heat for 5 minutes.
Add the fried bitter gourd, mix gently, and serve warm as the first course of a Bengali meal with rice.

recipes.name: Dhokla
recipes.description: A fluffy and spongy steamed savoury cake from Gujarat made with fermented gram flour batter, tempered with mustard seeds and green chillies.
instructions: Mix gram flour, yogurt, water, turmeric, sugar, salt, and lemon juice to a smooth batter; let it rest for 10 minutes.
Add fruit salt (eno) to the batter just before steaming and mix gently until frothy.
Pour the batter into a greased steaming plate and steam on high heat for 15-18 minutes.
Let it cool slightly, then cut into diamond or square pieces.
For the tempering, heat oil, add mustard seeds, slit green chillies, and curry leaves.
Add 3 tablespoons of water and sugar to the tempering, pour evenly over the dhokla pieces.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve with green chutney.

recipes.name: Thepla
recipes.description: A spiced Gujarati flatbread made with whole wheat flour and fenugreek leaves, perfect for travel and packed lunches as it stays fresh for days.
instructions: Wash and finely chop the fenugreek leaves, squeeze out excess moisture.
Combine whole wheat flour, chopped fenugreek, yogurt, turmeric, chilli powder, cumin seeds, sesame seeds, 1 tablespoon oil, and salt.
Knead into a soft pliable dough adding water as needed; rest for 15 minutes.
Divide into small balls, roll each into a thin round disc.
Cook on a hot tawa, applying oil on both sides, until golden brown spots appear.
Serve hot with pickle, yogurt, or enjoy plain as a snack.

recipes.name: Undhiyu
recipes.description: A festive Gujarati mixed vegetable casserole with seasonal winter vegetables, fenugreek dumplings, and a fragrant spice blend, slow-cooked in an earthen pot.
instructions: Make muthia (dumplings) by mixing gram flour, chopped fenugreek leaves, turmeric, salt, and oil into a dough; shape into small rolls and steam for 10 minutes.
Cut all vegetables into chunky pieces; make slits in the small brinjals.
Stuff the brinjals with a paste of coconut, green chillies, coriander-cumin powder, sugar, and salt.
Heat oil in a heavy pot, add the harder vegetables first and the steamed muthia.
Layer the stuffed brinjals and remaining vegetables, sprinkle the remaining spice mix and green garlic.
Cover tightly and cook on very low heat (dum style) for 35-40 minutes, shaking the pot occasionally.
Uncover, gently mix, and serve hot with puri or rotli.

recipes.name: Handvo
recipes.description: A savoury Gujarati baked cake made from a fermented batter of rice, lentils, and vegetables, topped with sesame seeds and tempered with mustard.
instructions: Mix handvo flour with yogurt, water, grated bottle gourd, grated carrot, green chillies, ginger paste, turmeric, and salt into a thick batter; let it ferment for 4-6 hours.
Just before baking, add fruit salt and mix gently until frothy.
Heat oil in a heavy pan or handvo maker, add mustard seeds and sesame seeds.
Pour the batter over the sizzling tempering, spread evenly.
Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes until the bottom is golden, then flip and cook the other side.
Alternatively, bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees C for 35-40 minutes until a skewer comes out clean.
Cut into pieces and serve hot with green chutney.

recipes.name: Khandvi
recipes.description: Delicate Gujarati rolled savoury snack made from a cooked gram flour and buttermilk mixture, tempered with mustard seeds and garnished with coconut.
instructions: Whisk gram flour into buttermilk to form a smooth lump-free mixture; add turmeric, green chilli paste, ginger paste, and salt.
Cook the mixture on medium heat in a non-stick pan, stirring constantly to prevent lumps, for 12-15 minutes until very thick and glossy.
Test by spreading a small amount on a greased surface; if it sets and rolls without cracking, it is ready.
Quickly spread the mixture thinly on greased inverted plates or a flat surface using a spatula.
Let it cool for 5 minutes, then carefully roll each sheet into tight rolls; cut into 2-inch pieces.
For tempering, heat oil, add mustard seeds and sesame seeds; pour over the arranged rolls.
Garnish with grated coconut and chopped coriander, serve as a snack or appetiser.

recipes.name: Dal Baati Churma
recipes.description: A signature Rajasthani trio featuring hard-baked wheat balls (baati) served with a panchmel dal and a sweet crushed wheat dessert (churma) drenched in ghee.
instructions: For baati: mix wheat flour with 2 tablespoons ghee, salt, and water to make a stiff dough; shape into round balls.
Bake baati in a preheated oven at 200 degrees C for 30-35 minutes until hard and golden brown, turning once.
For dal: pressure cook all five dals together with turmeric and water until soft; temper with ghee, cumin, and chilli powder.
For churma: coarsely crush leftover baati (or extra baked wheat balls), mix with melted ghee, powdered sugar, and cardamom.
Break the hot baati open, dip generously in ghee.
Serve the ghee-soaked baati with piping hot dal and sweet churma on the side.

recipes.name: Laal Maas
recipes.description: A fiery Rajasthani red meat curry where mutton is braised with an intense amount of Mathania red chillies and garlic, yielding a deep red, blazing hot gravy.
instructions: Soak dried red chillies in warm water for 20 minutes, then grind to a smooth paste with garlic.
Heat mustard oil in a heavy-bottomed pot until smoking, then reduce heat slightly.
Add bay leaves, cloves, cardamom, coriander seeds, and cumin seeds; let them crackle.
Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown.
Add the goat meat pieces and sear on high heat for 5 minutes until well browned.
Add the red chilli-garlic paste and yogurt, mix well, and cook for 10 minutes until oil separates.
Add water, bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on very low heat for 45-50 minutes until the meat is fall-off-the-bone tender.
The gravy should be deep red and thick; serve with bajra roti or steamed rice.

recipes.name: Gatte Ki Sabzi
recipes.description: A Rajasthani vegetarian curry featuring spiced gram flour dumplings simmered in a tangy yogurt-based gravy, a clever solution from the desert region.
instructions: Mix gram flour with ajwain, turmeric, 1 tablespoon oil, salt, and a little water to form a firm dough; shape into long cylindrical rolls.
Boil water, cook the gatte rolls for 15 minutes until they float; remove and cut into 1-inch pieces, reserving the cooking water.
Whisk yogurt with gram flour (1 tsp) and chilli powder until smooth to prevent splitting.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and asafoetida; let them crackle.
Add the yogurt mixture, coriander powder, and reserved gatte water; stir continuously on low heat until it comes to a gentle simmer.
Add the sliced gatte pieces, simmer for 10 minutes until the gravy thickens.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

recipes.name: Pyaaz Ki Kachori
recipes.description: Crispy deep-fried Rajasthani pastries stuffed with a spiced onion filling, a beloved street food from Jodhpur known for its flaky crust.
instructions: Make the dough by mixing flour, 3 tablespoons oil, salt, and water into a firm but pliable dough; rest for 20 minutes.
For the filling, heat oil, add cumin and fennel seeds, then finely chopped onions and green chillies.
Cook onions until golden and dry, add coriander powder, chilli powder, amchur, and salt; cook until completely dry.
Divide the dough into equal balls, roll each into a small disc, place a spoonful of filling in the centre.
Seal the edges, flatten gently into a round disc without letting the filling burst out.
Deep fry on medium-low heat (do not use high heat) until golden brown and crisp on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with tamarind chutney and green chutney.

recipes.name: Ker Sangri
recipes.description: A traditional Rajasthani desert dish made from dried ker berries and sangri beans cooked with spices, a unique delicacy adapted to the arid Thar region.
instructions: Soak dried ker and sangri separately in water for 6-8 hours or overnight.
Drain and wash thoroughly to remove any bitterness; boil sangri until tender and drain.
Heat mustard oil in a pan until it smokes lightly, then reduce heat.
Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds; let them splutter.
Add the soaked ker and boiled sangri, stir well on medium heat for 5 minutes.
Add turmeric, red chilli powder, coriander powder, amchur, and salt; mix and cook covered on low heat for 15 minutes.
The dish should be dry with the spices coating the ker and sangri well; serve with bajra roti or plain roti.

recipes.name: Roti
recipes.description: A simple and wholesome Indian unleavened whole wheat flatbread cooked on a tawa and puffed directly over an open flame, an everyday staple across India.
instructions: Combine whole wheat flour and salt in a bowl, gradually add water and knead into a soft, smooth dough.
Cover and rest the dough for at least 15 minutes.
Divide into equal-sized balls, dust with flour, and roll each into a thin round disc.
Heat a tawa (flat griddle) on high heat, place the rolled roti on it, and cook until small bubbles appear.
Flip and cook the other side, then place directly over an open flame for a few seconds to puff up.
Brush lightly with ghee and serve hot with any curry or dal.

recipes.name: Puri
recipes.description: Crispy, golden, deep-fried puffed Indian bread made from whole wheat flour, a festive accompaniment to curries and a breakfast favourite with halwa.
instructions: Mix whole wheat flour, semolina, ajwain, salt, and 1 tablespoon oil together.
Add water gradually and knead into a firm dough (firmer than roti dough); rest for 10 minutes.
Divide into small equal balls and roll each into a small round disc about 4 inches in diameter.
Heat oil in a deep kadhai to 180 degrees C.
Gently slide one puri into the hot oil, press lightly with a slotted spoon to help it puff up completely.
Flip and fry for a few seconds until golden on both sides; drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately while hot and puffed with aloo sabzi, chole, or halwa.

recipes.name: Bhatura
recipes.description: Large, soft, and fluffy deep-fried leavened bread from North India, the perfect companion to chole (chickpea curry) in the iconic chole bhature combination.
instructions: Combine flour, semolina, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
Add yogurt, 1 tablespoon oil, and warm water gradually; knead into a soft, smooth, and elastic dough.
Cover with a damp cloth and let the dough rest for 2-3 hours to rise.
Divide into large equal-sized balls, roll each into an oval shape about 6 inches in diameter.
Heat oil in a deep kadhai to 180 degrees C.
Slide a bhatura into the hot oil, press gently with a slotted spoon to puff it up, and fry until golden on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve immediately with chole, pickled onions, and green chutney.

recipes.name: Paneer Butter Masala
recipes.description: A rich and creamy North Indian curry with soft paneer cubes simmered in a velvety tomato-cashew gravy enriched with butter and cream.
instructions: Blanch tomatoes, peel, and blend with soaked cashew nuts to a smooth puree.
Heat butter in a pan, saute chopped onion until soft, add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the tomato-cashew puree, chilli powder, and salt; cook on medium heat for 15 minutes until the gravy thickens and oil separates.
Strain the gravy through a sieve for an extra-smooth texture (optional but traditional).
Return to heat, add sugar and a splash of water to adjust consistency.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes, then stir in cream and garam masala.
Crush kasuri methi between your palms and sprinkle over the top, serve hot with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Methi Thepla
recipes.description: A lightly spiced Gujarati flatbread packed with fresh fenugreek leaves and a blend of gram flour and wheat flour, ideal for travel and tiffin boxes.
instructions: Wash fenugreek leaves thoroughly, chop finely, and squeeze out excess moisture.
Mix both flours, chopped fenugreek, yogurt, turmeric, chilli powder, cumin, ajwain, 1 tablespoon oil, and salt.
Knead into a soft dough using water as needed; let it rest for 15 minutes.
Divide into small balls, roll each into a thin round circle.
Cook on a hot tawa, applying oil on both sides, until light golden spots appear.
Serve hot with pickle, yogurt, or enjoy on their own as a snack.

recipes.name: Mysore Pak
recipes.description: A rich and crumbly South Indian sweet from the royal kitchens of Mysore, made with generous amounts of ghee, gram flour, and sugar.
instructions: Sieve the gram flour to ensure there are no lumps.
Heat 100g of ghee in a pan and keep the rest warm on a low flame.
Make sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in water and heating to a one-string consistency.
Reduce heat and gradually add the gram flour to the sugar syrup, stirring vigorously to avoid lumps.
Keep adding warm ghee, one tablespoon at a time, while continuously stirring on medium heat.
When the mixture becomes frothy, starts leaving the sides of the pan, and ghee pools around the edges, add cardamom powder.
Quickly pour into a greased tray, let it set for 30 minutes, and cut into squares while still warm.

recipes.name: Murgh Malai Tikka
recipes.description: Succulent, creamy chicken tikka marinated in a rich blend of cream, cheese, and aromatic spices, grilled to smoky perfection, a Mughlai delicacy.
instructions: Cut chicken into large cubes and marinate first with lemon juice and salt for 15 minutes.
Mix cream, cream cheese, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, minced green chillies, white pepper, cardamom, mace, cornflour, and salt into a smooth marinade.
Coat the chicken pieces thoroughly in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 2 hours (overnight for best results).
Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers.
Grill in a preheated oven at 220 degrees C or on a charcoal grill for 15-18 minutes, turning once, until charred spots appear.
Baste with melted butter during the last few minutes of cooking.
Serve hot with green chutney, sliced onion rings, and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Prawn Balchao
recipes.description: A tangy, spicy, and slightly sweet Goan prawn pickle-style curry with a vinegar-based masala, influenced by Portuguese culinary traditions.
instructions: Soak dried red chillies in vinegar for 15 minutes, then grind with garlic, ginger, cumin, and peppercorns to a smooth paste.
Season prawns with turmeric and salt; lightly fry until pink and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan, add finely chopped onions and fry until deeply browned.
Add the ground masala paste and cook for 5-7 minutes until oil separates and the masala darkens.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down completely.
Add the fried prawns, sugar, and remaining vinegar; simmer for 5 minutes.
The dish should have a thick, pickle-like consistency; serve with steamed rice or crusty bread.

recipes.name: Mutton Rara
recipes.description: A rich Punjabi-style mutton curry combining tender meat pieces with keema (minced meat) in a spicy tomato and onion gravy for a double-meat indulgence.
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pot, add bay leaves and cardamom, then fry sliced onions until deep golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the goat meat pieces and sear on high heat for 5 minutes.
Add chilli powder, coriander powder, and whisked yogurt; cook on medium heat for 10 minutes.
Add pureed tomatoes and salt, cover and cook on low heat for 30-35 minutes until meat is nearly tender.
Add the minced meat (keema), stir well, and cook for another 15 minutes until both meats are fully cooked and the gravy is thick.
Sprinkle garam masala and fresh coriander, serve hot with naan or rumali roti.

recipes.name: Chicken 65
recipes.description: A spicy, deep-fried chicken dish originating from Chennai, featuring a fiery red marinade with ginger, chillies, and curry leaves, a popular bar snack across India.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chilli powder, lemon juice, salt, and food colour for at least 1 hour.
Add cornflour, rice flour, and beaten egg to the marinated chicken; mix well to form a thick coating.
Heat oil in a deep kadhai to 170 degrees C.
Deep fry the chicken pieces in batches until crispy and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per batch; drain on paper towels.
In a separate pan, heat 2 tablespoons of oil, add slit green chillies and curry leaves; fry for 30 seconds.
Toss in the fried chicken pieces, sprinkle a pinch of chilli powder and lemon juice, and toss well.
Serve hot as a starter garnished with fried curry leaves and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: Classic Roman pasta with eggs, guanciale, Pecorino Romano, and black pepper. A rich and creamy dish made without any cream.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the spaghetti until al dente.
Cut the guanciale into small strips and cook in a cold skillet over medium heat until the fat renders and the meat is crispy.
Whisk together egg yolks, whole eggs, and finely grated Pecorino Romano with generous black pepper.
Drain the pasta, reserving one cup of pasta water.
Toss the hot pasta with the guanciale and rendered fat, removing the pan from heat.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing quickly to create a creamy sauce, adding pasta water as needed.
Serve immediately with extra Pecorino and black pepper on top.

recipes.name: Bucatini all'Amatriciana
recipes.description: A bold Roman pasta featuring bucatini with guanciale, tomato sauce, Pecorino Romano, and a hint of chili. Originally from the town of Amatrice.
instructions: Cut guanciale into small batons and render in a skillet over medium heat until golden and crispy.
Remove guanciale, add chili flakes to the fat, then deglaze with white wine.
Add the crushed San Marzano tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes until thickened.
Cook bucatini in heavily salted boiling water until al dente.
Return the guanciale to the sauce and toss with the drained pasta.
Finish with grated Pecorino Romano and black pepper, tossing to combine.

recipes.name: Cacio e Pepe
recipes.description: Deceptively simple Roman pasta with just three ingredients: tonnarelli pasta, Pecorino Romano cheese, and coarsely ground black pepper.
instructions: Toast whole black peppercorns in a dry skillet, then crush coarsely with a mortar and pestle.
Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until just under al dente, reserving plenty of starchy pasta water.
Add crushed pepper to a large skillet with a ladle of pasta water and let it bloom.
Transfer the pasta to the skillet, tossing and adding pasta water gradually.
Remove from heat and add finely grated Pecorino a little at a time, tossing vigorously to form a creamy emulsion.
Serve immediately with additional Pecorino and pepper.

recipes.name: Spaghetti alla Puttanesca
recipes.description: A punchy Neapolitan pasta sauce made with tomatoes, olives, capers, anchovies, and garlic. Bold and briny flavors in every bite.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet and gently cook sliced garlic until fragrant.
Add anchovy fillets and stir until they dissolve into the oil.
Add chili flakes, olives, and capers, cooking for one minute.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente, then drain.
Toss the pasta with the sauce and finish with chopped fresh parsley.

recipes.name: Ragu alla Bolognese
recipes.description: The authentic slow-cooked meat sauce from Bologna with a soffritto base, mixed meats, wine, milk, and tomato. Best served with tagliatelle or fresh egg pasta.
instructions: Finely dice onion, carrot, and celery to make a soffritto.
Dice the pancetta and cook in olive oil and butter until the fat renders.
Add the soffritto and cook gently for 10 minutes until softened.
Add the beef and pork mince, breaking it up, and brown well.
Pour in red wine and let it evaporate completely.
Add tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, and milk, then season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Reduce heat to the lowest setting, partially cover, and simmer for at least 3 hours, stirring occasionally and adding water if needed.
Serve over fresh tagliatelle with Parmigiano-Reggiano.

recipes.name: Lasagna alla Bolognese
recipes.description: Layers of fresh egg pasta sheets, rich Bolognese meat sauce, creamy bechamel, and Parmigiano-Reggiano baked until golden and bubbling.
instructions: Prepare bechamel by melting butter, whisking in flour, then gradually adding warm milk while stirring constantly until thick and smooth.
Season the bechamel with salt and nutmeg.
If using dried lasagna sheets, blanch briefly in salted boiling water and drain.
Spread a thin layer of bechamel on the bottom of a baking dish.
Layer pasta sheets, Bolognese ragu, bechamel, and grated Parmigiano, repeating for 5-6 layers.
Finish with a layer of bechamel topped with Parmigiano.
Bake at 180C for 45 minutes until golden brown and bubbling.
Let rest for 15 minutes before cutting and serving.

recipes.name: Ricotta and Spinach Ravioli
recipes.description: Delicate handmade pasta parcels filled with creamy ricotta and wilted spinach, served with sage butter sauce.
instructions: Make pasta dough by combining flour and eggs, knead for 10 minutes until smooth, then rest for 30 minutes.
Wilt spinach, squeeze out all moisture, and finely chop.
Mix ricotta, spinach, half the Parmigiano, nutmeg, salt, and pepper for the filling.
Roll the pasta dough very thin and cut into squares, place filling in the center, fold and seal edges.
Cook ravioli in salted boiling water for 3-4 minutes until they float.
Melt butter in a pan, add sage leaves and cook until butter is golden brown.
Toss the ravioli gently in sage butter and serve with grated Parmigiano.

recipes.name: Gnocchi di Patate
recipes.description: Light and pillowy potato dumplings made from starchy potatoes, flour, and egg. Traditionally served with tomato sauce, pesto, or gorgonzola cream.
instructions: Boil potatoes whole in their skins until tender, then peel while hot and rice them onto a clean surface.
Let the riced potatoes cool slightly, then add flour, egg, and salt, mixing gently until just combined.
Roll the dough into long ropes and cut into 2cm pieces, rolling each piece over a fork to create ridges.
Make a quick tomato sauce by sauteing garlic in olive oil, adding crushed tomatoes, and simmering for 15 minutes with basil.
Cook gnocchi in salted boiling water until they float to the surface, about 2 minutes.
Toss the gnocchi with the tomato sauce and serve with grated Parmigiano.

recipes.name: Penne all'Arrabbiata
recipes.description: Fiery Roman pasta with a spicy tomato sauce made with garlic, red chili, and parsley. The name means 'angry' referring to the heat.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and gently fry sliced garlic and crushed dried chili until garlic is golden.
Add crushed San Marzano tomatoes and season with salt.
Simmer the sauce for 15 minutes until slightly thickened.
Cook penne in salted boiling water until al dente.
Toss the drained pasta in the sauce and finish with chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
recipes.description: A midnight staple from Naples featuring spaghetti tossed in garlic-infused olive oil with chili flakes and parsley. Simple perfection.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in generously salted boiling water until al dente.
Meanwhile, thinly slice garlic and gently fry in olive oil over low heat until just golden.
Add chili flakes and cook for 30 seconds.
Drain the pasta, reserving a cup of pasta water, and add it to the garlic oil.
Toss vigorously, adding pasta water to emulsify the sauce.
Finish with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Risotto alla Milanese
recipes.description: The iconic saffron-infused risotto from Milan with a luxurious golden color. Traditionally served alongside osso buco.
instructions: Warm the broth and steep saffron threads in a ladle of hot broth.
Finely dice the onion and sweat in half the butter until translucent.
Add the rice and toast for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour in the white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring frequently and waiting until each addition is absorbed before adding the next.
After about 18 minutes, add the saffron-infused broth.
Remove from heat, stir in remaining butter and Parmigiano-Reggiano, cover and rest for 2 minutes.
Serve immediately on warm plates with a flowing, creamy consistency.

recipes.name: Risotto ai Funghi Porcini
recipes.description: Earthy and aromatic risotto made with dried porcini mushrooms and fresh mushrooms, finished with butter and Parmigiano.
instructions: Soak dried porcini in warm water for 20 minutes, then drain and reserve the soaking liquid.
Slice fresh mushrooms and saute in olive oil with garlic and thyme until golden.
In a separate pan, sweat diced onion in butter, add rice and toast for 2 minutes.
Deglaze with white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth and strained porcini soaking liquid one ladle at a time, stirring frequently.
Add the rehydrated porcini and sauteed mushrooms halfway through cooking.
Finish with butter and Parmigiano, then rest covered for 2 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Risotto ai Frutti di Mare
recipes.description: Luxurious seafood risotto brimming with mussels, clams, shrimp, and calamari in a white wine and fish stock base.
instructions: Clean mussels and clams, steam open in wine and garlic, then remove from shells and reserve the liquid.
Peel and devein shrimp, slice calamari into rings.
Sweat diced shallot in olive oil, add rice and toast for 2 minutes.
Add the strained shellfish cooking liquid and warm fish stock one ladle at a time, stirring frequently.
Saute shrimp and calamari briefly in a separate pan with garlic and halved cherry tomatoes.
Add all seafood to the risotto in the last 3 minutes of cooking.
Finish with olive oil and chopped parsley, serving immediately without cheese.

recipes.name: Pizza Margherita
recipes.description: The queen of Neapolitan pizzas with San Marzano tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella di bufala, basil, and extra virgin olive oil on a thin, charred crust.
instructions: Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water, add flour and salt, and knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Let the dough rise for 2 hours at room temperature, then divide into four balls and rest for 30 minutes.
Crush San Marzano tomatoes by hand with a pinch of salt for the sauce.
Stretch each dough ball by hand into a thin round, leaving a slightly thicker edge.
Spread tomato sauce on the base, tear mozzarella over the top.
Bake in the hottest possible oven (ideally 450C or on a pizza stone at max heat) for 2-3 minutes.
Top with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil before serving.

recipes.name: Pizza Marinara
recipes.description: The oldest Neapolitan pizza, topped simply with tomato, garlic, oregano, and olive oil. No cheese, letting the quality of each ingredient shine.
instructions: Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water, add flour and salt, and knead for 10 minutes until smooth.
Let the dough rise for 2 hours, then divide into four balls and rest.
Crush San Marzano tomatoes by hand with salt.
Stretch each dough ball into a thin round by hand.
Spread tomato sauce on the base, scatter thinly sliced garlic, and sprinkle with oregano.
Bake at the highest oven temperature for 2-3 minutes until the crust is charred and blistered.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Pizza Quattro Formaggi
recipes.description: Indulgent four-cheese pizza topped with mozzarella, gorgonzola, fontina, and Parmigiano-Reggiano. A rich celebration of Italian cheeses.
instructions: Prepare pizza dough by combining flour, water, yeast, and salt, knead well, and let rise for 2 hours.
Divide dough into four balls and rest for 30 minutes.
Stretch each dough ball into a thin round.
Distribute torn mozzarella, crumbled gorgonzola, cubed fontina, and shaved Parmigiano evenly.
Bake at the highest oven temperature for 8-10 minutes until cheese is melted and crust is golden.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve hot.

recipes.name: Minestrone
recipes.description: Hearty Italian vegetable soup thick with beans, pasta, and seasonal vegetables in a tomato broth. Every region and family has its own version.
instructions: Dice all vegetables into small, uniform pieces.
Saute onion, carrot, and celery in olive oil for 5 minutes until softened.
Add garlic, potatoes, zucchini, and green beans, cooking for another 3 minutes.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and enough water to cover the vegetables by 5cm.
Add drained cannellini beans and torn cavolo nero, bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Add the ditalini pasta and cook until tender, about 10 more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, drizzle with olive oil, and serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Ribollita
recipes.description: A thick Tuscan bread soup made with cannellini beans, cavolo nero, and stale bread. It is reboiled the next day, hence the name.
instructions: Blend half the beans with some water to make a puree; keep the rest whole.
Saute diced onion, carrot, and celery in olive oil until softened.
Add garlic, rosemary, tomatoes, and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the bean puree, whole beans, torn cavolo nero, and enough water to cover.
Simmer for 40 minutes until thick and the cavolo nero is very tender.
Tear stale bread into chunks and stir into the soup, letting it absorb the broth.
Let rest, then reheat the next day for the best flavor, drizzling generously with olive oil.

recipes.name: Stracciatella alla Romana
recipes.description: A comforting Roman egg drop soup with whisked eggs, Parmigiano-Reggiano, and semolina stirred into hot chicken broth forming delicate egg ribbons.
instructions: Bring chicken broth to a gentle simmer.
Whisk together eggs, grated Parmigiano, semolina, nutmeg, lemon zest, and a pinch of salt.
Slowly pour the egg mixture into the simmering broth while stirring gently with a fork.
Let the soup simmer for 2-3 minutes until the egg forms delicate shreds.
Serve hot with chopped parsley and extra Parmigiano.

recipes.name: Osso Buco alla Milanese
recipes.description: Braised veal shanks slow-cooked in white wine, broth, and vegetables, finished with a bright gremolata of parsley, garlic, and lemon zest.
instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper, dredge lightly in flour, and brown in butter and olive oil on both sides.
Remove the shanks and saute diced onion, carrot, and celery in the same pan until softened.
Return the shanks to the pan, pour in white wine, and let it reduce by half.
Add crushed tomatoes and enough broth to come halfway up the shanks.
Cover and braise in a 160C oven for 2 to 2.5 hours until the meat is falling off the bone.
Prepare gremolata by mixing chopped parsley, minced garlic, and lemon zest.
Serve the osso buco with its sauce, spooning gremolata over the top.

recipes.name: Saltimbocca alla Romana
recipes.description: Thin veal cutlets wrapped with prosciutto and sage, pan-fried in butter and finished with a white wine sauce. The name means 'jumps in the mouth'.
instructions: Pound the veal escalopes thin between sheets of plastic wrap.
Place a sage leaf on each escalope, top with a slice of prosciutto, and secure with a toothpick.
Lightly dust the veal side with flour.
Heat butter in a large skillet and cook the saltimbocca prosciutto-side down first for 2 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 2 minutes until golden.
Remove the meat, deglaze the pan with white wine, and reduce by half to make a sauce.
Pour the pan sauce over the saltimbocca and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chicken Parmigiana
recipes.description: Breaded and fried chicken cutlets topped with tomato sauce and melted mozzarella and Parmigiano. An Italian-American classic with Southern Italian roots.
instructions: Pound chicken breasts to an even thickness of about 1cm.
Set up a breading station: flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs mixed with Parmigiano.
Coat each chicken breast in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
Fry the breaded chicken in olive oil until golden on both sides, about 3 minutes per side.
Make a quick sauce by simmering crushed tomatoes with garlic and basil for 10 minutes.
Place fried chicken in a baking dish, spoon sauce over each piece, and top with sliced mozzarella.
Bake at 200C for 10-12 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.name: Vitello Tonnato
recipes.description: Chilled sliced roast veal draped in a creamy tuna and caper sauce. A classic Piedmontese summer dish often served as an antipasto.
instructions: Poach the veal in water with wine, carrot, celery, and onion at a gentle simmer for 45-60 minutes until cooked through.
Let the veal cool completely in its cooking liquid, then refrigerate until cold.
Blend tuna, anchovies, 2 tablespoons of capers, mayonnaise, and lemon juice into a smooth sauce.
Slice the cold veal very thinly.
Arrange the slices on a platter and generously coat with the tuna sauce.
Garnish with remaining capers and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

recipes.name: Cioppino
recipes.description: A hearty Italian-American seafood stew from San Francisco's Italian fishing community, brimming with fish, shellfish, and tomatoes.
instructions: Saute diced onion in olive oil until soft, add garlic and chili flakes and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in white wine and reduce by half.
Add crushed tomatoes and fish stock, bring to a simmer, and cook for 20 minutes.
Add the firm fish and calamari rings first, cooking for 5 minutes.
Add mussels, clams, and shrimp, cover, and cook for 5-7 minutes until shellfish open.
Discard any unopened shells, season with salt, and finish with chopped parsley.
Serve in deep bowls with crusty bread for dipping.

recipes.name: Fritto Misto di Mare
recipes.description: A crispy mixed seafood fry of shrimp, calamari, and small fish in a light, airy batter. Served immediately with lemon wedges.
instructions: Clean the calamari and slice into rings, peel and devein the shrimp, and pat all seafood dry.
Mix flour and semolina, then whisk in ice-cold sparkling water to make a light batter.
Heat vegetable oil to 180C in a deep pot.
Dip the seafood in the batter, letting the excess drip off.
Fry in small batches for 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy, without overcrowding the pot.
Drain on paper towels, season immediately with salt, and serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Branzino al Forno
recipes.description: Whole roasted sea bass stuffed with herbs and lemon, baked simply with olive oil and white wine. An elegant yet straightforward Italian fish dish.
instructions: Score the branzino on both sides with diagonal cuts and season inside and out with salt and pepper.
Stuff the cavities with lemon slices, garlic cloves, rosemary, and thyme.
Place the fish in a baking dish, surround with halved cherry tomatoes.
Drizzle with olive oil and pour wine into the bottom of the dish.
Bake at 200C for 20-25 minutes until the flesh is opaque and flakes easily.
Serve whole with the pan juices spooned over the top.

recipes.name: Tiramisu
recipes.description: The iconic Italian dessert layering espresso-soaked ladyfingers with a rich mascarpone cream and dusted with cocoa powder. No baking required.
instructions: Brew strong espresso, let it cool, and mix with rum or Marsala.
Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale and thick, then fold in mascarpone until smooth.
Whip egg whites to stiff peaks and gently fold into the mascarpone mixture.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger into the coffee mixture and arrange in a single layer in a dish.
Spread half the mascarpone cream over the ladyfingers.
Add another layer of dipped ladyfingers and top with the remaining cream.
Refrigerate for at least 6 hours or overnight.
Dust generously with cocoa powder just before serving.

recipes.name: Panna Cotta
recipes.description: Silky Piedmontese cream dessert set with just enough gelatin for a delicate wobble, served with fresh berries or caramel sauce.
instructions: Soak gelatin sheets in cold water until soft.
Split the vanilla bean and scrape the seeds into the cream.
Heat cream, milk, and sugar in a saucepan until just below a simmer, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Remove from heat, squeeze excess water from gelatin, and stir into the warm cream until dissolved.
Pour the mixture into individual molds or glasses.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours until set.
Serve topped with fresh berries or inverted onto plates.

recipes.name: Cannoli Siciliani
recipes.description: Crispy fried pastry tubes from Sicily filled with sweet ricotta cream studded with chocolate chips and pistachios. An iconic Sicilian dessert.
instructions: Mix flour, sugar, salt, and cold butter into crumbs, then add egg and Marsala to form a smooth dough.
Rest the dough for 30 minutes wrapped in plastic.
Roll the dough very thin and cut into circles, wrapping each around a metal cannoli tube.
Deep fry at 180C for 2-3 minutes until golden and blistered, then cool on a rack.
Drain ricotta overnight in cheesecloth, then mix with powdered sugar, chocolate chips, and diced candied peel.
Pipe the ricotta filling into the shells just before serving.
Dip the ends in chopped pistachios and dust with powdered sugar.

recipes.name: Bruschetta al Pomodoro
recipes.description: Grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with diced fresh tomatoes, basil, and extra virgin olive oil. The quintessential Italian appetizer.
instructions: Dice the tomatoes, mix with torn basil, olive oil, salt, and pepper, and let sit for 15 minutes.
Slice the ciabatta into thick slices and grill or toast until golden on both sides.
Rub one side of each toast with a cut garlic clove.
Spoon the tomato mixture generously over the garlic-rubbed toast.
Drizzle with extra olive oil and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Insalata Caprese
recipes.description: A vibrant salad from Capri with thick slices of ripe tomatoes, fresh mozzarella di bufala, and basil dressed with olive oil. The colors of the Italian flag.
instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella into rounds of similar thickness.
Arrange alternating slices of tomato and mozzarella on a serving plate.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle generously with extra virgin olive oil.
Season with flaky sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper and serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Arancini
recipes.description: Crispy deep-fried Sicilian rice balls stuffed with ragu and mozzarella, coated in breadcrumbs. Golden on the outside, molten in the center.
instructions: Cook risotto rice with saffron and broth, stir in butter and Parmigiano, then spread on a tray to cool completely.
Cut mozzarella into small cubes.
Take a handful of cold rice, flatten in your palm, place a spoonful of ragu and a cube of mozzarella in the center.
Close the rice around the filling to form a ball and repeat until all rice is used.
Roll each ball in flour, then beaten egg, then breadcrumbs.
Deep fry at 180C for 3-4 minutes until deep golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.name: Caponata
recipes.description: A Sicilian sweet and sour eggplant relish with tomatoes, capers, olives, and celery in an agrodolce sauce. Served at room temperature.
instructions: Cut eggplant into 2cm cubes, salt generously, and let drain in a colander for 30 minutes.
Fry the eggplant cubes in olive oil until golden, then set aside on paper towels.
Saute sliced celery and onion in olive oil until softened.
Add crushed tomatoes, olives, and capers, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Dissolve sugar in vinegar and add to the sauce for the agrodolce flavor.
Return the eggplant to the pan, stir gently, and cook for 5 more minutes.
Let cool to room temperature, top with toasted pine nuts and basil, and serve.

recipes.name: Focaccia Genovese
recipes.description: Airy and golden Ligurian flatbread dimpled and generously drizzled with olive oil and flaky salt. Light, chewy, and irresistibly aromatic.
instructions: Mix flour, yeast, salt, and water to form a shaggy dough, then add half the olive oil.
Knead for 8 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Let the dough rise in an oiled bowl for 1 hour until doubled.
Pour remaining olive oil into a baking sheet and stretch the dough to fill it.
Dimple the surface deeply with your fingertips, let rise for 30 more minutes.
Sprinkle with flaky salt and bake at 220C for 20-25 minutes until golden.
Let cool slightly and serve warm, torn into pieces.

recipes.name: Eggplant Parmigiana
recipes.description: Layers of fried eggplant slices with tomato sauce, mozzarella, Parmigiano, and basil baked until bubbling. A beloved Southern Italian classic.
instructions: Slice eggplant into 5mm rounds, salt and drain in a colander for 30 minutes, then pat dry.
Dredge the eggplant slices in flour and fry in olive oil until golden on both sides.
Make a quick tomato sauce by simmering crushed tomatoes with garlic, basil, and salt for 15 minutes.
Spread a layer of sauce in a baking dish, then layer fried eggplant, sauce, torn mozzarella, and Parmigiano.
Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, finishing with sauce and cheese.
Bake at 180C for 35-40 minutes until bubbling and golden on top.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Pasta e Fagioli
recipes.description: A thick and rustic Italian soup of pasta and beans in a tomato-based broth. Comfort food at its finest, found across every region of Italy.
instructions: Saute diced onion, carrot, and celery in olive oil with rosemary until softened.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Blend half the beans to a puree and add both the puree and whole beans to the pot.
Add crushed tomatoes and enough water to make a soupy consistency.
Simmer for 20 minutes, then add the ditalini pasta and cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper, drizzle generously with olive oil, and serve.

recipes.name: Orecchiette con Cime di Rapa
recipes.description: Ear-shaped pasta from Puglia tossed with broccoli rabe, garlic, chili, anchovies, and olive oil. A signature dish of Southern Italy.
instructions: Trim and blanch broccoli rabe in salted boiling water for 2 minutes, then remove with a slotted spoon.
Cook orecchiette in the same water until al dente.
Heat olive oil in a large pan, add sliced garlic, chili flakes, and anchovies, cooking until anchovies dissolve.
Add the blanched broccoli rabe and toss in the flavored oil.
Drain the pasta and add it to the pan, tossing everything together with a splash of pasta water.
Serve with a final drizzle of olive oil.

recipes.name: Trofie al Pesto Genovese
recipes.description: Ligurian hand-rolled pasta tossed with authentic basil pesto made with pine nuts, Parmigiano, Pecorino, garlic, and olive oil.
instructions: Pound garlic and coarse salt in a marble mortar, then add pine nuts and crush.
Add basil leaves gradually, grinding against the sides of the mortar in a circular motion.
Stir in grated cheeses, then slowly drizzle in olive oil while mixing to form a creamy pesto.
Cook trofie in salted water with cubed potato and trimmed green beans.
Drain pasta and vegetables, reserving a cup of cooking water.
Toss with the pesto, loosening with pasta water until silky.

recipes.name: Fettuccine Alfredo
recipes.description: Originally from Rome, simple fresh fettuccine tossed with butter and Parmigiano-Reggiano to create a luxuriously creamy emulsion.
instructions: Cook fresh fettuccine in salted boiling water until al dente, reserving a cup of pasta water.
Melt butter in a large warm pan over low heat.
Add the drained fettuccine to the butter and toss vigorously.
Remove from heat and add finely grated Parmigiano a handful at a time, tossing to emulsify.
Add pasta water as needed to create a creamy, glossy sauce that coats each strand.
Serve immediately on warm plates with extra Parmigiano and pepper.

recipes.name: Spaghetti alle Vongole
recipes.description: Neapolitan spaghetti with fresh clams in a garlicky white wine sauce. One of Italy's most celebrated seafood pasta dishes.
instructions: Purge clams in salted water for 30 minutes, then scrub clean.
Heat olive oil in a large pan, add sliced garlic and chili, and cook until fragrant.
Add the clams and white wine, cover, and cook for 5 minutes until clams open.
Remove clams, strain and reserve the cooking liquid.
Cook spaghetti until just under al dente, then transfer to the pan with the clam liquid.
Finish cooking the pasta in the clam juices, return the clams, and toss with parsley.
Serve immediately with a drizzle of olive oil.

recipes.name: Involtini di Melanzane
recipes.description: Thin slices of grilled eggplant rolled around a ricotta and herb filling, baked in tomato sauce. A lighter alternative to eggplant parmigiana.
instructions: Slice eggplants lengthwise into 5mm slices, brush with olive oil, and grill until tender.
Mix ricotta with half the Parmigiano, chopped basil, salt, and pepper.
Place a spoonful of filling at one end of each eggplant slice and roll up tightly.
Make a sauce by simmering crushed tomatoes with garlic and basil for 10 minutes.
Spread sauce in a baking dish, arrange the rolls seam-side down, and top with more sauce and Parmigiano.
Bake at 180C for 20 minutes until heated through and golden on top.

recipes.name: Risotto al Limone
recipes.description: A bright and refreshing lemon risotto from the Amalfi Coast, finished with butter, Parmigiano, and fresh lemon zest and juice.
instructions: Sweat diced shallot in half the butter until translucent.
Add rice and toast for 2 minutes, then pour in wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring frequently for 18 minutes.
Zest all three lemons and juice two of them.
Remove from heat, stir in remaining butter, Parmigiano, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
Cover and rest for 2 minutes, then serve garnished with parsley and extra zest.

recipes.name: Tortellini in Brodo
recipes.description: Tiny ring-shaped pasta from Bologna filled with a mixture of pork, prosciutto, mortadella, and Parmigiano, served in a clear capon broth.
instructions: Make broth by simmering chicken, beef shin, carrot, celery, and onion in water for 3 hours, skimming regularly.
Brown the pork loin, then mince finely with prosciutto and mortadella.
Mix the ground meats with Parmigiano, egg, and nutmeg for the filling.
Make pasta dough with flour and eggs, rest for 30 minutes, then roll very thin.
Cut into small squares, place a tiny amount of filling on each, and fold into the traditional ring shape.
Strain the broth and bring to a gentle simmer.
Cook the tortellini in the broth for 3-4 minutes and serve in bowls with the clear broth.

recipes.name: Acqua Pazza
recipes.description: Neapolitan fish poached in 'crazy water' - a light broth of tomatoes, garlic, white wine, capers, and olives. Simple and elegant.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a wide pan and lightly saute garlic cloves.
Add halved cherry tomatoes, olives, and capers, cooking for 3 minutes.
Pour in white wine and a splash of water, bringing to a simmer.
Season the fish fillets with salt and nestle them into the liquid.
Cover and poach gently for 10-12 minutes until the fish is opaque and flaky.
Scatter with chopped parsley and serve with the broth spooned around the fish.

recipes.name: Gamberi alla Griglia
recipes.description: Grilled whole shrimp marinated in garlic, lemon, olive oil, and herbs. A simple and popular Italian coastal appetizer or main course.
instructions: Butterfly the shrimp by cutting along the back without going all the way through, devein.
Marinate with minced garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, chili flakes, and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat a grill or grill pan to high heat.
Grill the shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and slightly charred.
