Continue cooking on medium-low heat, stirring frequently, for 15-20 minutes until the champurrado thickens to a drinkable porridge consistency.
Remove the cinnamon stick, add vanilla, and serve warm in mugs. Traditionally served alongside tamales.

recipes.name: Pan de Muerto
recipes.description: Orange blossom-scented sweet bread decorated with bone-shaped dough pieces, baked for Day of the Dead celebrations. A deeply symbolic and aromatic Mexican tradition.
instructions: Dissolve the yeast in warm milk with a pinch of sugar. Let stand for 10 minutes until foamy.
In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, and salt. Make a well and add the beaten eggs, yeast mixture, orange blossom water, and orange zest.
Knead the dough, gradually incorporating the softened butter, for 10-12 minutes until smooth, elastic, and slightly tacky.
Place in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place for 1.5 hours until doubled.

Punch down the dough. Reserve about a quarter for decorations. Shape the main dough into a round loaf. Form the reserved dough into bone-shaped strips and a small ball. Arrange the bones across the top of the loaf with the ball in the center.
Let rise again for 45 minutes. Preheat oven to 175C (350F).
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown and the bread sounds hollow when tapped.
Brush the hot bread with melted butter and coat generously with sugar. Let cool before serving.

recipes.name: Conchas
recipes.description: Soft, pillowy Mexican sweet bread rolls topped with a crunchy cookie-like shell scored in a seashell pattern. The most iconic pan dulce found in every Mexican bakery.
instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm milk with a pinch of sugar. Let stand 10 minutes until foamy.
Mix flour, sugar, and salt. Add eggs, yeast mixture, and vanilla. Knead, incorporating softened butter gradually, for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise for 1.5 hours until doubled.

Make the topping: cream together the shortening, powdered sugar, and topping flour until a smooth paste forms. Divide in half and mix cocoa powder into one half for chocolate conchas. Leave the other half vanilla.

Punch down the dough and divide into 12 equal portions. Shape each into a smooth ball. Flatten a portion of topping and press onto the top of each dough ball. Score the topping with a knife in a shell pattern.
Place on lined baking sheets, cover, and let rise 45 minutes. Preheat oven to 175C (350F).
Bake for 18-20 minutes until the bottoms are golden. The topping should remain light in color.
Let cool on a wire rack. Serve with hot chocolate or cafe de olla.

recipes.name: Tacos Dorados
recipes.description: Corn tortillas rolled around a filling of seasoned shredded chicken or potato, then deep-fried until golden and crispy. Served topped with lettuce, crema, and salsa.
instructions: Warm the corn tortillas on a comal until pliable. Place a line of shredded chicken across the center of each tortilla.
Roll each tortilla tightly around the filling and secure with a toothpick.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet to 180C (350F). The oil should be about 2 cm deep.
Fry the rolled tacos in batches, seam-side down first, for 3-4 minutes total, turning occasionally until golden and crispy on all sides.
Drain on paper towels and remove the toothpicks.
Arrange on a platter and top with shredded lettuce, crumbled queso fresco, onion rings, sliced avocado, salsa, and drizzles of crema.
Serve immediately while crispy.

recipes.name: Flautas
recipes.description: Long, tightly rolled flour tortillas filled with shredded beef or chicken and deep-fried until flute-shaped and crunchy. Similar to tacos dorados but made with flour tortillas.
instructions: Place a line of shredded beef along one edge of each flour tortilla.
Roll each tortilla as tightly as possible into a thin flute shape. Secure the end with a toothpick.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet or pot to 180C (350F). The oil should be deep enough to submerge the flautas halfway.
Fry the flautas in batches for 3-4 minutes, turning once, until uniformly golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and remove the toothpicks.
Arrange the flautas on a serving plate. Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, crumbled queso fresco, drizzles of crema, and salsa.
Serve with guacamole on the side.

recipes.name: Chalupas
recipes.description: Small fried corn masa boats from Puebla topped with shredded pork, salsa verde, and diced onion. Crispy, savory, and a beloved antojito of central Mexico.

ingredients.name: lard or vegetable oil for frying

instructions: Mix the masa harina with warm water and salt. Knead until smooth and pliable. Let rest for 10 minutes.
Divide the dough into 12 small balls. Flatten each into an oval disc about 8 cm long and 5 mm thick.
Cook the masa discs on a dry comal for 2-3 minutes per side until cooked through but not crispy.
While still warm, pinch up the edges slightly to form shallow boat shapes.
Heat lard or oil in a skillet. Fry each chalupa for 2-3 minutes until the bottom is golden and crispy while the edges stay soft.
Drain on paper towels. Top half with salsa verde and half with salsa roja.
Add shredded pork, diced onion, and cilantro on top. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Papadzules
recipes.description: Corn tortillas dipped in a vibrant green pumpkin seed sauce, filled with chopped hard-boiled eggs, and drizzled with tomato-habanero oil. A pre-Hispanic Yucatecan delicacy.
instructions: Toast the pumpkin seeds in a dry skillet until puffed and golden. Reserve a few tablespoons for garnish.
Boil the epazote in 500 ml water for 5 minutes. Strain, reserving the green epazote water.
Blend the toasted pumpkin seeds with the warm epazote water until very smooth. The sauce should be pourable but creamy. Season with salt.
Roast the tomatoes and habanero on a comal. Blend until smooth and cook in a little oil for 5 minutes to make the tomato sauce.
Warm the tortillas on a comal. Dip each tortilla in the warm pumpkin seed sauce, fill with chopped egg, and roll up. Arrange seam-side down.
Pour remaining pumpkin seed sauce over the rolled tortillas.
Drizzle the roasted tomato-habanero sauce in a stripe over the top. Garnish with reserved toasted pumpkin seeds. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Coctel de Camaron
recipes.description: Mexican shrimp cocktail served in a tangy tomato-based sauce with avocado, onion, cilantro, and lime. Served cold in a glass, it is a staple at seafood stands along Mexico's coasts.
instructions: If using raw shrimp, poach in boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes until pink. Drain and chill in ice water. If already cooked, skip this step.
In a large bowl, combine the Clamato juice, ketchup, lime juice, hot sauce, and salt. Stir until well mixed.
Add the diced onion, cilantro, serrano chile, and cucumber to the sauce.
Add the cooked shrimp and stir gently to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Serve in tall glasses or bowls, topped with diced avocado. Accompany with saltine crackers and extra hot sauce.

recipes.name: Tacos Gobernador
recipes.description: Griddled flour tortilla tacos filled with shrimp, melted cheese, roasted poblano peppers, and tomato. A famous creation from Sinaloa that has become a nationwide favorite.
instructions: Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saute the onion and garlic for 2 minutes.
Add the chopped shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until just pink.
Add the diced tomatoes and roasted poblano strips. Season with salt, pepper, and lime juice. Cook for 2 more minutes. Set the filling aside.
Wipe the skillet clean. Place a flour tortilla on the hot skillet.
Sprinkle shredded cheese on one half of the tortilla, then add a generous portion of the shrimp filling on top of the cheese.
Fold the tortilla in half and press down gently. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until the tortilla is golden and crispy and the cheese has melted.
Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Serve immediately with salsa and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Tortas Ahogadas
recipes.description: Crusty birote bread rolls stuffed with carnitas and drowned in a spicy chile de arbol tomato sauce. The signature dish of Guadalajara, Jalisco, messy and magnificent.
instructions: Toast the chiles de arbol on a dry comal for 1-2 minutes until fragrant and darkened. Remove stems.
Boil the tomatoes and garlic in water for 10 minutes until soft. Reserve some cooking liquid.
Blend the tomatoes, garlic, toasted chiles de arbol, oregano, vinegar, salt, and enough reserved liquid to make a smooth, pourable sauce.
Strain the sauce into a saucepan and simmer for 10 minutes. Adjust salt and consistency; it should be thin enough to drench the bread.
Slice each birote roll lengthwise. Spread refried beans on the bottom half and fill generously with warm carnitas.
Close the sandwiches and place each in a deep plate or bowl. Ladle the hot chile sauce generously over each torta, drowning it.
Top with pickled onion rings and serve with lime wedges. Eat with a fork and knife, or bravely with your hands.

recipes.name: Kibbeh
recipes.description: Traditional Lebanese croquettes made with bulgur wheat, minced lamb, and warm spices, often served fried or baked.
instructions: Soak bulgur wheat in cold water for 30 minutes, then drain and squeeze out excess moisture.
Finely chop one onion and saute with pine nuts in a little oil until golden. Season with half the spices and set aside as filling.
In a food processor, combine the remaining raw onion, half the lamb, soaked bulgur, and remaining spices. Process until a smooth paste forms.
Take a small portion of the bulgur-lamb shell mixture, form into an oval, make a hollow, and stuff with the pine nut filling.
Seal the kibbeh into a torpedo shape, ensuring no cracks.
Heat oil to 175C and deep-fry kibbeh in batches for 4-5 minutes until deep golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with yogurt or tahini sauce.

recipes.name: Fattoush
recipes.description: A vibrant Lebanese bread salad with crispy pita, fresh vegetables, and a tangy sumac-lemon dressing.
instructions: Tear or cut pita bread into bite-sized pieces, toss with a little olive oil, and bake at 200C for 8-10 minutes until crispy and golden.
Chop romaine lettuce, dice tomatoes and cucumber, thinly slice radishes and green onions.
Roughly chop the fresh mint and parsley.
Whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, sumac, pomegranate molasses, and salt to make the dressing.
Combine all vegetables and herbs in a large bowl.
Add the crispy pita and pour the dressing over. Toss gently and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Manakish
recipes.description: Lebanese flatbread topped with za'atar and olive oil, baked until golden and fragrant. A beloved breakfast staple.

ingredients.name: extra virgin olive oil for topping

instructions: Combine flour, yeast, sugar, and salt. Add warm water and olive oil, then knead for 8 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Cover the dough and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 230C. Divide dough into 6 equal balls.
Roll each ball into a round disc about 20cm in diameter.
Mix za'atar with olive oil to form a paste. Spread generously over each dough round.
Place on baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes until the edges are golden.
Serve warm, folded or flat, with fresh vegetables and labneh.

recipes.name: Kafta
recipes.description: Seasoned Lebanese ground meat skewers with parsley, onion, and warm spices, grilled to perfection.
instructions: Finely chop the onion and parsley, or pulse in a food processor until very fine.
Combine ground lamb and beef with the onion, parsley, and all spices in a bowl.
Knead the mixture vigorously for 3-4 minutes until very well combined and slightly sticky.
Divide into 8 portions and shape each around a flat metal skewer into a long, flat sausage shape.
Preheat grill to high heat. Grill kafta skewers for 3-4 minutes per side until cooked through with nice char marks.
Serve immediately with pita bread, tahini sauce, pickled turnips, and fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Beef Shawarma
recipes.description: Thinly sliced marinated beef layered with warm spices, slow-roasted and served in pita with tahini and pickles.
instructions: Slice beef very thinly against the grain. Grate the onion and mince the garlic.
Combine lemon juice, olive oil, grated onion, garlic, and all spices to make the marinade.
Toss the beef slices in the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 200C. Layer marinated beef on a baking tray and roast for 20 minutes.
Increase heat to the broiler setting and broil for 5-8 minutes until edges are crispy and charred.
Warm pita bread, spread with tahini, and fill with sliced shawarma meat.
Serve with pickled turnips, fresh tomatoes, and garlic sauce.

recipes.name: Chicken Shawarma
recipes.description: Fragrant marinated chicken thighs with Middle Eastern spices, roasted until juicy and served with garlic toum.
instructions: Combine yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, and all spices to create the marinade.
Coat chicken thighs thoroughly in the marinade. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, ideally 4 hours.
Preheat oven to 220C. Arrange chicken on a wire rack over a baking tray.
Roast for 25-30 minutes until deeply golden and cooked through, with an internal temperature of 75C.
Let rest for 5 minutes, then slice thinly against the grain.
Serve in warm pita bread with garlic toum, pickles, tomatoes, and lettuce.

recipes.name: Kebab Koobideh
recipes.description: Classic Persian ground lamb kebabs seasoned with saffron and onion, grilled on flat skewers over charcoal.
instructions: Grate the onions and squeeze out all excess liquid through a fine sieve or cheesecloth.
Grind saffron threads with a pinch of sugar, then dissolve in warm water and set aside.
Combine ground lamb with the squeezed onion, saffron water, salt, pepper, and turmeric.
Knead the mixture for 5 minutes until very smooth and sticky. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Shape the meat onto flat metal skewers in long, flat portions about 2cm wide.
Grill over high heat for 3-4 minutes per side until charred and cooked through.
Serve over saffron-steamed basmati rice with a pat of butter, grilled tomatoes, and a sprinkle of sumac.

recipes.name: Joojeh Kabab
recipes.description: Persian saffron and lemon marinated chicken kababs, grilled until juicy with a beautiful golden crust.
instructions: Grind saffron threads and dissolve in 2 tablespoons of hot water. Set aside to bloom.
Cut chicken into large chunks. Grate the onion and squeeze out excess juice.
Combine saffron water, lemon juice, grated onion, yogurt, olive oil, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 4 hours, ideally overnight in the refrigerator.
Thread chicken onto skewers, alternating with cherry tomatoes.
Grill over medium-high heat for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally and basting with melted butter.
Serve with saffron rice, grilled tomatoes, and fresh herbs.

recipes.name: Ghormeh Sabzi
recipes.description: Iran's beloved herb stew made with a medley of fresh herbs, kidney beans, dried limes, and tender lamb chunks.
instructions: Soak kidney beans overnight, then drain. Finely chop all fresh herbs.
Cut lamb into 3cm cubes. Dice the onions.
Saute the herbs in oil over medium-high heat for 15-20 minutes until dark and fragrant, stirring frequently.
In a separate pot, brown the lamb in oil, then add onions and turmeric and cook until softened.
Add the sauteed herbs, drained kidney beans, and enough water to cover by 2cm.
Pierce the dried limes with a fork and add them to the stew. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered for 2-2.5 hours until lamb is very tender.
Serve over steamed basmati rice with tahdig on the side.

recipes.name: Tahdig
recipes.description: The prized Persian crispy golden rice crust, achieved by steaming basmati rice with butter and saffron.
instructions: Rinse basmati rice in cold water several times until water runs clear. Soak in salted water for at least 1 hour.
Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil. Parboil the soaked and drained rice for 5-6 minutes until just al dente.
Drain rice and rinse gently with cool water to stop cooking.
Grind saffron and dissolve in 3 tablespoons of hot water.
Mix 2 cups of parboiled rice with yogurt and half the saffron water for the crust layer.
Heat butter and oil in a non-stick pot. Spread the yogurt-rice mixture evenly on the bottom, then layer remaining rice on top in a mound.
Poke 5-6 holes with the handle of a spoon, drizzle remaining saffron water over the top, cover with a wrapped lid, and cook on medium-low for 45-50 minutes.
Invert onto a platter to reveal the golden, crispy tahdig crust.

recipes.name: Zereshk Polo
recipes.description: Persian barberry rice with saffron, a jeweled pilaf of tart barberries, fragrant saffron, and butter served with chicken.
instructions: Rinse and soak rice for 1 hour. Rinse barberries and soak in cold water for 15 minutes.
Season chicken with turmeric, salt, and pepper. Saute sliced onion in oil, add chicken, and cook until browned. Add water and simmer until tender.
Parboil rice in salted boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain.
Grind saffron and dissolve in 3 tablespoons hot water.
Layer rice in a pot with butter on the bottom, steam on low heat for 45 minutes with a wrapped lid.
Saute drained barberries in butter with sugar for 2 minutes until glossy. Mix with saffron water.
Serve rice on a platter topped with barberry-saffron mixture alongside the braised chicken.

recipes.name: Fesenjan
recipes.description: Rich Persian pomegranate and walnut stew with tender chicken, balancing sweet and sour flavors in a thick, dark sauce.
instructions: Toast walnuts in a dry pan for 5 minutes, then grind finely in a food processor.
Dice onions and saute in oil until golden. Add turmeric and stir for 1 minute.
Add chicken pieces and brown on all sides for about 5 minutes.
Stir in ground walnuts, pomegranate molasses, cinnamon, sugar, salt, and 500ml water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 1.5-2 hours, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thick and dark.
Adjust seasoning, balancing sweet and sour with more sugar or pomegranate molasses as needed.
Serve over steamed basmati rice, garnished with pomegranate seeds.

recipes.name: Ash Reshteh
recipes.description: A hearty Persian noodle and legume soup loaded with herbs, beans, lentils, and topped with kashk and fried onions.
instructions: Cook green lentils in 2 liters of water for 20 minutes until half tender.
Finely chop all the herbs and spinach. Saute in a large pan with a little oil for 15 minutes.
Add the sauteed herbs, drained chickpeas, and kidney beans to the lentil pot. Add turmeric and salt.
Simmer for 30 minutes, then add the reshteh noodles and cook for another 15-20 minutes.
Thinly slice 2 onions and fry in oil until deeply golden and caramelized for topping.
Fry dried mint in a little oil for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Serve the soup in bowls, topped with kashk, fried onions, and the fried mint oil.

recipes.name: Kuku Sabzi
recipes.description: Persian herb frittata packed with fresh herbs, walnuts, and barberries. Traditionally served for Nowruz celebrations.
instructions: Finely chop all the fresh herbs. Roughly chop the walnuts. Rinse the barberries.
Beat the eggs with turmeric, baking powder, and salt.
Fold the chopped herbs, walnuts, and barberries into the egg mixture.
Melt butter in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Pour in the herb-egg mixture.
Cook on the stovetop for 5 minutes until the bottom sets, then transfer to a preheated oven at 180C.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until firm and golden on top.
Let cool slightly, then slice into wedges and serve with yogurt and flatbread.

recipes.name: Mirza Ghasemi
recipes.description: Smoky northern Persian dish of charred eggplant mashed with tomatoes, garlic, and eggs.
instructions: Char eggplants directly over a gas flame or under a hot broiler, turning until completely blackened and soft inside, about 15-20 minutes.
Peel the charred skin off the eggplants and mash the flesh, discarding excess liquid.
Dice tomatoes. Mince the garlic cloves.
Saute garlic in oil until golden, add turmeric, then add diced tomatoes. Cook for 10 minutes until tomatoes break down.
Add the mashed eggplant, salt, and pepper. Cook and stir for 10 minutes.
Crack eggs into the mixture and stir gently until eggs are just set.
Serve warm or at room temperature with flatbread.

recipes.name: Koshari
recipes.description: Egypt's national comfort dish layering rice, lentils, macaroni, and chickpeas topped with spicy tomato sauce and crispy onions.
instructions: Cook lentils in salted water for 15-20 minutes until tender but not mushy. Drain and set aside.
Cook rice separately and cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain both.
Thinly slice onions and deep-fry in oil until dark golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Make the tomato sauce: saute minced garlic, add passata, cumin, chili flakes, and salt. Simmer 10 minutes.
Make the vinegar-garlic dakka: heat vinegar with extra minced garlic and chili flakes.
Layer on a serving platter: rice on the bottom, then lentils, then macaroni, then warmed chickpeas.
Pour tomato sauce over the top, drizzle with dakka, and pile crispy fried onions on top.

recipes.name: Ful Medames
recipes.description: Ancient Egyptian slow-cooked fava beans mashed with garlic, lemon, and cumin, drizzled with olive oil.
instructions: Drain and rinse the fava beans, reserving some of the liquid.
Place beans in a pot with minced garlic and a splash of reserved liquid. Heat gently for 10 minutes.
Mash about half the beans with a fork, leaving some whole for texture.
Stir in lemon juice, cumin, salt, and chili flakes.
Serve in a shallow bowl, drizzled generously with olive oil, topped with diced tomato and chopped parsley.
Accompany with warm pita bread and pickled vegetables.

recipes.name: Molokhia
recipes.description: Traditional Egyptian jute leaf stew cooked in a fragrant garlic-coriander broth, served with rice and chicken.
instructions: Boil the whole chicken in salted water until fully cooked, about 45 minutes. Reserve the broth and shred the chicken.
Bring the chicken broth to a boil and add the frozen molokhia leaves, stirring well.
Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent clumping.
Prepare the taq'liya: crush garlic and fry in ghee with ground coriander until golden and very fragrant.
Pour the sizzling garlic-coriander mixture into the molokhia pot. Stir well and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for another 5 minutes. The soup should be slightly thick and glossy.
Serve the molokhia over steamed rice with shredded chicken on the side.

recipes.name: Hawawshi
recipes.description: Egyptian spiced meat stuffed into pita bread and baked until crispy. A beloved Egyptian street food.
instructions: Finely dice the onion, bell pepper, tomato, and parsley. Mince the garlic.
Mix ground beef with all the diced vegetables, garlic, baharat, chili flakes, and salt.
Cut each pita in half to create a pocket. Stuff generously with the meat mixture.
Brush the outside of each stuffed pita with oil.
Preheat oven to 220C. Place stuffed pitas on a baking tray.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until the bread is crispy and golden and the meat is cooked through.
Serve hot with tahini sauce and a fresh salad.

recipes.name: Basbousa
recipes.description: Sweet Egyptian semolina cake soaked in fragrant sugar syrup, topped with almonds and scented with rose water.
instructions: Make the syrup first: boil 250g sugar with 200ml water, add lemon juice and rose water. Simmer 10 minutes, then cool.
Mix semolina, 150g sugar, coconut, and baking powder in a bowl.
Add yogurt and melted butter. Stir until well combined. Let rest for 15 minutes.
Grease a baking pan with tahini. Spread the batter evenly.
Score into diamond shapes and press an almond into the center of each piece.
Bake at 180C for 25-30 minutes until golden brown on top.
Immediately pour the cooled syrup over the hot cake. Let it absorb for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Om Ali
recipes.description: Egyptian bread pudding made with puff pastry, milk, nuts, raisins, and coconut, baked until bubbly and golden.
instructions: Bake puff pastry at 200C until golden and flaky, about 15 minutes. Let cool and break into rough pieces.
Scatter pastry pieces in a large baking dish. Top with roughly chopped nuts, raisins, and coconut.
Heat milk with sugar and vanilla until sugar dissolves and milk is hot but not boiling.
Pour the hot milk mixture over the pastry and nuts. Let it soak for 5 minutes.
Drizzle heavy cream over the top and sprinkle with cinnamon.
Bake at 200C for 15-20 minutes until the top is golden and bubbly.
Serve warm in bowls.

recipes.name: Masgouf
recipes.description: Iraq's national dish of butterflied carp grilled over wood fire, seasoned with tamarind and spices.
instructions: Butterfly the fish by cutting along the belly and opening it flat, keeping the back intact.
Mix tamarind paste, olive oil, turmeric, curry powder, and salt into a marinade. Rub all over the fish.
Slice tomatoes and onions into thick rings.
Place fish skin-side toward the heat source on a grill. Cook slowly over medium heat for 30 minutes.
Arrange tomato and onion slices around the fish during the last 15 minutes of grilling.
Flip the fish carefully for the last 5 minutes to crisp the flesh side.
Squeeze fresh lemon over the fish and serve with flatbread and pickled mango.

recipes.name: Mujaddara
recipes.description: Humble but delicious Middle Eastern comfort food of lentils and rice topped with deeply caramelized onions.
instructions: Cook lentils in 600ml salted water for 15 minutes until just tender. Drain, reserving the cooking liquid.
Thinly slice all the onions. Fry two-thirds of the sliced onions in olive oil over medium heat for 25-30 minutes until deeply caramelized and crispy.
Remove crispy onions and set aside. In the same oil, saute remaining onion until soft.
Add rice, cumin, coriander, and cinnamon. Toast for 2 minutes.
Add the cooked lentils and 400ml of the reserved lentil water. Bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook for 18 minutes until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Fluff with a fork and serve topped generously with the crispy caramelized onions and a side of yogurt.

recipes.name: Bamia
recipes.description: Middle Eastern lamb and okra stew in a rich tomato-based sauce flavored with garlic and coriander.
instructions: Cut lamb into cubes. Dice the onion and mince the garlic.
Brown lamb in olive oil over high heat. Remove and set aside.
Saute onion until soft, then add garlic and ground coriander. Cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato paste and stir for another minute. Add canned tomatoes and the browned lamb.
Add enough water to just cover, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes.
Add the okra and lemon juice. Simmer for another 30 minutes until lamb is tender and okra is cooked.
Serve over steamed rice or with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Kabsa
recipes.description: Saudi Arabian spiced rice dish with tender chicken, tomatoes, and a fragrant blend of cardamom, cloves, and saffron.
instructions: Cut chicken into pieces and season with baharat and salt. Brown in oil and set aside.
In the same pot, saute diced onion until golden. Add minced garlic and tomato paste, stir for 1 minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, cardamom, dried limes, and remaining baharat. Cook for 5 minutes.
Return chicken to pot, add enough water to cover, and simmer for 25 minutes.
Remove chicken. Measure the broth - you need about 900ml. Add soaked and drained rice to the pot.
Top with saffron dissolved in water. Cover tightly and cook on low for 18 minutes until rice is tender.
Serve rice on a platter with chicken on top, garnished with raisins and toasted almonds.

recipes.name: Mansaf
recipes.description: Jordan's national dish of lamb cooked in a fermented dried yogurt sauce (jameed), served over rice and flatbread.
instructions: Soak jameed in warm water for several hours until dissolved. Blend until smooth.
Boil lamb pieces with onion, cardamom, baharat, turmeric, and salt for 1 hour until tender.
Strain and reserve the lamb broth. Add dissolved jameed to 500ml of the broth in a pot.
Bring the jameed sauce to a gentle simmer, stirring constantly in one direction to prevent curdling.
Add the cooked lamb to the sauce and simmer gently for 20 minutes.
Cook rice in the remaining broth with butter until fluffy. Toast pine nuts and almonds in butter.
Assemble: lay flatbread on a large platter, top with rice, then lamb, pour sauce over, and garnish with toasted nuts and parsley.

recipes.name: Maqluba
recipes.description: Palestinian upside-down rice and vegetable cake with layers of fried eggplant, cauliflower, and spiced chicken.
instructions: Slice eggplant, salt, and let drain for 20 minutes. Fry until golden. Break cauliflower into florets and fry until golden.
Season chicken with baharat, turmeric, cinnamon, and salt. Brown in oil and add enough water to make a broth. Simmer until cooked. Strain and reserve broth.
Soak rice for 30 minutes, then drain.
Layer a heavy pot: chicken on the bottom, then fried eggplant, then cauliflower, then rice on top.
Pour the reserved hot chicken broth over the rice (you need about 800ml). The liquid should cover the rice by 1cm.
Bring to a boil, then cover tightly and cook on very low heat for 30 minutes.
Remove from heat and let rest 10 minutes. Place a large platter over the pot and flip upside down. Toast pine nuts and scatter on top.

recipes.name: Knafeh
recipes.description: Beloved Palestinian cheese pastry made with shredded kataifi dough, stretchy cheese, and orange blossom sugar syrup.
instructions: Soak akkawi cheese in water for several hours, changing water frequently to remove salt. Shred or slice thinly.
Make syrup: boil sugar and water with lemon juice for 10 minutes. Add orange blossom water and cool completely.
Shred kataifi dough finely. Mix with melted butter and food coloring until evenly coated.
Press half the buttered dough into a round baking pan in an even layer.
Spread the cheese evenly over the dough layer. Top with the remaining dough, pressing down firmly.
Bake at 180C for 25-30 minutes until the top and bottom are golden and crispy.
Immediately flip onto a serving plate and drizzle with cold syrup. Garnish with crushed pistachios. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Ma'amoul
recipes.description: Delicate shortbread cookies filled with dates, walnuts, or pistachios, scented with rose water and dusted with powdered sugar.
instructions: Mix both semolinas with sugar. Add melted butter and oil, rubbing with fingers until evenly coated. Let rest overnight or at least 2 hours.
Add yeast dissolved in a little warm water, rose water, and orange blossom water. Knead briefly until dough holds together.
Prepare date filling: pit and mash dates with a little butter and cinnamon. Prepare walnut filling: chop walnuts and mix with sugar and cinnamon.
Take a walnut-sized ball of dough, hollow it out, fill with a teaspoon of filling, and seal closed.
Shape or press into a ma'amoul mold, then tap out onto a baking sheet.
Bake at 170C for 18-20 minutes until just barely golden on the bottom. Do not over-bake.
Cool completely, then dust generously with powdered sugar.

recipes.name: Halva
recipes.description: Dense, crumbly Middle Eastern confection made from tahini and sugar syrup, often studded with pistachios.
instructions: Stir tahini well until smooth and at room temperature.
Combine sugar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook until it reaches 120C on a candy thermometer.
Remove sugar syrup from heat. Immediately pour the hot syrup into the tahini while stirring vigorously.
Add vanilla extract and fold in roughly chopped pistachios.
Pour the mixture into a parchment-lined loaf pan, pressing down firmly.
Let cool completely at room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours until set.
Slice and serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Baklava
recipes.description: Layers of buttery phyllo pastry filled with chopped nuts and drenched in rose-scented honey syrup.
instructions: Make syrup: boil sugar and water with lemon juice for 10 minutes. Add rose water and orange blossom water. Cool completely.
Chop pistachios and walnuts coarsely. Mix with cinnamon and cloves.
Melt butter. Brush a baking pan with butter. Layer 10 sheets of phyllo, brushing each with butter.
Spread half the nut mixture evenly. Add 5 more buttered phyllo sheets.
Spread remaining nuts, then top with 10 more buttered phyllo sheets.
Cut into diamond shapes with a sharp knife before baking. Bake at 160C for 40-45 minutes until deep golden.
Immediately pour cold syrup over the hot baklava. Let it absorb for several hours before serving.

recipes.name: Hummus
recipes.description: Creamy Levantine dip of blended chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic, swirled with olive oil.
instructions: Drain and rinse chickpeas. For extra-smooth hummus, rub chickpeas between your hands to remove the skins.
Process tahini and lemon juice in a food processor for 2 minutes until thick and whipped.
Add garlic, salt, and cumin. Process for another minute.
Add chickpeas and process for 2 minutes, scraping down sides.
With the processor running, drizzle in ice water until the hummus is very smooth and light.
Serve in a shallow bowl with a well in the center, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with paprika.

recipes.name: Falafel
recipes.description: Crispy, golden fried patties made from ground chickpeas and fresh herbs, a staple street food across the Middle East.
instructions: Soak dried chickpeas in water for 18-24 hours. Do not use canned chickpeas. Drain well.
Place soaked chickpeas, onion, herbs, garlic, and spices in a food processor. Pulse until finely ground but not a paste.
Transfer to a bowl, add baking powder, mix, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Shape mixture into small patties or balls about 4cm wide, pressing firmly.
Heat oil to 175C. Fry falafel in batches for 3-4 minutes until deep golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels. Serve in pita bread with tahini sauce, pickled turnips, and fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Tabbouleh
recipes.description: Classic Lebanese herb salad starring finely chopped parsley, mint, tomatoes, and bulgur in a zesty lemon-olive oil dressing.
instructions: Soak bulgur in boiling water for 10 minutes, then drain well and squeeze out excess moisture.
Very finely chop the parsley (it should be the star of the salad). Finely chop the mint.
Dice tomatoes finely and drain excess juice. Thinly slice green onions.
Combine bulgur, parsley, mint, tomatoes, and green onions in a bowl.
Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and allspice together.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently. Let sit 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Baba Ganoush
recipes.description: Smoky roasted eggplant dip blended with tahini, garlic, and lemon juice, drizzled with olive oil and pomegranate seeds.
instructions: Char whole eggplants directly over a gas flame or under a broiler until completely blackened and collapsed, about 20 minutes.
Let cool, then peel off the charred skin. Place flesh in a colander and let drain for 15 minutes.
Mash eggplant flesh with a fork, keeping some texture.
Stir in tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt.
Spread on a plate, drizzle with olive oil, and garnish with pomegranate seeds and chopped parsley.
Serve with warm pita bread.

recipes.name: Labneh
recipes.description: Thick and creamy strained yogurt cheese, served with olive oil, za'atar, and warm bread for dipping.
instructions: Mix yogurt with salt until evenly combined.
Line a fine-mesh strainer with cheesecloth and set over a bowl. Pour in the yogurt.
Gather the cheesecloth edges, tie, and refrigerate for 24-48 hours, draining whey occasionally.
The longer you strain, the thicker the labneh becomes.
Transfer to a serving plate, make a well in the center, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with za'atar.
Serve with warm pita or flatbread and fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Stuffed Grape Leaves
recipes.description: Tender grape leaves rolled around a spiced rice and lamb filling, braised slowly in lemon juice.
instructions: Rinse grape leaves and blanch briefly in boiling water. Drain and pat dry.
Soak rice for 15 minutes, then drain. Mix with ground lamb, diced tomato, finely diced onion, chopped herbs, spices, and salt.
Place a grape leaf flat, vein-side up. Put a tablespoon of filling near the stem end.
Fold the sides inward and roll tightly from the stem to the tip.
Line the bottom of a heavy pot with extra grape leaves. Pack the rolled leaves tightly in layers.
Pour lemon juice, olive oil, and enough water to just cover. Place a heavy plate on top to keep them submerged.
Bring to a boil, then simmer on low heat for 75-90 minutes until rice is cooked and leaves are tender. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Lamb Tagine with Prunes and Almonds
recipes.description: Moroccan slow-cooked lamb stew with prunes, almonds, and a fragrant blend of cinnamon, ginger, and saffron.
instructions: Cut lamb into large chunks. Season with cinnamon, ginger, saffron, and salt.
Brown lamb in olive oil in a tagine or heavy pot. Remove and set aside.
Saute sliced onions in the same pot until softened, about 8 minutes.
Return lamb, add 400ml water, and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 1.5 hours until very tender.
Add prunes and honey during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Toast almonds in a dry pan until golden.
Serve the tagine garnished with toasted almonds and sesame seeds alongside couscous.

recipes.name: Harira
recipes.description: Hearty Moroccan tomato-based soup with lentils, chickpeas, and lamb, traditionally served to break the fast during Ramadan.
instructions: Cut lamb into small cubes. Dice onion and celery.
In a large pot, combine lamb, onion, celery, spices, and a little oil. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add canned tomatoes, lentils, and 1.5 liters of water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 40 minutes until lentils and lamb are tender.
Add drained chickpeas, vermicelli, and chopped herbs. Cook for 10 more minutes.
Stir in lemon juice and adjust seasoning.
Serve hot with fresh lemon wedges and dates on the side.

recipes.name: Pastilla
recipes.description: Exquisite Moroccan pie with layers of spiced shredded chicken, toasted almonds, and eggs wrapped in crispy warqa pastry.
instructions: Simmer chicken with diced onion, saffron, ginger, cinnamon, cilantro, and salt in 400ml water for 30 minutes. Shred chicken and reduce the broth.
Scramble eggs in the reduced broth until just set, creating a soft custard-like mixture.
Toast almonds and grind coarsely. Mix with sugar and cinnamon.
Butter a round baking pan. Layer 6 sheets of phyllo, brushing each with melted butter, letting edges overhang.
Layer the almond mixture, then the egg mixture, then the shredded chicken.
Fold overhanging phyllo inward, top with 4 more buttered sheets, and tuck edges under.
Bake at 180C for 30-35 minutes until golden. Dust with powdered sugar and cinnamon in a decorative pattern.

recipes.name: Fattet Hummus
recipes.description: Layered Lebanese breakfast dish with crispy pita, warm chickpeas, tangy yogurt sauce, and toasted pine nuts.
instructions: Toast or fry pita bread pieces until golden and crispy. Place in the bottom of a serving dish.
Warm chickpeas in their liquid with a pinch of cumin and salt. Drain and spoon over the pita.
Mix yogurt with tahini, minced garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth.
Pour the yogurt-tahini sauce over the warm chickpeas.
Toast pine nuts in butter until golden brown.
Pour the sizzling butter and pine nuts over the yogurt layer. Sprinkle with paprika.
Serve immediately while the layers are still warm.

recipes.name: Shish Tawook
recipes.description: Lebanese garlic-marinated chicken skewers, grilled until charred and juicy, served with garlic cream sauce.
instructions: Cut chicken into 3cm cubes.
Mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, tomato paste, olive oil, and all spices to make the marinade.
Coat chicken thoroughly in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, ideally overnight.
Thread marinated chicken onto skewers.
Grill over medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes, turning every 3 minutes, until charred and cooked through.
Serve with garlic toum, pita bread, pickled vegetables, and French fries.

recipes.name: Sambousek
recipes.description: Lebanese fried pastry turnovers stuffed with spiced ground meat, pine nuts, and onions.
instructions: Make the dough: combine flour, salt, oil, and warm water. Knead until smooth. Rest for 30 minutes.
Cook the filling: saute diced onion, add ground beef, pine nuts, baharat, and cinnamon. Cook until meat is browned.
Roll out the dough thinly and cut into 10cm circles.
Place a tablespoon of filling on one half of each circle. Fold over and seal edges firmly with a fork.
Heat oil to 175C. Fry sambousek in batches for 3-4 minutes until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Sfiha
recipes.description: Lebanese open-faced meat pies topped with seasoned lamb, tomatoes, and a hint of pomegranate molasses.
instructions: Make dough: combine flour, yeast, sugar, salt, olive oil, and warm water. Knead until smooth. Let rise 1 hour.
Make topping: mix ground lamb with finely diced tomato, diced onion, pomegranate molasses, baharat, and salt.
Divide dough into 18-20 small balls. Roll each into a thin circle about 10cm across.
Place a spoonful of meat mixture on each circle and spread to the edges, leaving a tiny border.
Top with a few pine nuts. Some can be pinched into a boat shape.
Bake at 220C for 12-15 minutes until the dough is golden and the meat is cooked.
Serve hot with a squeeze of lemon and fresh mint.

recipes.name: Kibbeh Bil Sanieh
recipes.description: Baked kibbeh tray with two layers of bulgur-lamb shell encasing a spiced meat and pine nut filling.
instructions: Soak bulgur for 30 minutes. Drain and squeeze out moisture.
Process soaked bulgur, lean lamb, 1 grated onion, and half the spices in a food processor until a smooth paste forms. This is the kibbeh shell.
Make the filling: saute 2 diced onions in butter, add filling lamb and pine nuts. Cook until browned. Season with remaining spices.
Oil a baking tray. Press half the kibbeh shell mixture into the tray in an even layer.
Spread the cooked filling evenly over the first layer.
Press the remaining kibbeh shell on top as an even layer. Score into diamond shapes and drizzle generously with olive oil.
Bake at 180C for 30-35 minutes until golden brown and crispy on top. Let rest 10 minutes before cutting along the scored lines.

recipes.name: Musakhan
recipes.description: Palestinian sumac chicken with deeply caramelized onions, served atop taboon bread and drizzled with olive oil.
instructions: Season chicken with 2 tablespoons sumac, allspice, salt, and pepper. Marinate for 30 minutes.
Thinly slice all 5 onions. Slowly cook in 80ml olive oil over medium-low heat for 30-40 minutes until deeply caramelized and jammy.
Stir remaining sumac into the caramelized onions. The onions should be dark and very soft.
Brown the marinated chicken in the remaining olive oil. Then bake at 200C for 25 minutes until cooked through.
Place bread on a baking sheet. Spread a thick layer of sumac onions on each bread. Top with chicken pieces.
Bake for another 5-10 minutes until bread is slightly crispy.
Toast pine nuts and scatter over the top. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Arayes
recipes.description: Grilled pita stuffed with seasoned ground meat, a popular Lebanese and Syrian street food with crispy, charred edges.
instructions: Mix ground lamb with finely diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, baharat, allspice, salt, and pepper.
Cut each pita in half. Open each half to create a pocket.
Stuff each pita half generously with the meat mixture, pressing flat and spreading evenly.
Brush the outside of each stuffed pita with olive oil.
Grill on a hot grill or in a grill pan for 4-5 minutes per side until the bread is crispy and the meat is cooked through.
Cut into triangles and serve with tahini sauce, lemon wedges, and fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Makdous
recipes.description: Syrian pickled baby eggplants stuffed with walnuts, garlic, and red pepper, preserved in olive oil.
instructions: Trim stems from baby eggplants. Boil in salted water for 8-10 minutes until slightly softened but still firm.
Drain and press eggplants under a heavy weight for 24 hours to remove all moisture.
Finely chop walnuts and mince garlic. Mix with red pepper flakes and 1 tablespoon salt.
Make a slit in each eggplant and stuff generously with the walnut-garlic mixture.
Pack stuffed eggplants tightly into sterilized jars, pressing down firmly.
Cover completely with olive oil, ensuring no air pockets. Seal jars tightly.
Store in a cool dark place for at least 2 weeks before eating. Once opened, refrigerate.

recipes.name: Fatteh
recipes.description: Layered Syrian-Lebanese dish of crispy pita, warm chickpeas, and garlicky yogurt topped with toasted nuts and spiced butter.
instructions: Tear pita into pieces and bake or fry until golden and crispy. Spread in a serving dish.
Warm chickpeas with their liquid, a pinch of cumin, and salt. Drain and spoon over the pita.
Whisk yogurt with tahini, crushed garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth and creamy.
Pour the yogurt sauce generously over the warm chickpeas.
Melt butter in a small pan, toast pine nuts until golden. Add paprika.
Drizzle the spiced butter and pine nuts over the yogurt layer. Garnish with chopped parsley.
Serve immediately while the bottom layers are still warm and the pita retains its crunch.

recipes.name: Shorbet Adas
recipes.description: Velvety Middle Eastern red lentil soup flavored with cumin, lemon, and a hint of turmeric, garnished with crispy pita croutons.
instructions: Dice onion and carrot. Mince garlic.
Saute onion in olive oil until soft. Add garlic, cumin, and turmeric. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add rinsed red lentils, diced carrot, and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until lentils are completely soft and falling apart.
Blend with an immersion blender until smooth and velvety. Add more broth if too thick.
Stir in lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil, a pinch of cumin, and crispy pita chips on the side.

recipes.name: Nasi Goreng
recipes.description: Indonesian fried rice with sweet soy sauce, shrimp paste, and aromatic spices, topped with a fried egg.
instructions: Mince shallots, garlic, and chilies into a paste using a mortar and pestle.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat and stir-fry the paste with shrimp paste for 1 minute.
Add diced chicken breast and cook until no longer pink, about 3 minutes.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until pink, about 2 minutes.
Add the cold cooked rice, breaking up clumps, and stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Pour in kecap manis and toss until rice is evenly coated and slightly caramelized.
Fry eggs sunny-side up in a separate pan.
Serve rice topped with fried egg and sliced green onions.

recipes.name: Mie Goreng
recipes.description: Indonesian stir-fried noodles tossed with vegetables, egg, and a savory-sweet sauce.
instructions: Cook egg noodles according to package directions, drain, and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat and sauté minced garlic and shallots until fragrant.
Add sliced chicken thigh and cook until browned, about 4 minutes.
Push chicken to the side, crack eggs into the wok, and scramble.
Add shredded cabbage, julienned carrots, and sliced celery, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Toss in the cooked noodles, pour kecap manis and soy sauce over everything.
Stir-fry vigorously for 2 minutes until noodles are well coated and slightly charred.

recipes.name: Rendang
recipes.description: Slow-cooked dry beef curry from West Sumatra, simmered in coconut milk and a rich spice paste until deeply caramelized.
instructions: Blend shallots, garlic, soaked dried chilies, galangal, and turmeric into a smooth paste.
Cut beef chuck into large cubes and place in a heavy pot or Dutch oven.
Add the spice paste, coconut milk, bruised lemongrass, and kaffir lime leaves to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered, stirring occasionally.
After about 2 hours, the sauce will thicken; add toasted coconut and tamarind paste.
Continue cooking on low heat, stirring frequently, until the liquid is almost gone and the meat is dark and tender.
The rendang is ready when the oil separates and the meat is coated in the dry, caramelized spice paste.

recipes.name: Satay Ayam
recipes.description: Grilled chicken skewers marinated in turmeric and spices, served with a rich peanut dipping sauce.
instructions: Cut chicken into small cubes and marinate with turmeric, coriander, minced lemongrass, and a splash of kecap manis for 1 hour.
Soak bamboo skewers in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning.
Thread marinated chicken onto skewers, about 4-5 pieces per skewer.
Blend peanuts, shallots, garlic, chilies, palm sugar, and coconut milk into a thick sauce.
Simmer the peanut sauce in a small pot for 5 minutes, adding water to reach desired consistency.
Grill the skewers over high charcoal or gas heat for 3-4 minutes per side until charred.
Serve skewers with warm peanut sauce and sliced shallots on the side.

recipes.name: Gado-Gado
recipes.description: Indonesian salad of blanched vegetables, tofu, and hard-boiled eggs, dressed in a creamy peanut sauce.
instructions: Blanch green beans, cabbage, and bean sprouts separately in boiling water until just tender, then drain.
Fry tofu cubes in oil until golden and crispy on all sides, then drain on paper towels.
Grind peanuts, garlic, and chilies in a mortar, then mix with palm sugar, tamarind, kecap manis, and warm water to form a sauce.
Slice cucumber into rounds and arrange all vegetables on a serving platter.
Top with fried tofu cubes.
Pour the peanut sauce generously over the vegetables and tofu.
Garnish with crushed prawn crackers and serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Soto Ayam
recipes.description: Aromatic Indonesian chicken soup with turmeric broth, rice vermicelli, and fresh herb garnishes.
instructions: Simmer whole chicken in 2 liters of water with turmeric, bruised lemongrass, sliced galangal, and salt for 40 minutes.
Remove chicken, shred the meat, and strain the broth through a fine sieve.
Sauté minced shallots and garlic until golden, then stir into the strained broth.
Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions and divide among serving bowls.
Top noodles with shredded chicken, bean sprouts, and halved hard-boiled eggs.
Ladle the hot turmeric broth over each bowl.
Garnish with celery leaves, fried shallots, and a squeeze of fresh lime juice.

recipes.name: Nasi Uduk
recipes.description: Fragrant coconut rice steamed with pandan and lemongrass, a beloved Jakarta breakfast staple.
instructions: Wash jasmine rice until the water runs clear, then drain well.
Combine rice, coconut milk, and enough water to reach normal rice-cooking level in a pot.
Add knotted pandan leaves, bruised lemongrass, bay leaves, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to lowest setting, cover, and steam for 18 minutes.
Remove from heat and let rest covered for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork, remove aromatics, and serve topped with fried shallots.

recipes.name: Bakso
recipes.description: Indonesian beef meatball soup with springy meatballs in a clear, aromatic broth served with noodles.
instructions: Blend ground beef, minced garlic, egg white, tapioca starch, salt, and white pepper in a food processor until very smooth and paste-like.
Chill the mixture for 15 minutes to firm up.
Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer and form the mixture into golf-ball-sized rounds using wet hands.
Drop meatballs into the simmering water and cook until they float, about 8 minutes.
In a separate pot, heat beef broth and season with salt and white pepper.
Cook rice vermicelli and blanch bok choy separately.
Divide noodles and bok choy among bowls, add meatballs, ladle hot broth over, and garnish with fried shallots and celery leaves.

recipes.name: Rawon
recipes.description: East Javanese black beef soup colored by keluak nuts, producing a rich, earthy, and deeply savory broth.
instructions: Crack keluak nuts open and scoop out the black flesh, then soak in warm water for 30 minutes.
Blend shallots, garlic, turmeric, and keluak flesh into a dark paste.
Sear beef shank cubes in oil until browned on all sides.
Add the spice paste, bruised lemongrass, and sliced galangal, and stir for 2 minutes.
Pour in 2 liters of water, bring to a boil, then simmer on low for 2 hours until beef is tender.
Season with salt and serve over steamed rice with bean sprouts, sliced salted egg, and a squeeze of lime.

recipes.name: Opor Ayam
recipes.description: Javanese chicken braised in a mild, fragrant coconut milk sauce with galangal and lemongrass.
instructions: Grind shallots, garlic, candlenuts, and coriander seeds into a smooth paste.
Sauté the paste in oil until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they turn white on the outside.
Pour in coconut milk, then add bruised lemongrass, sliced galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and bay leaves.
Simmer uncovered on medium-low heat for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add palm sugar and salt to taste.
Serve when the sauce has thickened and the chicken is tender and infused with the aromatics.

recipes.name: Tempeh Goreng
recipes.description: Crispy fried tempeh marinated in garlic and coriander, a staple protein in Indonesian home cooking.
instructions: Slice tempeh into thin rectangular pieces about 5mm thick.
Blend garlic, coriander, turmeric, salt, and water into a thin marinade.
Coat tempeh slices in the marinade and let sit for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a deep pan or wok to 180C.
Fry tempeh slices in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot as a side dish with sambal.

recipes.name: Pecel
recipes.description: Javanese blanched vegetable salad dressed in a spicy peanut and kaffir lime sauce.
instructions: Blanch water spinach, bean sprouts, and cut long beans separately in boiling salted water until just tender.
Drain and arrange the blanched vegetables on a plate with sliced cucumber.
Grind roasted peanuts, chilies, and kaffir lime leaves in a mortar until coarse.
Mix in tamarind paste, palm sugar, salt, and a little warm water to form a thick sauce.
Pour the peanut sauce generously over the arranged vegetables.
Serve at room temperature with steamed rice and fried tempeh on the side.

recipes.name: Tahu Goreng
recipes.description: Deep-fried tofu with a crispy exterior and silky interior, served with sweet soy and chili sauce.
instructions: Cut tofu into triangles or rectangles and pat thoroughly dry with paper towels.
Lightly dust tofu pieces with rice flour and salt.
Heat oil in a wok to 180C and fry tofu until golden brown and crispy, about 4 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Mince garlic and chilies and mix with kecap manis to create the dipping sauce.
Serve fried tofu on a bed of blanched bean sprouts with the dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Bubur Ayam
recipes.description: Indonesian chicken rice porridge topped with shredded chicken, fried shallots, and crunchy crackers.
instructions: Wash rice and add to a pot with chicken broth, sliced ginger, and minced garlic.
Bring to a boil then simmer on low, stirring occasionally, until rice breaks down into a thick porridge, about 35 minutes.
Meanwhile, poach chicken breast in salted water until cooked, then shred finely.
Season porridge with soy sauce and salt to taste.
Ladle porridge into bowls and top with shredded chicken.
Garnish with fried shallots, sliced green onions, celery leaves, and crushed prawn crackers.

recipes.name: Klepon
recipes.description: Pandan-scented glutinous rice balls filled with melted palm sugar and rolled in fresh coconut.
instructions: Blend pandan leaves with water and strain to get green pandan juice.
Mix glutinous rice flour with pandan juice and a pinch of salt to form a smooth, pliable dough.
Chop palm sugar into small pieces for the filling.
Take a small ball of dough, flatten it, place a piece of palm sugar in the center, and seal into a ball.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and drop in the balls; they are done when they float to the surface.
Remove with a slotted spoon and immediately roll in grated coconut mixed with a pinch of salt.
Serve at room temperature; the melted sugar inside will burst when bitten.

recipes.name: Adobo
recipes.description: The quintessential Filipino dish of chicken and pork braised in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and bay leaves.
instructions: Combine chicken thighs and sliced pork belly with soy sauce, vinegar, crushed garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns in a large pot.
Add water and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 35 minutes until the meat is very tender.
Remove the meat from the sauce and pat dry.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the meat pieces until browned and slightly crispy on the edges.
Return the sauce to a simmer, add sugar, and reduce until slightly thickened.
Pour reduced sauce over the fried meat and serve with steamed jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Sinigang
recipes.description: Sour Filipino soup with pork ribs and vegetables simmered in a tamarind-based broth.
instructions: Place pork ribs in a large pot with water and quartered onion, bring to a boil, and skim the scum.
Simmer for 40 minutes until the pork is tender.
Add quartered tomatoes and sliced daikon radish and cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in tamarind paste until dissolved, adjusting sourness to taste.
Add sliced eggplant, string beans cut into 2-inch pieces, and green chilies.
Cook for 5 more minutes, then add water spinach and fish sauce.
Turn off heat as soon as the spinach wilts and serve immediately with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Kare-Kare
recipes.description: Rich Filipino oxtail stew in a velvety peanut sauce with eggplant, banana blossom, and string beans.
instructions: Boil oxtail in water for 2.5 hours until very tender, reserving the broth.
Steep annatto seeds in warm oil to extract the orange color, then strain.
Sauté garlic and onion in annatto oil until softened.
Add 4 cups of reserved oxtail broth, peanut butter, and toasted rice flour, stirring until smooth.
Simmer the sauce until thickened, about 15 minutes.
Add oxtail pieces, sliced eggplant, string beans, and quartered banana blossom.
Cook until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Serve with shrimp paste on the side for dipping and steamed white rice.

recipes.name: Lechon Kawali
recipes.description: Crispy pan-fried pork belly boiled until tender then deep-fried to achieve a crackling golden crust.
instructions: Place whole pork belly slab in a pot with bay leaves, peppercorns, crushed garlic, and salt, cover with water.
Boil for 60 minutes until the pork is tender but not falling apart.
Remove pork from the pot, pat completely dry, and let it air-dry in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Heat oil in a deep pan to 190C for deep frying.
Carefully lower the pork belly into the hot oil and fry until the skin is golden and blistering, about 10 minutes.
Drain on a wire rack, then chop into pieces.
Serve with a dipping sauce of vinegar, soy sauce, and crushed garlic.

recipes.name: Lumpia
recipes.description: Filipino spring rolls filled with savory ground pork and vegetables, fried until golden and shatteringly crispy.
instructions: Sauté minced garlic and diced onion until fragrant, then add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add grated carrots, soy sauce, and black pepper, and cook until vegetables are softened.
Remove from heat, stir in sliced green onions, and let the filling cool completely.
Place a spoonful of filling on each lumpia wrapper, fold in the sides, and roll tightly.
Seal the edge with a dab of water.
Deep-fry lumpia in batches at 180C until golden brown and crispy, about 3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet chili sauce or banana ketchup.

recipes.name: Pancit Canton
recipes.description: Filipino stir-fried egg noodles with chicken, shrimp, and vegetables in a savory soy-oyster sauce.
instructions: Cook canton noodles according to package directions, drain, and toss with a little oil.
Heat oil in a large wok and sauté minced garlic and sliced onion until softened.
Add sliced chicken breast and stir-fry until cooked through.
Add peeled shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes.
Toss in shredded cabbage and julienned carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add the noodles, pour in soy sauce and oyster sauce, and toss everything together over high heat.
Squeeze calamansi over the top and serve hot.

recipes.name: Sisig
recipes.description: Sizzling Kapampangan dish of chopped pig face and ears seasoned with calamansi, chili, and onions on a hot plate.
instructions: Boil pig face and ears in seasoned water for 60 minutes until tender, then drain.
Grill the boiled meat over charcoal until slightly charred on the edges.
Chop the grilled meat and chicken liver finely into small pieces.
Sauté the chopped meat with diced onions, soy sauce, and minced chilies in oil.
Stir in mayonnaise and squeeze calamansi juice over the mixture.
Transfer to a sizzling hot cast-iron plate, crack a raw egg on top, and mix.
Serve immediately while sizzling with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Tinola
recipes.description: Light Filipino chicken soup with ginger, chayote, and moringa leaves in a clean, aromatic broth.
instructions: Sauté sliced ginger, minced garlic, and diced onion in oil until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned on all sides.
Pour in water and bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for 20 minutes.
Add chayote wedges and cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
Season with fish sauce to taste.
Add moringa leaves and turn off the heat immediately so they stay bright green.
Serve hot in bowls with steamed rice on the side.

recipes.name: Bistek Tagalog
recipes.description: Filipino beef steak braised in soy sauce and calamansi juice, topped with caramelized onion rings.
instructions: Slice beef sirloin thinly against the grain.
Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi juice, minced garlic, and black pepper for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and sear the marinated beef slices over high heat for 2 minutes per side, then set aside.
In the same pan, fry thick onion rings until golden and caramelized.
Pour the remaining marinade into the pan and bring to a simmer.
Return the beef to the pan and cook for 3 more minutes in the sauce.
Top with the caramelized onion rings and serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Halo-Halo
recipes.description: Colorful Filipino shaved ice dessert layered with sweet beans, jellies, fruits, leche flan, and ube ice cream.
instructions: In each tall glass, layer sweet red beans, white beans, nata de coco, kaong, and jackfruit strips.
Pack shaved ice on top of the ingredients to fill the glass.
Pour evaporated milk generously over the shaved ice.
Top with a scoop of ube ice cream and a slice of leche flan.
Sprinkle pinipig rice crisps on top.
Serve immediately with a long spoon; mix everything together before eating.

recipes.name: Bibingka
recipes.description: Traditional Filipino rice cake baked in banana leaves, topped with salted eggs and butter, especially popular at Christmas.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190C and line a baking pan with banana leaves.
Whisk eggs and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Add rice flour, baking powder, and coconut milk, mixing until smooth.
Pour the batter into the banana leaf-lined pan.
Bake for 15 minutes, then remove and top with sliced salted egg and brush with melted butter.
Return to the oven and bake for 10 more minutes until golden.
Sprinkle with grated coconut and serve warm.

recipes.name: Ensaymada
recipes.description: Soft, buttery Filipino brioche-style rolls topped with butter, sugar, and grated cheese.
instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm milk with a pinch of sugar and let it bloom for 10 minutes.
Mix flour, sugar, and salt, then add eggs and yeast mixture to form a dough.
Knead in softened butter gradually until the dough is smooth and elastic, about 15 minutes.
Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1.5 hours until doubled.
Divide dough into 12 pieces, roll each into a rope, coil into a spiral, and place in paper molds.
Let rise for 30 minutes, then bake at 180C for 12-15 minutes until golden.
While warm, brush with melted butter, sprinkle with sugar, and top with grated cheddar cheese.

recipes.name: Feijoada
recipes.description: Brazil's national dish of black beans slowly stewed with smoked pork, sausage, and beef, served with rice and farofa.
instructions: Soak black beans overnight in water, and soak carne seca separately, changing the water twice to reduce salt.
In a large heavy pot, sauté chopped bacon, diced onion, and minced garlic until golden.
Add drained beans, all the meats cut into chunks, bay leaves, and a halved orange.
Cover with water and bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered for 2.5 to 3 hours.
Remove some beans, mash them, and stir back into the pot to thicken the broth.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve in deep bowls with white rice, farofa, sauteed collard greens, and orange slices.

recipes.name: Picanha
recipes.description: Brazil's prized top sirloin cap, seasoned simply with coarse salt and grilled over charcoal until perfectly pink inside.
instructions: Cut picanha with the fat cap into thick steaks, following the natural grain of the meat.
Season generously with coarse salt on all sides at least 30 minutes before grilling.
Preheat charcoal grill to high heat.
Grill the steaks fat-side down first for 5 minutes to render the fat.
Flip and cook for 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare, adjusting for desired doneness.
Let rest for 5 minutes, then slice against the grain.
Serve with a squeeze of lime and chimichurri sauce on the side.

recipes.name: Coxinha
recipes.description: Brazilian teardrop-shaped croquettes filled with shredded chicken in a creamy catupiry-style filling, breaded and fried.
instructions: Poach chicken breast, shred finely, then sauté with minced onion, garlic, cream cheese, and chopped parsley to make the filling.
Bring chicken broth and butter to a boil, then add flour all at once and stir vigorously until a smooth dough forms that pulls away from the pot.
Let the dough cool until handleable.
Take a portion of dough, flatten it in your palm, add a spoonful of filling, and shape into a teardrop.
Dip each coxinha in beaten egg, then coat in breadcrumbs.
Deep-fry at 180C until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pao de Queijo
recipes.description: Chewy, cheesy Brazilian bread balls made with tapioca flour and Minas cheese, naturally gluten-free.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200C and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Heat milk, oil, and salt in a saucepan until it just begins to boil.
Pour the hot liquid over tapioca flour and stir until a sticky dough forms.
Let cool slightly, then mix in eggs one at a time and both grated cheeses.
Knead until smooth, then roll into walnut-sized balls.
Place on the baking sheet with space between each ball.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until puffed, golden, and slightly cracked on top.

recipes.name: Moqueca
recipes.description: Bahian fish stew simmered in coconut milk, dende palm oil, tomatoes, and peppers in a traditional clay pot.
instructions: Marinate fish pieces in lime juice, minced garlic, and salt for 20 minutes.
Layer sliced onion, tomatoes, and bell peppers in a heavy clay pot or Dutch oven.
Place the marinated fish on top of the vegetables.
Pour coconut milk over everything and drizzle with dende palm oil.
Cover and cook over medium heat for 25 minutes without stirring, gently shaking the pot occasionally.
The stew is ready when the fish is flaky and the sauce is rich and orange-hued.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with white rice.

recipes.name: Acaraje
recipes.description: Afro-Brazilian street food of black-eyed pea fritters split open and filled with spicy vatapa and caruru.
instructions: Soak black-eyed peas overnight, then rub between your hands to remove the skins.
Blend skinned peas with chopped onion and dried shrimp into a thick, fluffy batter.
Season with salt and beat vigorously with a wooden spoon until light and airy.
Heat dende palm oil in a deep pan to 180C.
Drop large spoonfuls of batter into the oil and fry until deep golden, about 5 minutes.
Split each fritter open and fill with vatapa paste and caruru.
Serve immediately as a hearty street-style snack.

recipes.name: Brigadeiro
recipes.description: Brazil's beloved chocolate truffles made from condensed milk and cocoa, rolled in chocolate sprinkles.
instructions: Combine condensed milk, cocoa powder, butter, and a pinch of salt in a nonstick pan.
Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and pulls away from the pan, about 12 minutes.
Transfer to a buttered plate and let cool to room temperature.
Grease your hands with butter and roll the mixture into small balls.
Roll each ball in chocolate sprinkles to coat evenly.
Place in small paper cups and refrigerate until firm.

recipes.name: Acai Bowl
recipes.description: Thick frozen acai berry smoothie bowl topped with granola, banana, and a drizzle of honey.
instructions: Blend frozen acai pulp with one banana and a splash of water until thick and creamy.
Pour the thick smoothie into bowls.
Top with sliced banana, halved strawberries, and blueberries.
Sprinkle granola and coconut flakes over the fruit.
Drizzle with honey and serve immediately before it melts.

recipes.name: Farofa
recipes.description: Toasted cassava flour mixture with bacon, onions, and herbs, a crunchy Brazilian side dish for meats and beans.
instructions: Fry diced bacon in a skillet until crispy, then remove and reserve the rendered fat.
Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in the bacon fat and butter until golden.
Scramble the eggs into the pan and break into small pieces.
Add cassava flour gradually, stirring constantly to toast it evenly without burning.
Toss in sliced green olives and the crispy bacon.
Toast the mixture for 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until golden and crunchy.
Finish with chopped parsley and salt to taste.

recipes.name: Baiao de Dois
recipes.description: Northeastern Brazilian comfort food of rice and black-eyed peas cooked together with queijo coalho and dried meat.
instructions: Soak black-eyed peas overnight and cook until tender; soak carne seca separately and shred.
Fry diced bacon until crispy, then sauté shredded carne seca in the bacon fat until browned.
Add diced onion, garlic, and green pepper and cook until softened.
Add washed rice and stir to coat in the fat for 2 minutes.
Add cooked black-eyed peas and enough water to cook the rice, about 450ml.
Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Fold in diced queijo coalho and butter, garnish with cilantro, and serve.

recipes.name: Vatapa
recipes.description: Creamy Bahian paste of bread, coconut milk, peanuts, and dried shrimp, a traditional Afro-Brazilian dish.
instructions: Soak stale bread in coconut milk until softened.
Blend dried shrimp, peanuts, cashews, soaked bread, onion, garlic, and ginger into a smooth paste.
Heat dende palm oil in a pot and sauté the blended paste over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Add remaining coconut milk and minced malagueta peppers.
Cook on low heat for 20 minutes, stirring frequently, until thick and creamy.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve as a filling for acaraje or as a side with white rice.

recipes.name: Bolo de Rolo
recipes.description: Delicate Brazilian rolled cake from Pernambuco with paper-thin layers of sponge and guava paste.
instructions: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy, then add eggs one at a time.
Fold in flour and salt gently until just combined.
Melt guava paste with water in a saucepan over low heat until spreadable.
Spread a very thin layer of batter on a lined baking sheet and bake at 200C for 3-4 minutes until just set.
Spread a thin layer of guava paste on the baked sheet and roll tightly.
Repeat the process with remaining batter, wrapping each new layer around the existing roll.
Continue until all batter is used, creating many thin spiral layers.
Let cool completely before slicing to reveal the distinctive spiral pattern.

recipes.name: Ceviche
recipes.description: Peru's iconic dish of fresh sea bass cured in lime juice with aji amarillo, red onion, and cilantro, served with sweet potato.
instructions: Cut sea bass into bite-sized cubes and place in a glass bowl.
Mix lime juice with minced garlic, grated ginger, and aji amarillo paste.
Pour the mixture over the fish and toss gently to coat every piece.
Let it cure for 10-15 minutes; the fish will turn opaque.
Thinly slice red onion into half-moons and add to the ceviche with chopped cilantro and salt.
Boil sweet potato and corn separately until tender.
Serve the ceviche in a shallow bowl with the leche de tigre (curing liquid), alongside sliced sweet potato and corn.

recipes.name: Lomo Saltado
recipes.description: Peruvian-Chinese fusion stir-fry of beef tenderloin with onions, tomatoes, and soy sauce served over french fries and rice.
instructions: Cut beef into thick strips, season with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a very hot wok and sear beef strips in batches until browned but still pink inside, then set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry red onion wedges for 1 minute over high heat.
Add quartered tomatoes, minced garlic, and aji amarillo paste and toss for 1 minute.
Return beef to the wok, add soy sauce and red wine vinegar, and toss for 30 seconds.
Toss in crispy french fries and chopped cilantro, mixing quickly so fries stay crispy.
Serve immediately alongside steamed white rice.

recipes.name: Aji de Gallina
recipes.description: Creamy Peruvian shredded chicken in a mild yellow chili sauce thickened with bread and walnuts.
instructions: Poach chicken breasts in salted water until cooked, then shred finely, reserving the broth.
Soak bread slices in evaporated milk and blend with walnuts into a smooth paste.
Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in oil until golden, then add aji amarillo paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Stir in the bread-walnut paste and a cup of the reserved chicken broth.
Add shredded chicken and grated parmesan, simmer on low for 15 minutes, stirring often.
The sauce should be thick and creamy; adjust consistency with more broth if needed.
Serve over boiled potatoes, garnished with halved hard-boiled eggs and black olives.

recipes.name: Anticuchos
recipes.description: Peruvian grilled beef heart skewers marinated in aji panca, cumin, and vinegar, a beloved street food.
instructions: Clean beef heart, removing fat and sinew, and cut into 2cm cubes.
Mix aji panca paste, vinegar, minced garlic, cumin, oregano, oil, salt, and pepper into a marinade.
Toss the beef heart cubes in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, ideally overnight.
Soak bamboo skewers in water for 30 minutes.
Thread the marinated cubes onto skewers, about 5 pieces per skewer.
Grill over very high heat for 2-3 minutes per side; the heart should be slightly charred outside and medium inside.
Serve with boiled potato and a drizzle of the remaining marinade.

recipes.name: Causa Limena
recipes.description: Elegant Peruvian layered potato terrine filled with seasoned chicken or tuna salad, colored with aji amarillo.
instructions: Boil yellow potatoes until tender, then peel and mash while still warm.
Mix mashed potato with aji amarillo paste, lime juice, vegetable oil, and salt until smooth and vibrant yellow.
Mix drained tuna with mayonnaise and season to taste.
Press half the potato mixture into the bottom of a lined mold or ring.
Layer the tuna salad and sliced avocado on top.
Cover with the remaining potato mixture and press firmly.
Chill for 30 minutes, then unmold and garnish with sliced hard-boiled eggs and black olives.

recipes.name: Papa a la Huancaina
recipes.description: Boiled potatoes blanketed in a creamy, spicy cheese and aji amarillo sauce from the Peruvian highlands.
instructions: Boil potatoes until fork-tender, then peel and slice into thick rounds.
Blend queso fresco, aji amarillo paste, evaporated milk, crackers, garlic, and oil until very smooth and creamy.
Adjust sauce consistency with more milk if too thick; season with salt.
Arrange lettuce leaves on a platter and place potato slices on top.
Pour the huancaina sauce generously over the potatoes.
Garnish with quartered hard-boiled eggs and black olives.

recipes.name: Arroz con Pollo
recipes.description: Peruvian-style green rice with chicken, colored by blended cilantro and beer, studded with peas and carrots.
instructions: Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper, and brown in oil on both sides, then set aside.
Sauté diced onion, garlic, and red bell pepper in the same pot until softened.
Blend cilantro with beer until smooth to create the green liquid.
Add rice to the pot and stir for 1 minute, then add the cilantro-beer blend, chicken broth, and aji amarillo paste.
Nestle the browned chicken thighs into the rice, add diced carrots.
Cover and cook on low heat for 25 minutes until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Add peas in the last 5 minutes, fluff with a fork, and serve.

recipes.name: Pollo a la Brasa
recipes.description: Peruvian rotisserie chicken marinated in soy sauce, cumin, paprika, and beer, roasted until the skin is dark and crispy.
instructions: Blend garlic, soy sauce, beer, cumin, paprika, oregano, pepper, vinegar, oil, and salt into a marinade.
Rub the marinade all over the chicken, including under the skin, and refrigerate overnight.
Preheat oven to 200C and place chicken on a roasting rack over a drip tray.
Roast for 60-75 minutes, basting every 20 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 75C.
The skin should be dark, crispy, and deeply caramelized.
Let rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Serve with french fries, salad, and aji verde sauce.

recipes.name: Picarones
recipes.description: Peruvian pumpkin and sweet potato doughnuts fried into rings and drizzled with warm chancaca fig syrup.
instructions: Boil squash and sweet potato until very soft, then mash until completely smooth.
Dissolve yeast in warm water with anise seeds and let bloom for 10 minutes.
Mix mashed vegetables, yeast mixture, and flour to form a soft, sticky dough.
Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour until doubled.
Make the syrup by simmering chancaca, figs, cinnamon stick, and orange peel in water until thick.
Wet your hands, take a portion of dough, shape it into a ring, and fry in hot oil at 180C until golden.
Drain picarones on paper towels and drizzle generously with warm chancaca syrup.

recipes.name: Suspiro Limeno
recipes.description: Lima's sigh - a silky dulce de leche custard topped with a cloud of port wine meringue.
instructions: Combine condensed milk and evaporated milk in a heavy saucepan and cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, for 20 minutes.
Temper the egg yolks by adding a small amount of the hot milk, then add them to the pot.
